Reviews.Content: It takes great quality pics. Excellent zoom.  It is very comfortable to hold.  I'm still learning to use all its features, but I am extremely happy with it.  The only down side that I can mention right now, is that when using all the zoom, you have to have a very steady hand or use a tripod to take a perfect pic.  and unfortunately, the programs that come in the CD are for mac 10.6 and up, and I have a 10.5.8, so I haven't been able to use them.

Reviews.Title: Third SX for us
Reviews.Author: Charles Hardin
Reviews.Content: I have always thought these were a great family of cameras.  Takes good pictures but more study is required.  Will buy another SX in the future.  We would still have the SX30 except for a rainstorm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50
Reviews.Author: stacey
Reviews.Content: love the sport setting; continuous shots are a must.  Quality of the pictures are great; clear, crisp & so enlarging pics for framing is easy.  Great camera!

Reviews.Title: So far, so good . . .
Reviews.Author: James B. O'Hearn
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer. I simply like taking pictures and storing them on the computer.My previous camera was a Kodak Easyshare about eight years old, so this was a big step up in technology. Maybe most important, the pictures are very high resolution, clear, with excellent color. I haven't had the camera very long, so most of the pictures have been taken on "auto" or the sports setting. They're beautiful. The camera has a 50x zoom, and you need to be well-braced or use a tripod to keep the camera steady. If you do that, you get great pictures over a very long distance. The camera has a huge assortment of settings and features. It takes a lot of time to acquaint yourself with them, and there's no manual. You have to get it on-line and there are too many pages to print. A manual would have been a huge plus.If it's been a long time since you changed cameras, here's something you might keep in mind: I always used my all-in-one printer as the vehicle for getting my SD card read into my computer. It wouldn't do it with my new camera. At first I thought it might be the camera. Then I thought it might be the SD card. Then I read that my OS (XP) might not read the newer type of SD card. I ultimately found that it was the printer that couldn't read it. I put the SD card in an SD card reader and popped it into a USB port and it worked fine.Overall, I really like this camera. It's heavy enough to have some substance without being too heavy to handle. If you're going to use the 50x zoom (and why wouldn't you?) you should invest in a tripod.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Marian Mertens
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are very happy with the camera. The quality of the pictures are very good (even in very dark places). You can take pictures very quickly. The camera has an excellent zoom and very good flash. Yet it is not an SLR. It is a very good camera if you would like to take pictures on vacation, if you want to photograph people, animals and landscape.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Mickey Kroll
Reviews.Content: Did lots of research between this camera and others of same type. Was looking for a long zoom but at the same time for close up and low light. Very happy with this camera and the large choices of options.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Thomas Pojar
Reviews.Content: For the price this is an amazing camera.  The telephoto is something to behold and the IS really works well even on very high power.  It is well designed with comfortable and practical grip areas.  I totally recommend this camera for photographers that are past point and shoot but not really at the pro level.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Pao
Reviews.Content: We had the previous model and after a couple if years if heavy use gave up on us. We decided to get the same one, but was not available anymore therefore we opted for the new model, is 100 times better, faster and unbelievable zoom!  Very happy about it

Reviews.Title: Great value.
Reviews.Author: Donald J. Costello
Reviews.Content: This camera is a terrific compromise for someone who wants a long zoom (50X) in a relatively compact package with lots of features and without the high cost of a SLR model. It does have many buttons and requires careful handling. I used it for a few nature shots and have been very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great choice.
Reviews.Author: GKARMPOUNIS
Reviews.Content: The camera is amazing.the zoom is fantastic.it is very light.has a lot of choices to take beautiful pictures.Must buy for everyone who want a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Craiglow
Reviews.Content: This is just what I wanted.We've had a nice little 1000Elph for many years and it has served us well.I'm looking at the Elph130 to replace it sense the screen has issues and the lack of IS. I wanted a better camera so I tried the Rebel T3 with an extra 55-250 lens but that was too much to deal with.This SX50 has it all.It has some bulk but that lens makes it worth it.I read a review that mentioned shooting the moon with it.I've done it twice now, once tonight ,and it's like looking through a telescope.Just standing in the yard shooting with no tri or monopod ,it does it.If you can get a green box around your subject pull the trigger even if you see shake and the I.S. will give you a clean picture.I'm very pleased with the SX50, and I look forward to trying out everything else it can do.I wish I had It along on St John, but there's always Bora Bora.

Reviews.Title: Amazing...
Reviews.Author: J. Hunter
Reviews.Content: All I can say is, UNREAL! I took a picture of the moon at full, at about 75x Zoom. The 50x Optical zoom is just amazing, and the digital up to about 2x (100x total) is very good. I can see the lines, and craters on the moon in amazing detail. The pictures are stunning, and the video is amazing for the price. My only wishes, are that it would have had the option for "AA" batteries instead. Also, 12.1 is a bit small for MP these days. I wish it was at least 16MP or 18MP. Still... my moon shot was taken on auto settings at 2:30am in the morning, using only camera - no tripod. What i got, was the most detailed picture I have taken. The features of this camera are almost as good as a DSLR, at less than half the price. I have no issues showing this camera off, and the amazing pictures it takes. I highly recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Glad I got it
Reviews.Author: P. Wagner
Reviews.Content: Nice solid feel to the grip. Well made, lots of nice features. Only problem is, the self-timer options can be easily accidentally displayed. This usually happens when you hold the camera with just your right hand - the part of your palm just below the thumb rests right across that part of the function dial.

Reviews.Title: I love it......You will too.
Reviews.Author: Frank L. Sweeney
Reviews.Content: I am at a point in life where lugging around many lenses and other gear is just too much.  The 50X zoom lens suits me perfectly.  I am a pretty good amateur not a fussy pro.  This camera is just perfect for m.  I love it

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing
Reviews.Author: Ahmad
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing for that task. I had looked at the SX30 and the SX40 in the past but for me testing them out at the stores the Autofocus just was not yet fast enough for me to be willing to work with. The SX50 changes that and has a very quick AF system that has already worked for me in a variety of situations for a sub 500 dollar point and shoot class camera I am extremely impressed with the AF system.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot with a super zoom
Reviews.Author: Leo Strick
Reviews.Content: Really like this camera.  The zoom lens has great depth of field and is not the cruel joke many super zooms on the market are nowadays.  With a fast enough SD Card 80mb/s+ full 1080p high def video is possible.  At around 30mb/s 720p is good quality.  Stereo Sound recording is a plus.  Last but not least, it's great to get a point and shoot style camera that is capable of taking RAW format images.  Took this camera to Alaska and got the best eagle pictures of my life with it.  Canon has a winner here!

Reviews.Title: Great camera and at a reasonable price.
Reviews.Author: ANDERSON C COLLIER
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat this camera for the price.  The zoom lense is out of this world, but when you go out to 100 or 200x you better have it on a tripod.  I took zoomed pictures of the moon and that was all you could see.  Like looking through a telescope.  50x and lower and the quality of the shots are crisp and clear.  I have seen pictures taken by cameras that cost $5000 or more and there was not a whole lot of difference in quality.  In some cases this camera takes better pictures than the expensive ones.  It is easy to use and fast.  It automatically will switch between far off or micro shots wish is nice.  I use this camera for personal use (animals, flowers, nature, vacations) and for work (surveillance/investigations) and it is perfect for both without breaking the bank.  The other great item to consider is if you drop it, it breaks, is stolen, etc.---you are not out of a lot a money.  Pick up another and keep going.  By the way the video and sound is impressive too along with the image stabilizer.

Reviews.Title: Yes it met  all my expectations, mostly
Reviews.Author: Emile Abbott MD
Reviews.Content: I could not spend $15,000 for a 600 mm or 800mm lens.  This powershot goes from 24mm to 1200 mm optical zoom for $440 approx.  I found it very light (nice) and even handheld at 1200mm the resolution was fair to good.  On a tripod better of course but I never thought about handholding at that range but it is possible.  The quality at the low range is exceptional and at the long range acceptable although not the fixed lens quality (but at the price I was surprised).  I bought it as a travel camera.  I do a lot of action captures and it just does not auto-focus fast enough for action sports so if this is your vent this is not the camera for that.  The view finder is a bit dark in trying to focus and is slightly better with the live view.  Overall I rate it a 5* for the purpose in which I bought it and found it a great value.  Do get extra batteries and the cable release but forget the other accessories.  Emle

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!!
Reviews.Author: Martha M. Baker "Martha Baker"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband who has been looking for a new camera for months.  This one does everything he wants and is just the right size and weight.  Very easy to use as well - didn't have to read a lot of instructions before we could start taking amazing pictures.  Plus - I ordered it on Sunday night and had it before noon on Wednesday.  Couldn't have asked for better service and shipping and all at a greatly reduced price from others we had been looking at.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality
Reviews.Author: Elvis Nousiainen
Reviews.Content: This camera takes pictures with a high quality without the need to know photography as a professional.Just set auto and shoot to get much better photos than a point-and-shoot camera.Also, I was positively impressed with the video quality and the amazing Image Stabilization! The end result looks like you are using those very expensive Steadicams.I am very happy with the acquisition.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: André Petrini
Reviews.Content: I really loved the camera. Although I'm not a professional, I understand how photography works, and its a huge pleasure to use that zoom and the manual mode. The lens is very good, and it is not heavy at all.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Travel Camera!
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: I am headed to rural Ghana for eight weeks this summer, so I knew I wanted a really great camera to take with me.  I initially perused both Nikon and Canon DSLR's (I have used a Nikon DSLR in the past), but my friend, who is a pro photographer, steered me towards this camera.  She loves her DSLR's, but when she travels, and especially to more remote places like Africa, she uses this camera to take quality photographs.  I have not been disappointed.  It is lightweight, fairly compact (compared to a DSLR!), and boasts incredible functionality and programming capabilities.  The 50X optical zoom is amazing, and has allowed me to capture some truly incredible shots from up close and far away.  I cannot wait to explore more of its features as I embark on my trip to Africa!

Reviews.Title: It is worth
Reviews.Author: Lúcio Aragão Santos
Reviews.Content: The equipment is excellent. Meet my expectations. I recommend. Well worth the money. Pictures taken are sensational. I liked very much.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Steven E. Gruenewald "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I have been looking at cameras for some time. This one is simple to use and takes fantastic pictures. I especially like that I can put in a 32 GB card and never have to worry about running out of space, just click away.The ablility to manually adjust aperature is a huge plus!! I do most photos auto, but the manual option is easy to use. I have had to play around with settings and it didn't take too long to get it right.Using the telephoto lens takes some getting used to, just need some patience.The fully rotating LCD screen makes taking pictures from overhead or below the waist so much easier.I recommend this camera for anyone who wants a camera that is easy to use, takes great pictures and doesn't require an advanced degree to use it.

Reviews.Title: This camera is everything I expected., mostly.
Reviews.Author: Ray Kammer
Reviews.Content: Pros - Great zoom, easy ergonomics, well built, good quality imagesCons - Not quite as good in low light as my Canon G12 was.  I would like to see a faster lens by at least one F Stop.  Otherwise this camera meets all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Priscilla C Ebbs
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Pictures are sharp and clear. Zoom is awesome. Not too heavy.  The only fault I found was when holding the camera to take a picture my thumb keeps hitting the timer.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Santos
Reviews.Content: I'm a amateur photographer and It's perfect for me.Pictures and movies are perfect in my 55' tv.The 50x zoom is incredible.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: R. Horn "zebulonpike"
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything I was hoping for, including an incredible amount of optical zoom, for a very good price.  The photo quality is astounding and the stabilization is great, even at high zoom.  Although I prefer to use a tripod when using the higher levels of zoom I have taken some shots hand held and the stabilization is truly amazing.  I have taken shots of hawks soaring behind my house and some macro shots as well and have been very pleased with the results.  Of course this isn't a DSLR, but for my level of photography this camera meets all my needs without spending a fortune on a high end DSLR and several very pricey lenses.

Reviews.Title: Awesome general purpose camera.
Reviews.Author: Wayne M. Vanweerthuizen
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome general purpose camera, particularly for outdoor use.  The 50x zoom is versatile and fun. This is a very intelligent camera with a high quality image sensor (well, high quality for the sensor size; this sensor is small and fights all the drawbacks that come with small sensors. But the high quality of the sensor compensates somewhat for its small size.) The 50x zoom is best used from a tripod; hand holding the camera, even with image stabilization, it's hard to avoid blur from camera shake when zoomed in that far. But this camera gives me great shots at maximum zoom when I use a tripod and remote trigger. I am also glad this model has a flash hotshoe so I can use an inexpensive Neewer speedlite with it (the speedlite helps significantly with indoor shots, especially when using bounce flash off of ceilings.)  I like that this model allows images to be saved in raw mode.I primarily take my camera with me on bicycle trips, shooting various scenery and items of interest. For that, this camera is the perfect fit for me.  Because this camera doesn't get good battery life, I carry several spare batteries with me when I go on trips. (So far I've been very happy with Opteka NB-10L 1800mAh Ultra High Capacity Li-ion Batteries.)  To protect the lens on this camera, especially when outdoors, I highly recommend a 67mm adapter ring and a 67mm UV protective filter. There are also 58mm adapter rings available for this camera, but I've discovered they cause vignetting (obstruction of the view in the corners of the image) while shooting in maximum wide angle. The 67mm adapter rings don't give me that problem.This is not the best camera for the price if you mostly shot indoors. Indoors, you won't need the 50x zoom very often, which is this camera's primary feature. And superzoom cameras generally don't perform as well as other cameras in the low light conditions one generally finds indoors. Another drawback to this camera's design is the limited range of aperture adjustment for controlling exposure or limiting depth of field.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: daylebread
Reviews.Content: I have owned every version of the powershot series.  I debated a long time before buying this model.  I read many reviews both good and bad.  I bought the camera with the idea that if I did not like it, I would ship it back.  I have not been disappointed.  Of course the zoom is phenomenal.  I like taking pictures of the moon and they are just brilliant.  It focuses much faster than the sx40, the image stabilizer is very effective, works very good in low light and the size and weight is just perfect.  One thing I really like is the rechargeable battery.  The lithium battery is a plus. The sx50 is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Brad Virgil
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife, as my son had stepped on our older digital camera that didn't have a viewfinder. She really wanted a camera that had a viewfinder. I started looked at digital SLR's and I know she wasn't about to start adding extra lenses, etc...This camera has everything she needed.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50
Reviews.Author: LalaH
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love this camera! I also ordered Bryan Peterson's book - Understanding Exposure - great book!!! The stabilization on this camera is fantastic!!  Able to take extreme handheld close ups.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled
Reviews.Author: Uncle Jimbo
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th Canon camera since the days of the film A-1.  I love photographing wildlife and this camera does it all so well.  Last trip out was photographing 14 Desert Bighorn.  With a tripod and the telephoto I got shots where their eye color was visible.  Close-ups like I've never imagined.  Just added a monopod to my gear for those hard to get spur of the moment shots.  Highly recommend this great camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Marcos Elói
Reviews.Content: What an amazing camera. Take impressive pictures. I liked it so much. Focus, zoom, size, everything is very good. I recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: Incredible camera!
Reviews.Author: S. H. Roth "cat lover"
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about this camera, both professional in magazines and non-professional on amazon, before purchasing it.Virtually every one said great things about this camera, its extreme lens, excellentimage and image stabilization, even at maximum focal lengths. And all I can sayis that they were all absolutely correct!I used this camera on a trip to baseball's Spring Training in Florida and was ableto get perfect pictures from the upper stands, all the way across the ballpark.The image stabilizers worked perfectly, even at maximum zoom, with only a small numbershowing movement blur. I have a Lumix ZS9, with a 16x zoom and with image stabilization, Istill average about 10% or less that do not show movement blur. Since the camera wasnew, I used it set mostly on auto and the exposure and color were perfect.  I alsoexperimented with the HDR function and got some really beautiful pictures. I am an advanced amateurtype of photographer, having taken a couple of college courses and in the past I mainly used SLRsand interchangeable lenses. Having a camera this compact, with incredible zoom and excellent photoquality has relegated my other equipment to the back of my closet and to re-sell stores. Whenthe people I was traveling with saw my pictures, they decided to buy the SX50 for their tripto the arctic next year.I LOVE this camera and would recommend it to anyone, amateur or advanced.

Reviews.Title: Best Hand Held 1200 mm Lens ever
Reviews.Author: Vyper
Reviews.Content: Needing a long reach lens for my 50D I happened upon this SX50 for $400.Could this be real? You bet it is. While it is not a 50D it is a super value.I not only use it at 1200mm but through out the entire range from 28 to 1200mmand find acceptable results for the entire range.It is not a multiple frame camera that I would go to first since the viewfinderblanks out after the first frame is fired, but that is why we have the 50D.If you can get your picture with one frame, wait half a second then take anotherthen you are fine with this outfit. However in sports mode you can get a burstof up to 10 frames and still follow the action. I believe focus will be fixed on thefirst frame fired but it works pretty good. I have it for the 1200mm lens and it isawesome. Where else can you get 1200mm for only $400 and get a camera too!Sure contrast is not as good with my 50D but after all it is 1200mm,only weighs in at 20 ounces and while it wont fit in my pocket it is quite small.If you need a camera that has outstanding reach, is light weight, has Image Stabilitythen this is the one. I will use the SX50 along with my 50D and capture birds and animalsthat are out of reach with the 50D. On a long hike it will be nice to only carry the SX50and save 6 lbs by leaving the 50D in the trunk or at home. Canon got it right, of coursethey usually do!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Being a camera "buff" and having an background for technology research, I was researching cameras for a neighbor's wife - it was to be a Christmas gift for her husband.He wasn't a serious photographer but wanted to begin learning some photography techniques.My research  seemed to indicate this camera was really good alternative to a DSLR.- for his efforts.While owning several digital cameras - from a Nikon to Sony ultra slim T series - I was so impressed with this camera's specifications and reviews that I decided to purchase one for my self also.  I love the outstanding photos even at the extended 50x zoom.  Color is great, the details are great.  Great features.  I would recommend this camera to the basic to advanced photographer.

Reviews.Title: Some things are just meant to be! I <3 my Canon!
Reviews.Author: L. Giese
Reviews.Content: I hauled off & bought a Nikon L810 in January 2013. I got the Nikon & was okay happy about it until I used the Video & discovered the blurry + zoom it had. I also noticed that the Shutter Button wasn't "acting right" & all of a sudden, it stopped working altogether. So back in the box it all went, I sent for a Refund & good ol' Amazon was MORE than willing to give me a full refund.The next day it left my home & when I went back to look at other models, I decided I was NOT going to limit myself to a mere $200-250 price tag. I stepped up my budget and BOY am I ever glad I did! I saw this Canon SX50 & went to You Tube, looking at all the Reviews and demonstrations of the camera & it's 50X zoom. I splurged and put this SX50 on my Amazon.com Store Card.Believe me now & hear me later, I looked at EVERY single bridge camera out on the market in the span of a month and the SX50 is THE best deal going....could it have a 16MP on it, sure; but you'll not miss it, the pixs on this camera are just fine.I got the camera yesterday & I am ALREADY thrilled and can't WAIT to get to CA in March and try it out on the Auto Club Speedway!! This zoom is INCREDIBLE, the camera is sturdy, the functions are MANY but almost idiot-proof....I hate having to "study" a manual on anything, but this camera's functions are straight forward and almost make sense the way they are programmed into the camera and set up to guide the owner thru taking pictures or videos. No more dragging the manual out EVERY time you go to take an unusual picture or video,.....the instructions make it pretty safe to bet your pix will be good.If you're curious about the bridge cameras, go to You Tube, you find out ALL you want to know about this little gems.I paid $403 for mine, it's already gone down to $399 and might go down more, I have probably already sold at least 3 of these for Amazon! The filters, hood, adapters, accessories and cases are cheap enough here, or on Ebay...you do not have to be rich to HAVE a good bridge camera. You don't have to be a semi or pro photographer, this camera will walk you thru everything. The CD w/ apps and manual is easy to read and the manual is easy enuff to pull up anytime.I used to take LOTS of photos for my work & personal use with my old Yashica FX-2 & this Canon is the closest thing to my old faithful 35mm I have found yet, unless I wanted to spend the megabucks for a DSLR. Don't hesitate, if you want a good bridge camera and have $400, this is the best one to date. There's only Pros on my Review; I guess if I just HAVE to gripe about something, it would be that you don't get a USB cord in the box.I'm a happy camper, this is gonna be it for awhile, it's all I'll need unless I leave it on the roof of my car someday. ;) JK! Not gonna happen, love this camera.

Reviews.Title: More than I had hoped for.
Reviews.Author: Cawinediva
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for my Panasonic Lumix FZ35, which I loved until recently.  The colors seem to have shifted to dingy from beautiful.  We were taking a trip to Patagonia and I wanted good pics.  And I got them.I have been a SLR person since the 70's, but as I get older and travel more I was done with large cameras and interchangeable lenses.  But long for the end results.  I think I've found a great camera that weighs just 1.5 pounds and has amazing color.I'm past wanting to adjust the aperature and speed. This camera on auto is perfect if you want really good pics with more than a little point and shoot.  I've gotten great raves from my friends on the photos from Patagonia and the Straights of Maggellan.I used mainly the eyepiece viewfinder, the digital display is beautiful on the fold out viewfinder, but a little awkward. I think I probably got better battery life as well by not using it much.  I did use it for awkward angles as it tilts and swivels great.  But again in super bright sun the eyepiece is best.The burst shots allowed me to get some really good pics of dolphins surfacing, and birds in flight, very fast.  Only a few times did I go to the menu to change settings.  These cameras have come so far so fast it's amazing.  It offers way more control than the average person would ever want or need.The 50X lens was so much better than I would have ever imagined.  I bought it from Amazon thinking "if this isn't what I want , it's going back".  It's a keeper.  My only wish is that it was a little lighter, but for what you have it's totally worth lugging around and extra pound and a half.I wish I could be a techincal as some of the other reviews, but again, I'm past that.  I'm going to be toting it around Asia in a few weeks, knowing that I'll come home with greats pics.  I did by an extra battery.  Both fit nicely in my purse while we tour around effortlessly.

Reviews.Title: Wow - what a camera!  Who needs a DSLR!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Z
Reviews.Content: I recently upgraded from the SX30 for the greater zoom, and also bought a T3i DSLR.  I wasn't crazy about the SX30 because of some yellow tint in some photos, which I now realize was probably due to white balance issues.So let's talk about zoom.  I compared the zoom on this little baby to my DSLR with a 100-400 mm DSLR lens with a 2 x extender, about $2,000 worth of lenses.  Well, I found the SX50 actually took a sharper picture, and this is in a very low light environment.I could not be more impressed.  Go Canon!  It makes me wonder why I bothered investing thousands of dollars into my DSLR and associated lenses.

Reviews.Title: What a great camera
Reviews.Author: C Gary Mutz
Reviews.Content: I had the predecessor to this camera and was quite pleased with the quality of the pictures but this camera has greater quality and a lot more features, there are so many it is overwhelming.  The great new enhancement is shutter speed, at the same level as a SLR camera, no picture of children heads.  the camera has very little weight and the view finder is very sharp.  A great camera for a person who likes to take good pictures but does not want the bulk and weight of an SLR.

Reviews.Title: SX-50 HS qualifies for "If I could have only one camera" category.
Reviews.Author: Kermie
Reviews.Content: Great features/price ratio;but, possibly not for the typical novice or first-time camera buyer. Although, it can certainly qualify for a camera that any serious, amateur would not outgrow for a long, long time. Really amazing the shots my wife and I have extracted and saved from the "almost-impossible" category. Only one pan: User Guide seems to be available only on an enclosed CD. Very unhandy for a new user in the field, looking for clarification with some of the more cryptic, albeit useful, feature titles - - - Canon: raise the price a few dollars if you must; and, bring back the diminutive, but powerful, pocket paper-back reference booklet.  I would highly  recommend or buy as an thoughtful gift to a close friend. My issue with the User Guide has no relevance to the excellent quality and powerful features on the camera itself.

Reviews.Title: An imperfect miracle
Reviews.Author: R. Goldberg "Bobbo"
Reviews.Content: Using this camera and its superzoom lens, I grabbed a shot of a great blue heron's face, so close you could see a bit of a feather in his mouth, left over from preening. It's not bad at all for a P&S.; Lots of features, some of them I'll never use, but inventive technology. The viewfinder is grainy and seems delayed. I'll have to get  used to that, as I prefer an optical viewfinder, but how would you link that to a 1200mm lens?? This is really all about the zoom, and for that, it borders on the miraculous. Can't wait for the comets expected to arrive this year (2013). In all, very happy with the choice. No, it'll never rival a DSLR for quality,  but it has a nice look to it, and how good not to have to pay $100,000 for a lens with this kind of reach.BTW - Worth noting that this is a significant upgrade from the SX40, which I tried and loathed. Slow, slow focus and then mostly on the wrong thing. Much improved on this model, though of course it can still hunt a bit at telephoto lengths. Congrats to Canon on a major improvement.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Ernest Anderson Jr.
Reviews.Content: This is a very powerful camera and it will take me a while to learn how to effectively use it. I bought a pistol grip to go with the camera. The pistol grip really helps. I just took some amazing pictures of a full moon. Could not do that with my Canon A720. The camera is well made and I handle it very carefully because I don't want to drop it. The software on CD from Canon is terrible. I have an older version of the software and it works very well. The new version just does not work very well on my older Windows XP computer. Probably need a lot of memory to run the new version. Overall, I am very satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great look and great Pictures!!!
Reviews.Author: Nicole Williams
Reviews.Content: A little heavy and big but otherwise a great camera!! I love the auto shoot, zoom, and LCD screen, and picture quality is almost professional!

Reviews.Title: Great Point And Shoot
Reviews.Author: Christopher Dahms
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera for the money!!!!!  Canon make great camera.  Fast, great zoom, and good pictures.  Not a DSLR, but close

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Tbone
Reviews.Content: this camera is easy to learn, fast, resonable price, and has a ton of features. the macro is amazing and the zoom can shoot the moon on a clear night to the point you see the craters.  very worth the money.

Reviews.Title: 3rd megazoom I've owned...
Reviews.Author: V. M. Krouth
Reviews.Content: I realize that this isn't an SLR - I'm an amateur Mom-tographer and didn't want to bite the bullet for a full-blown SLR.  Besides - a megazoom seems like the right idea for shooting pics of my kids in sports and such.  So - that said - I had a Sony, the plastic button broke on it.  Next, bought a Nikon and the battery would start loosing contact and shutting off.  Tried several trouble-shooting suggested by other users to no avail.  My hubby bought me this one - it is noticeably more sturdy.  Hoping it'll last longer than the other two.  It has so many cool features, it's mind boggling.  Very cool camera.  I'm so excited to use all of it's features (well, the easy ones anyway!)  Shutter speeds are much faster than either of my previous cameras and even in it's point and shoot mode - it is noticeably better.  LOVE it so far - only had it a couple of days, but so far, it's impressed me.  Image stabilization is nice from what I can tell - have to shoot some sports pics from the stands yet to tell you if it'll do a better job than my previous cameras.  From my excursions the last couple of days -I believe it will out-perform.  May add to this review - or re-review later - but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Wai
Reviews.Content: I like the lightweight feel of it, but at the same time, how it gives the feeling of a DSLR without the weight. The features are great. I am still experimenting with the camera features, and trying to figure out what goes where. One function I find missing is the ability of the camera to create panoramic views (or maybe I haven't figured that out yet). The zoom function is amazing! I also like the tracking AF function too. Really useful camera from Canon.

Reviews.Title: An impulse buy that worked out. In spades
Reviews.Author: Ralph Friedman "R."
Reviews.Content: Sharp images across the whole range. From flower macros to shooting pix of the moon hand held. Only complaint I have right now is with Adobe whose Camera Raw doesn't yet recognize the raw format for th sx59hs.

Reviews.Title: WOW! WHAT A ZOOM
Reviews.Author: REDDOG
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera/camcorder, although  the top eyepeice  veiwfinder is not that good of quality & it does not take AA bateries.It mostly seems to be a camcorder with a very powerfull zoom, that can also take pictures. Also it does not seem to go to 24mm's wide. My 28-300 fugifilm finepix S9000 goes wider.

Reviews.Title: Zoom Zoom Zoom
Reviews.Author: Spudman
Reviews.Content: So I had the Canon SX30 and though I liked it sold it to buy the Panasonic FZ150. I also liked the Panasonic but sold it to get the added zoom of the Canon SX50 and the fun settings of miniature and especially fisheye. On a recent vacation I took about a thousand pictures with the new Canon and a new Panasonic SLR.  How did I fare?I like the CanonSX50 quite a bit. The crazy zoom alone is a feature worth having. I've taken pictures of subjects barely visible and zoomed in close up using the camera hand held. I could get the same reach with the Panasonic FZ150 by adding a teleconverter and holding the camera steady on a ledge or with a tripod. With the Canon SX50 I don't need a teleconverter.Picture quality with this Canon is very good, not spectacular, but for a long zoom point and shoot far more than adequate. I took quite a few pictures of alpaca who were lolling about in the shade; the pictures turned out well with good detail and clarity after a little bit of post processing.The menu takes some getting used to. It's not intuitive, so it'll take lots of hands on experimentation to learn. Having had the SX30 previously, I learned to navigate the menu. I much prefer the easier to use menu of the Panasonic FZ150.While on vacation I took some night pictures of the same scenes previously photographed with the FZ150.  The night pictures with the Panasonic turned out better.Comparing the Pansonic FZ150 to the Canon, I can't say that the Canon necessarily takes better pictures than the FZ150, but I love the incredible zoom of the Canon and have a lot of fun with the fish-eye effect.Many neat features are built into the Canon SX50; so many that it takes lots of trial and error to learn how to access and take advantage of them. If you want a long reach and don't want to fool with carrying more than one camera or changing lenses, this may be the camera for you.You can't add filters to the Canon unless you buy a relatively inexpensive converter ring. Then you can screw on 58mm filters to protect the Canon's lens.NOTE - Initially I became very frustrated by not being able to get the flash to work or being able to use the bracketing feature. I was ready to give up and return the camera. Then I got on line and discovered that there's a little plastic cover that slides into the hotshoe. When it's inserted, neither the flash nor the bracketing controls work. Now I know to remove the little cover when I want to use the flash or bracket pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Nicole Bixby
Reviews.Content: I'm a photographer, so I have 3 DSLR's at my disposal.  But there's times I just want to grab and go.  Don't want to be bother with changing my lens, like when I'm at the zoo and want a close up of an animal but then want to take a close up of my kids too.  Generally not possible with the same lens.  This is perfect.  The color and speed are great.  Before I got it, I had recommended it to a friend, then I bought it 3 weeks later.  LOVE IT!  You should buy one too!

Reviews.Title: Great nature shots!
Reviews.Author: S. Webber "Sophie's mom"
Reviews.Content: I'm loving the pictures I get with this camera. The 50X is great for nature shots but with the additional digital zoom you can get up to 200X. Even taking hand held shots of moving birds at 200X they are in focus. I'm still getting to know some of the more advanced capabilities of this camera, but so far I think it's a winner! Do be aware though that in order to download the user manual, you have to buy an extra USB cable (around $18). Also, the rechargeable battery life seems a little short so you will need an extra.

Reviews.Title: "An answer to a poor man's SLR"
Reviews.Author: Paul Milovich
Reviews.Content: After my wife got my camera wet and ruined it taking pictures of my Grandson at the pool, I did a lot of research on camera's for a replacement.  I have always purchased and have had good luck with Canon, so I researched and found the sx50 hs.  It has almost all the features of a high end SLR at 1/4 the price.  And the best part of this camera is it packs a 24-1200mm lens that remains attached to the camera.  Unlike SLR' S that would require multiple lens' to cover these numbers, not to mention the extra expense of each.  After receiving it and taking pictures, I will admit to you that this is one awesome camera.  Probably one of the best investments that I have ever made, and purchasing it from Amazon saved me at least $85.00 over any other store.  So in closing, I would recommend this awesome camera to the point and shooter or an experienced pro.

Reviews.Title: Buttons too sensitive
Reviews.Author: C. Morgan
Reviews.Content: We have an older version of this camera and have loved it.  This one the buttons on the right side of the camera are too touch sensitive and I have repeatly hit the timer button or the REC button when trying to take a regular picture and have missed the picture opportunity.  Sending it back.

Reviews.Title: What the heck is 'low light'
Reviews.Author: Raw Banans
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this camera--but was hesitant to buy it because I heard it didn't do well in 'low light'.  I tried to get an answer as to what 'low light' was but never got an adequate one.  I'm very much an amateur photographer--who has specific needs for zoom, and various lighting--taking photos of dogs in the show ring and in the field.  Finally I bought the camera unsure as to whether I could keep it or not because of the 'low light' factor.  This camera is WONDERFUL in all lighting that I have used it in.  I've taken many photos in dim lighting and they are terrific.  This camera makes me look like a great photographer--because the photos are extraordinary.  I have just begun to know much about it--and have bascially just being doing point and click.  I had an Olympus several years back that was huge--love the photos but the camera was huge.  Then I went to a small Canon PowerShot for the size of the photos and just hated the quality of the photos.  This camera is smaller than my Olympus--really nice looking camera and takes wonderful photos.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Best lightweight telephoto ever!
Reviews.Author: Judy in California
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 50x Wide-Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom I received mine yesterday and immediately started testing the long zoom. I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!! Forget the reviews that say the 50X zoom is too long for a handheld camera. Forget all the people who say the pixel quality erodes at the full length of the telephoto. They must not know how to handle a camera. If you know how to properly stabilize a hand-held camera by making a little tripod with your arms, hands and head (elbows against your chest and forearms touching each other while your also stabilize it against head with your brow touching the eyepiece), the 50X zoom is miraculous! Even the digital zoom is good. I normally never use digital zoom, but I actually took one photo of a Japanese magnolia, hand held, at full optical +digital zoom and it was crystal clear and beautiful when I opened it up full size on my iMac screen. This camera is a nature photographer's or a street photographer's dream come true. It's like being able to take absolutely great photos through a pair of strong binoculars. I have yet to test it's capabilities in low light, but if you're looking for a truly excellent, snatch-and-grab, telephoto camera that can be at close hand on hikes or bike rides, this SX50 will wow you. Never again will I spot a hawk, a moose, or a whale in the near distance and wish I had been carrying my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Best superzoom
Reviews.Author: Patricia G. McKown
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, great image quality. I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a lightweight camera with great zoom capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Every bit as good as we'd hoped
Reviews.Author: William J Benjamin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife for Christmas after looking at just about everything else out there, including DSLRs. It was the only one with a 50X optical zoom, something that will really facilitate her desire to take wildlife shots that she can later paint. We also had very good experience with her previous Canon point and shoot and the user reviews were excellent. We haven't been disappointed. In fact, we're amazed. We took it to the butterfly grove nearby and we could get the same view as the large spotting scopes they set up and take excellent pictures and movies. This thing is awesome and takes astounding photos just in automatic mode. We're learning all the other features which will enhance our picture taking ability. I'm thinking of getting one for myself too to replace my old SLR Nikon and Samsung camcorder. I can't even imagine why one would buy a DSLR and carry all those lenses around and then a camcorder too. This camera pretty much does it all, at least for the serious amateur.

Reviews.Title: Great slow motion and the best zoom
Reviews.Author: Joaquim E.R. Costa
Reviews.Content: I knew about this camera on a trip and I had a look on the internet later to check the specs. Now, after using it a lot I change my opinion about how good I am taking photos (or the camera). It does a good job. The zoom is amazing good and this feature of slow motion with 200 frames per second helps you to discover lots of details that your eyes don't see.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Aviv Siegel
Reviews.Content: And easier to use than SX40 I had before (which broke - my fault). Only issues are 1) controls are placed so some are pressed too many times by mistake, 2) sometimes has difficulties focusing in low light conditions, or on far away landscape. Manual focus is very easy to use with better LCD so not such a big issue. Took for a long road trip and took more than 2000 pictures - very pleased.

Reviews.Title: GREAT pulling power.
Reviews.Author: A. Tay "Private Tay"
Reviews.Content: I have a Lumix FZ200. The lens goes from 25 - 600mm f/2.8 all the way. It's great. BUT today, I tried shooting a kingfisher and even at 600mm, the bird was too small. The bird was on the opposite bank of a wide and deep river.So I tried the SX50. Was worried that at 1200mm f/6.5, the images won't be good. I was wrong. Managed to get good shots of a cat even at ASA 200. The bokeh was super creamy for the 1200mmm cat portrait.One reviewer maintained that when you view shots, the lens will retract. Perhaps I'm fortunate - this hasn't happened to me.Downside? Would be great if the Canon could be like the FZ200 with f/2.8 all the way.Of course in a few months. maybe even sooner, I'll gripe that the 1200mm lens is not long enough.18 Jan 13HA, just as I said - was shooting some birds on the way to work today. It's a small bird that hangs upside down. Have no idea what it is - it's blue and yellow with a long curved beak.ANYWAY, the problem is, the bird flits from tree to tree. And the electronic zoom lever gets annoying. A manual zoom (like what Fuji does) would be good because then if you get in too tight, you just turn the ring the other way. With e zoom levers, the focal length kind of jumps, so either you're too tight or too far.SO it's not just about a longer zoom but a zoom that's easy to control.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 50x Wide-Angle...
Reviews.Author: Joe Kiss
Reviews.Content: This camera was given as a gift and it takes fantastic photos. The clarity and sharpness are unbeliveal. My children who are camera sophisticated were very impressed with the photos.

Reviews.Title: Great Second Camera
Reviews.Author: KnarfOH "KNARFOH"
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon T3i which i consider my first camera.  But like everyone, there are instances where you do not want to carry around a camera bag with the various lenses, add-on flashes, etc.  Plus the zoom is phenomenal and while I do not have much use for 1200mm equivalent lens regularly, the few time I have used it -- it is great.  At the time of purchase - Amazon had the best price and shipping and delivery was timely.

Reviews.Title: Great for Travel
Reviews.Author: Pino
Reviews.Content: Great for travel, easy to carry and easy to use,  great zoom, great photos and video,  Must keep extra spare battery.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: S. Maley
Reviews.Content: A professional photographer recommended this light weight, compact camera. It has lots of features to choose from - including manual settings. The range of the lens is amazing! The zoom is from 24-1200mm! Crazy! This makes a great alternative to your "big camera". I recently heard the Dalai Lama speak in Atlanta. DSLRs were not permitted unless you had a press pass. As a freelance photographer, I was not able to get a pass. I brought this camera instead and was able to get some great shots of His Holiness.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with good IQ.  Noise is Good.  A couple of quirks.
Reviews.Author: Rolla Gravett "Rolla Gravett"
Reviews.Content: This is going to be a quick review of the SX50 HS camera.  I also have the Panasonic FZ200 camera and they compare very favorably in many areas.  I like the image quality of the SX50 camera and the noise is a little better than the FZ200 camera.  I like the big zoom, and it is fairly easy to take very detailed crisp shots at full 50X zoom hand held in daylight conditions.It does have a couple of quirks.  One is at any shot over 1 second, the camera automatically shoots at ISO 80, and a lot of people don't like that.  Another quirk is in Aperture Priority (probably Program as well) the exposure time will not go over 1 second shutter speed no matter how dark the environment is.  If the light and shutter speed are not adequate the camera will take a dark shot.  That makes the camera somewhat hard to use in low light dim shots in Aperture Priority.  I would use Auto in those low light conditions.  In Auto it will just set the ISO higher to get the shot, but with that comes more noise.  In many cases I think it is a good thing to have the ISO real low to keep out the noise in low light shots, but many want the option to use a higher ISO with a longer exposure time.Overall I really like the camera and plan on keeping it. The lens is a little bit slow, but it seems to do fairly well in low light as long as nothing is moving, which is the same as any other bridge camera.  It has a lot of features and takes great pictures!  The price is great too.  Not only does it zoom to 50X, but does so with very crisp sharp photos at that amount of zoom.  The stability system works very well too, allowing hand held shots at max 50X zoom with great results.I have the Panasonic FZ150 and FZ200 cameras in addition to the SX50.  I also have a Nikon D7000 with the Nikon 18-300mm lens, as well as a Sony Nex F3.  I am doing testing with all of these cameras and the results can be seen on page 2 of the comments.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my wife. She is a novice at photography but she wanted a better camera than the little point and shoot one she had. This camera is perfect. It takes great pictures and is very easy to use. Got a cheaper price than costco so no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: Great Travel SuperZoom
Reviews.Author: Jim Matson
Reviews.Content: Overall we love this camera, have been testing it for a week or so.  It seems to be the perfect camera for travel when we don't feel like taking a large camera bag with a DSLR and a few lenses.  The zoom is amazing, as is the image stabilization !  And for all the features included, it is a small and very light package.Two concerns have surfaced, so if anyone can help please reply.(1) can't set an aperture smaller than f/8 in Aperture Priority, would like to do Sunny 16 landscape shots(2) difficult to get a blurry background in Aperture Priority mode even at f/4.5, something we do all the time with a Rebel T3i.

Reviews.Title: very good camera!
Reviews.Author: Walter Oliveira Jr.
Reviews.Content: The pictures have amazing quality, the digital zoom works perfectly during the day, when enought light is provided. Could get pictures from 200 yards and see the face of the person with enought resolution to identify it as a girl or as a boy...

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: Robert Cowlishaw "Mertonian"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product this week! First, I sold my SX40...I will miss it...but I had to have the SX50. I must admit that I now believe this is a perfect camera not just because of the 50x zoom but the raw file capability. It has been fun roaming the house looking for the perfect shot...tomorrow I take it on vacation. I also own the G12! and I have no desire to upgrade to the G15...what happened to the swivel screen?

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality Not So Great
Reviews.Author: Mbowe
Reviews.Content: I mainly bought this camera for it's long zoom feature and was excited to use it to compliment my DSLR. Unfortunately, I can never get a good picture out of this camera. Maybe it's just me since I'm used to seeing my DSLR shots, and this is not a DSLR, but nevertheless the image quality is very disappointing for $400. Don't expect to use the zoom and get good quality pics. The more you zoom in the worst it will get, even for optical zoom. They look like they were taken with an old cell phone camera from 10 years ago. Even zoomed out, most shots are slightly blurry. Out of 30 pictures taken, maybe 2 are worth saving. I do like the small physical size, good build quality and feel of the camera, but the image quality is were it matters most, and for me I was disappointed in this model and will be sticking with my DSLR. If you are considering this I would spend just a little bit more and get a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Don't let the super zoom con you
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I've used various settings on this camera, to no avail.  I either need a tripod to take clear images or I must limit myself to landscape photography, and even those images aren't sharp.  I have owned several earlier versions of this camera and was satisfied.  It's better to revert to a camera with less zoom and MP than to deal with soft, fuzzy images.  A great disappointment.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Karen Ballentine
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  The 50x zoom is amazing.  I took a photo of three baby robins in a nest from across a street in our RV park and my friends were astounded at how clear it was.  The 286 page manual is a bit daunting but I will learn things as I need them.  I have also found some helpful videos online.

Reviews.Title: Suberb birders camera
Reviews.Author: Jimsoar
Reviews.Content: The SX50 HS produces clear photos particularly at maximum zoom, so it is a great camera for bird photography and I have many great photos to prove it!

Reviews.Title: Awesome pictues, Video is just Ok
Reviews.Author: RVNut
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to save having to have both a Quality Camera and Quality HD Video. It does NOT fit the bill.Pictures are Awesome:The camera is awesome for picture quality, flexibility of format and the Zoom is fantastic. Love the 16:9 option, which is great for using in slideshow for panning of landscapes, plus it just looks natural on 16:9 TV. Camera is easy to use, battery life is excellent.NOW for what is just Ok... the Video:Video is crisp and clear but suffers from 24 frame jumpiness (when panning move Slow, or you will hate watching it) This also makes fast action video look jumpy.Bottom line I like the camera and will keep it but will not give up my Canon Vixia HFM300 for AVCHD 29 frame video.

Reviews.Title: Best in class
Reviews.Author: Ars Gratia Artis
Reviews.Content: I was not quite ready to move up to the major leagues of DSLR.  I purchased this camera because it's versatile, has lots of bang for moderate bucks, with a good-enough lens for short and long shots in most shooting situations. All in all, this camera has proven to be a sweet, sweet deal, well suited to my current needs and interest in photography.If you are new to digital photography as I was, the number of features and combinations thereof initially may seem overwhelming.  Expect to invest some time (as in hours) reading the manual, tinkering and testing features. (The manual is only available as a pdf file.)In addition to registering the product at the Canon site, you can download an ImageBrowserEX utility for copying of files from the memory card. The utility also can be used for some basic editing tasks.  You may also want to download and install the Digital Photo Professional application from the Canon web site.  It includes some additional editing functionality, like cropping images, tweaking contrast and saturation.  These two applications have so far proved to be good enough for most of my needs.The many features of the camera have been well covered by other reviews. I would like to remark upon one that has turned out to be quite useful for me: the custom delayed timer.  Most cameras advertise a maximum of 10 seconds delayed time to get into pictures. For more time, you must invest in a delayed timer accessory.Alas, for the peculiar shot angles that I like to take, 10 seconds max is often insufficient.  The Canon PowerShot SX50 HS offers the flexibility to customize the delay to as long as 30 seconds.  In all my research -- including much higher priced models -- I never found another model with such a generous delayed timer.  Not one.Bottom line: I am very pleased with the features and performance of this camera, and I would recommend it to anyone in the market for a camera in its class.

Reviews.Title: Perfect small camera
Reviews.Author: Luvmyfmly
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, I have a Canon 7D that is heavy to carry when I travel. Not just is it lighter to carry, it takes great sports pictures too..

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: GumbyTheCat "Gumby"
Reviews.Content: I won't go in-depth with this review, as more knowledgeable camera aficionados have written more detailed summaries than I possibly could. But I wanted to add my voice to the chorus who are singing this camera's praises in the reviews.I love photography but am not a camera-savvy expert by any means. I like a camera that takes great pictures without me having to know a lot about the technical considerations. The SX50 is the perfect camera for me. I can leave it on auto mode and get great shots in just about any lighting conditions. Of course, the SX50 has a full menu system with which I can control the camera's configurations should I wish - it's an enormously flexible piece of equipment. And as many people here have said, the 50x zoom is spectacular, for the most part taking great shots even when handheld. I recommend a tripod for full zoom though, as well as a remote shutter switch so that the camera won't shake when you press the shutter button at full zoom. Check for my pic of a recent full moon in the submitted pics section for an example of full (optical) zoom, Auto mode, tripod and shutter remote.I know I'm going to get my money's worth out of this camera, and I do highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Zoom, zoom and more zoom!
Reviews.Author: Michael Neuland
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera. The zoom is absolutely amazing! I've become a wildlife photographer! I never knew how many pictures I would be taking now with the ability to zoom so far away. Nice clear and crisp images. You will live this camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: ANONYMOUS
Reviews.Content: Tried Canon PowerShot SX510 model.  It was hard to focus on full zoom.The Canon PowerShot SX50 is easy to use and takes great pictures.  Took pixs of the bloodmoon and surrounding stars that binoculars didn't pick up.

Reviews.Title: Why 3 stars?
Reviews.Author: Fong Kong
Reviews.Content: Pro:Light weightZooms to 50xEasy to useComes with recharger & batteryComes with a lens coverTakes great picturesSize is okayEverything was neatly packedCon:No USB cordCamera material feels a little cheapHave to manually lift the flashTo zoom really far away must have a steady hand or else pic becomes blurry.It might take a few second for the camera to process the shot. Depends on what you are taking a pic of.Overall, I am content with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Canon SX50
Reviews.Author: Linda Go
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome - small but mighty. It takes wonderful pictures in auto and the zoom is amazing. The only other setting I have tried is the sports setting and it takes two photos when you press and release the shutter - a really neat feature to make sure you do not miss the action. This is so much better than your average point and shoot and much less hassle than a SLR. Great bridge camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!! Great price!!
Reviews.Author: mdonauer
Reviews.Content: This camera will last me for as long as I continue to take photos.  Easy and fun to use.  I am still on the upward side of the learning curve, but am confident this camera will not disappoint in the long run.  Good battery life.  Many shooting options in a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Alexander
Reviews.Content: After replacing my old Canon with this one, which I expected to be similar to the SX500, I was amazed at the improvement. Very good zoom, and takes great pics in any light.  Just wish these ( and all) cameras came with instruction books!  Still can't figure out some basic functions, such a how to change pixel size..

Reviews.Title: Shoots raw
Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: This little bridge camera is terrific and shoots raw as well.  One word for you Elements users.  Raw images will not upload into my Elements 10 without a Digital Negative Converter.  Perhaps that is corrected with Elements 12.  The range on the zoom is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: SmartShopper
Reviews.Content: I am a point and shoot photographer!  However, needed a better camera for a double safari - 6 week trip to Africa.  By the time I got the camera, dealt with the recall and received the replacement, I had only a couple of weeks to get acquainted with a whole new camera system.  Intimidated, YES!  Well, I am back from the awesome trip with 2400 pictures and am I impressed with this camera.  It was learn as you go, it was amazing the pictures I took of the animals, birds, plants and people!  The camera performed flawlessly.  I was able to photograph herds of animals on the Ngorongoro Crater floor that looked like dots from the rim!  For the price of this camera, I am so impressed with the pictures and the camera can perform like a point and shoot.  The pictures are amazing and the camera was light enough for me to wear around my neck all day. I did use a good UV lens.  My only disappointment is the low/no light, I wish it had a pre-set for those situations (like a point and shoot).  I missed a few shots of lions on night drives because I was unable to change the aperture/ISO yet.  The long lens on this camera makes it a great camera!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for limited backup use. Very light. Good battery life in storage.
Reviews.Author: Junkbondman
Reviews.Content: decent all purpose light camera, images good to iso 800, images deterioriate beyond this, NOT the equal of a DX format camera but much lighter and smaller, very good stabilization considering long reach. slow auto focus and not very good tracking, slow aquisition between individual shots

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera. Ideal for the amateur photographer
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Catena
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera. Ideal for the amateur photographer who wants to get the best pictures. The zoom is powerful and excellent image quality. Strongly recommended for those who want to take pictures at a near professional levels, without having to learn the theory of photography or spend lots of money on expensive lenses.

Reviews.Title: Cool entry level DSLR
Reviews.Author: Sharoid Blackmon
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty cool camera.  It has a bunch of great features and so far the pictures I've taken have come out really good.  I like the fold out screen, it also tilts but i haven't really used the tilt too much yet.  It's comfortable to hold, pretty quick at snapping pictures and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Range with Light Weight
Reviews.Author: Lanie T "loves a neat lawn"
Reviews.Content: This had what I was looking for - light weight for walking long distances and wide range for shooting things far off.  Have had it several weeks now and am pleased with it.  Has some drawbacks - mainly hard to fix location on birds from a distance before they move again, but overall, I've gotten some quite decent shots.  Already own 2 DSRL's but they are heavy!  Would buy it again - and for the price it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS
Reviews.Author: Gypsy Travler "Gypsy_Lady"
Reviews.Content: I've owned a variety of top of the line SLR's. I took a Canon SX20IS to Europe with me 4 years ago, shot over 6000 pics and hours of video without out a misfire (on the camera's part) and have since passed it down to the next lucky owner.  This camera does all I need without having to carry extra lenses, etc. Slightly lighter than the SX20, it still has the feel of a "real" camera, and most important, it too has a view finder. As I shoot 90% of my photos through the view finder, and under certain lighting conditions, the view finder is an absolute necessity. The mobile flip screen makes it possible to get those really creative and otherwise impossible shots. The photo quality is superb.  I shoot on high resolution and I've blown these pictures up to 20x30 with unbelievable clarity.  You can get 1200 pics on an 8 gb SD card with room to spare. This is a great camera for the above average amateur who wants to travel light.  I did purchase the spare battery pack, to be sure of my power source. A small case of basic filters rounds out the purchase and you're good to go.  My one concern was the power source.  The SX20 used AA's, which is std world wide. But the battery in the SX50 seems to last a long time, so I feel comfortable with it  now. Looking forward to many happy hours of use from this camera. There are numerouse adjustments which you can get creative with. Great little camera!

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: ginnyd
Reviews.Content: .amazing zoom  Bought camera for traveling.  It was analyzed by my photo club and they were very impressed.  Can't wait to learn about all its fitures.

Reviews.Title: Very nice cam!
Reviews.Author: Sandra Cássia Spinosa
Reviews.Content: I liked so much! The zoom is extraordinaire. No noises. Just need attention in one point: the manual function has some settings fixed, so you can't change some :(If you want to use manual, buy a dslr. For travels, and risk to learn, sx50 is a very good camera!

Reviews.Title: SX50 is great
Reviews.Author: Billie J. Higgins
Reviews.Content: Has been a wonderful camera.  I can take photos in low light and they are good.  My bird photos are wonderful.  This is my 5th Canon and I believe in Canon.

Reviews.Title: Huge zoom, but fits in my pocket
Reviews.Author: kieren gaul
Reviews.Content: Does just what we need - huge zoom but doesn't take up the space that a DSL camera with lens for a similar zoom would take.  Takes great photos, and does video.

Reviews.Title: Great features & photos, but major design flaw
Reviews.Author: M. Elrod
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research before purchasing this camera and figured it would be my last for awhile, but...First for the good stuff:  It takes beautiful photos, including in low light with no need for flash.  There is no noticeable recovery time between photos; I've never found myself having to wait on the camera to reset in order take a picture.  The image stabilization is amazing; I took some photos while riding in a cart on a bumpy street - most came out unbelievably clear and focused.  Flash throws a good distance when needed.I usually shoot through the viewfinder, but I LOVE the articulated LED screen!  It allows me to take photos from a lower level without having to kneel.  I can be discreet when taking candid shots, as I am looking down at the screen, not directly toward my subject.  On a recent tour, I was able to lift the camera over the heads of other tourists and perfectly frame the shots I wanted.  It's idea for macro photography, plus the LED screen is protected when it is closed.It's the design of the grip that keeps me from giving this camera 4 stars.  I don't know how many times I, or someone I asked to take a photo of me, set off the self-timer or activated one of the menu items.  While this is not a heavy camera as compared to a DSLR, it is not as light as many other point-and-shoot cameras.  It requires a firm grip, but you must be careful where you grab it.  The normal "SLR grip," if you know what I'm getting at, places the heel of your thumb directly over some of the controls.  This is annoying, esp when a shot presents itself only briefly; the delay involved in resetting the camera after the self timer - or some other function - kicks in has cost me multiple photo opportunities.As with many cameras now, it comes with no user manual; you must download and print it out.  I am still exploring features as I attempt to broaden my skills.  It offers many of the features available on high-end DSLR's without the need for purchasing expensive lenses, so is a good camera to learn on b4 investing in a more expensive camera.I would recommend you buy at least one extra battery if you plan on taking a lot of shots in a day, as when you are traveling.  I generally run through 2 batteries a day, but I do take a lot of photos.  For the everyday photography, one would probably be enough, but it's nice not to have to worry about it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice; Amazing Zoom
Reviews.Author: commonsense....
Reviews.Content: A 50x Zoom lens allows you to take a picture of a duck's eyeball. Just be sure you use a tripod, because at that magnification, you can't hold your hand steady enough.

Reviews.Title: Great for point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Russ "Russ"
Reviews.Content: This camera has amazed me with the quality shots it takes. I have had several DSLR's both Canon and Nikon and this camera actually competes in photo quality.  Though I haven't been able to try all the features yet the pictures I have taken have been very sharp and able to be cropped quite a bit with little if any deterioration. I mainly got this camera for the zoom ability as most of my shooting involves birds and wildlife and this amount of zoom with a DSLR would cost thousands. I can't wait to get out and test this camera to the fullest but mother nature is stopping me right now. Bottom line...Canon rules both in DSLR and point and shoots period and Amazon rules with pricing and shipping.

Reviews.Title: recall with this model before using it
Reviews.Author: imagine 1016
Reviews.Content: It was my first Amazon purchase. I have not even taken the camera out of the box, and I have already been notified of a dangerous problem with this model camera. I have to send it to the manufacturer to have the eye piece replaced. It would be easier if I could just have another camera sent to me.

Reviews.Title: Great moon shots
Reviews.Author: Linda Scharck
Reviews.Content: Amazing zoom lens.  I can get fabulous photos of the moon, hand held showing every crater.  Light weight, and no extra lenses to haul around in case you need them.  This camera does it all and produces very sharp images.

Reviews.Title: Superb camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely well made. The versatility is amazing and it will take me quite a bit of time to explore all the features.  I bought it for the 50x lens. I want to take outdoor shots for the most part, however, I have used it indoors and am  surprised at the quality of the shots.  Learn how to handle this camera because the controls are very sensitive. You wouldn't want to miss a shot because your finger slightly touched one of the controls. Stick with it and I am sure you will find it fulfills many if not all of your photographic needs.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera in Many Respects!!
Reviews.Author: Horace G. Shipp
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this camera for the purpose and within the restraints with which I purchased it.  I wanted the 1200mm focal length.  It is a very long focal length camera that performs wonderfully in bright daylight.  As the light wanes, so should the expectations for this camera.  Of course, it should not be expected to perform as a camera that is f2.8 across the entire focal range of the lens.  This camera is a very  reasonably priced camera for its focal length capabilities.  I have really enjoyed my experiences and results with it so far, and I expect to continue to be happy with it.  I also have a Nikon D300 and lenses as well as a Canon G11.  The Canon SX50 HS has applications and capabilities that neither of my other two cameras can touch.  It is a good value with very satisfactory results when used primarily within its design purposes.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Mats
Reviews.Content: Having recently switched to "point and shoot" cameras from standard slr cameras, I am amazed at the clarity of this camera.  The telephoto aspect is phenomenal as is the overall ease of handling.  I have tried others brands of this type of camera.  The Canon SX50 is in a class of it's own.  I would (and have) highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA FOR OUTDOOR SCENES
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: My wife had a SX20 and with the excellent performance of that model we went with the SX50. Zoom is fantastic and pictures have all turned out really well.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: Susie Q
Reviews.Content: I am loving my Canon PowerShot SX50 HS Digital Camera! Still learning the dos and don'ts. It takes beautiful pictures even when you are just learning! I was blown away with the optical zoom. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone that wants such a smart camera that won't empty your wallet!! Very pleased with my choice!!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Cozy-D
Reviews.Content: have been a canon user for 20+ years.  this version replaced an earlier powershot.  cannot say enough about this device.  substantial  improvements made.  very thoughtful design.  the flip screen is absolutely a must.  very very pleased.  highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the serious and beginning photographers alike!!!
Reviews.Author: Bob Belcher
Reviews.Content: I purchased the SX50 for an upcoming game viewing trip to southern Africa.  This camera exceeded my expectations for a wide variety of outdoor conditions (sunny, cloudy, low light, etc.).  The 50X zoom is amazing and enables photographers to reach out and precisely frame their subjects with minimal effort.  The automatic image stabilization function enables the capture of high quality images throughout the zoom range in most lighting conditions.  I found that the "Smart Auto" mode performed as well or better than any of the manual modes.  The Auto mode enabled me to concentrate my attention on composing images of nerverous wildlife rather than missing key shots due to having to manually adjust settings for varying lighting conditions.  EXCELLENT VALUE for photographers at all experience levels!!!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Cielo
Reviews.Content: Got it because it has a thru the viewfinder feature.  Use the flip out often when i hold the camera high to get 'over the crowd' shots.  Also love the sport 5 shot burst.  Highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Newbie
Reviews.Author: Dennis Smolinski
Reviews.Content: I have always used simple point and shoot cameras.  My last vacation I was extremely disappointed with my current point and shoot. Mainly because of the inability to take a decent night shots and even with 10x zoom the animals were just too far away.After months of research I bought this camera.In the beginning I was not able to take decent pictures with it and started to think I bought the wrong camera.  After a little googling I realized hey I am a newbie and know nothing about cameras!  As long as your willing to learn a little about photography this camera is a really good pick.  At 50x zoom it still take very clear pictures.  I am really impressed with the quality of the images now that I have more of a grasp on how to use the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: coachman
Reviews.Content: I'm a rookie to photography. I debated on on the latest Lumix superzoom vs. the SX50 for months but pulled the trigger on the SX50. The camera is incredibly easy to operate in any mode and i'm just touching the surface of what you can do with this thing. I like the fact i don't have to carry around different lenses and all that mess either. Do yourself a favor and get a tripod while your ordering. When you zoom this baby in all the way it will be a little jumpy, the tripod takes care of that.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Diane Oberlander
Reviews.Content: I have always had Nikons but wanted a bridge camera.  This one fit the bill.  Many differences in operating the camera from Nikon to Canon.  My biggest complaint about the camera is that you need to grip the camera on the right side.  All the controls are on the right side. Therefore I am constantly hitting something.  That is the reason for 4 stars instead of 5. The lens on the camera is fantastic. Also wish the flash would have a dedicated pop up button, instead you have to manually open the flash

Reviews.Title: Great long zoom, excellent quality photos
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Parrish
Reviews.Content: Really good camera for a reasonable price. If your looking for a long zoom, which takes excellent quality pictures.This is good for bird,& nature photography.

Reviews.Title: Canon Sx50 hs
Reviews.Author: whitehawk
Reviews.Content: Love this camera,it met all my expectations.It was user friendly and  easy to set up and program.It takes great photo's

Reviews.Title: Got it for $318.. Best impulse purchase ever
Reviews.Author: Justin B
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for $318 on Thanksgiving. Best decision ever. I haven't had much time to use it but I did go for walk around my town a take pics. The pics are superb. I didn't mess with any settings and I got beautiful pics of wildlife. The zoom is wonderful. Even when zoomed in the pics are super clear. I am traveling to Europe and I wanted a good camera to take with me and I feel this is the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: Canon sx50
Reviews.Author: Randall Guinn
Reviews.Content: This is a really great camera, and the price was the best I could find.  So far I can't find anything to complain about, and the delivery was fast.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choise!
Reviews.Author: Zsolt Simon
Reviews.Content: Perfect camera for not professionals. Easy to handle, beautiful pictures. The 50x zoom is just amazing. Love taking pictures with it.

Reviews.Title: Worth trying.
Reviews.Author: Stan in MA
Reviews.Content: This camera is a nice combination of simplicity and function.  The zoom is amazing and the image clarity is impressive.  It is easy to operate yet has capabilities that should satisfy most amateur photographers.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, easy to use.
Reviews.Author: zone
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and simple to use the basic functions.  Not as heavy for this type of quality camera, which is nice since you can take pictures with one hand if needed.

Reviews.Title: Great bridge camera!
Reviews.Author: tjmadison
Reviews.Content: I have two dslr but bought the SX50 as a grab and go camera and as a camera for times when I don't want to carry all of the dslr stuff.  Also the great tele zoom gives a range that would be extremely costly in a dslr lens.  I find the SX50 take great pictures-far better than the Nikon Coolpix 500/510 both of which I returned.  My one warning is that you cannot be sloppy with your technique and need to learn to hold the camera steady even with its image stabilization.
