As most camera companies do today, the manual comes on a disc and can be obtained as a pdf download, however, an email to Canon customer service got a one time only hard copy!  Its large-too large for a typical camera bag-but it is one that those of us that like old fashioned hard copies can use in the comfort of our easy chairs!

Reviews.Title: Much better than the Nikon 520
Reviews.Author: Rodney J Shimabukuro
Reviews.Content: The camera focus is much faster than the Nikon 520 I had purchased just a month before I returned it and bought the Canon.  I wasn't sure that the Canon would be much faster than the Nikon, but I was leaving on a family vacation very soon so I figured it would be a good test.  I was thrilled with the camera on the trip, it focused fast so I got some good shots of my 1 year old granddaughter running around and on the rides at Disneyland.  It also worked well in low light at the park.  My one wish is that the lens was faster, would have been nice to have a 1.8 aperture for portrait shots.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Nella Kilmartin
Reviews.Content: I have only had the camera a few weeks but most of the photos I have taken are beautiful and I am so pleased with the amazing detail. I still am learning how to select the best setting for each shot. I am enjoying playing with the straight forward controls.and I look forward to many great shots on my upcoming cruises.

Reviews.Title: Great for the average person. Clear pictures and lots of features.
Reviews.Author: Christopher P Jensen
Reviews.Content: The camera is awesome for a novice like me. I would imagine the DLRs are better but this one works great for the average person. Awesome zoom, large display, simple dials.I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: its my camera.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "an amazon  regular"
Reviews.Content: I had a Nikon p510 for 8 months. then I saw this one in one of my visits to amazon. I also looked at the comparisons on an internet site. I bought it and since then I hardly touch the Nikon camera. it works faster, has a better and bigger battery. the zoom is better. plus the cap pushes out the camera with the lens, not like on the Nikon. in my opinion this one is better than the Nikon p510.

Reviews.Title: keeper
Reviews.Author: J. Lesher
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera's versatility.  Get to know the different modes as they are quite useful.  I've been using for a couple months now, and have not yet mastered the manual modes, but suffice it to say you can achieve excellent pictures in diverse shooting conditions.  I would recommend this for someone who doesn't care to learn to use an SLR but wants much of the functionality.  The auto mode is fantastic for almost every kind of shot.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Ann Chittum
Reviews.Content: Pretty easy to learn how to use this camera and it takes awesome pics.  It really needs a steady surface for extreme zoom, but the quality is great.  Takes excellent wildlife photos and moving shots.  Also good for indoor photos (I use it to photograph my work as a kitchen and bath designer).  Just remember, the flash is not automatic--you must pull up the flash if you need it.  The rechargeable battery lasts much longer than my old Canon and charges quickly.  Couldn't be happier with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Shoot the moon!
Reviews.Author: C. York
Reviews.Content: Within the first week you own this camera you will take a picture of the moon. You'll show your friend and tell them you took the picture with your camera, handheld, with no tripod, and you'll all be staring in disbelief. At least one of your friends will buy the camera as a result.Superzoom - that's what this camera is all about. It's a high end point and shoot for people who do not quite want an SLR. I have use this to shoot high school football and I can capture up-close shots of the action from high in the stands. The lens is slow for night shooting at games, but the high ISO is very good and the image stabilization helps a bunch. Picture under stadium lights of the team in the huddle are perfect and sharp, action pictures are hit and miss. It exceeds my expectations for this price and technology. Keep in mind a HS football game is not as well lit as a professional stadium, so this is a pretty difficult shooting environment.I will also use it to shoot auto racing and wildlife where the zoom will be utilized and it will generally be daylight, so I expect excellent results.I've been using the Canon S1,3,5 line of cameras for many years and I like the image quality and controls of Canon cameras. I took this upgrade for the zoom, but I also like that the high ISO shooting is greatly improved over my S5.

Reviews.Title: I really love this camera
Reviews.Author: Roberta Marshall
Reviews.Content: I have been taking photos for a long time, always using advanced compact fixed lens cameras, I bought this one to upgrade to a camera with a few more capabilities. I have only had it a couple of weeks and so far I am very pleased. The camera is light weight so I don't get tired carrying it around. I can move the LCD in any direction I don't bother with the viewfinder at all, though I like the idea that there is one. It shoots RAW as well a JPEG so I have a choice. The 50X zoom allows me to zoom in and recompose without moving the tripod. I've already purchased an adapter ring, a polarizing filter and some diopters. I missed the capability to use filters on my last camera.  My Grandson plays soccer and I plan to do moving images of his games. The more I use the camera the more I like it.

Reviews.Title: WHAT A TOY!
Reviews.Author: Lynn Laseman "OL HASBEEN"
Reviews.Content: It seems to do everything it's supposed to do. I had some doubts about how good a 50x zoom could be; buit the thing works just fine. Is it the sharpest long lens on the planet? No, but but it's great for the price. So far it looks like anything up to 8.5 x 11 will look great. And if I want to go 16 x20 there's always PerfectResize 7. Very pleased with the SX 50. When my expensive lens runs out at 200mm it's real nice to reach back in the bag, grab the SX 50 and know nothing is going to get away. No problems, it just plain works.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: GG
Reviews.Content: Initially, I was having trouble getting used to the controls on this camera, especially when doing manual focus, but over time, and with some practice, the controls are workable. It just takes some getting used to. What's great about this camera is the zoom and the ability to capture images in RAW format. This allows you to take some really incredible photos you would have no way of getting otherwise. Of course, when you are shooting with the zoom all the way out, you might notice some loss of resolution, but overall, the sky is literally the limit with this camera. I also like its relative size and weight compared to a full-sized DSLR. I would take this camera anywhere I didn't want to lug my regular DSLR and would feel quite confident of being able to get some great images. It is a good camera with amazing telephoto possibilities.

Reviews.Title: Works for me
Reviews.Author: Sandra Stencil
Reviews.Content: Brand new user.  So far, am very happy with it.  Meets my simple needs.  Beautiful pics.  Easy to use.  Lightweight, but not flimsy.

Reviews.Title: I get great pictures
Reviews.Author: Robert R Hardman
Reviews.Content: the telephoto lens give me a real advantage forf nature pictures.  I have owned many cameras , and this is the best ever.  It is alittle bulky, but pays off.

Reviews.Title: Excellent clarity
Reviews.Author: Ashraf Ali Shaik
Reviews.Content: Super ultra zooooom. The best of all point shoot cameras. Multiple modes to be researched yet. Some who do not want to go to slr.. Choose this

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Jim Kious
Reviews.Content: Love this camera...the quality of the photos and the zoom capabilites are fantastic.Great camera for the person that loves photography.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos
Reviews.Author: JRPenza620 "JRPenza620"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend who doesn't have much photography background other than her $100 point and shoot. The photos come out clear as can be, and the zoom on this camera still amazes me. A great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Carla A Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I love it!  I can shoot my sons football games from the stands!  Great zoom!  Clear pics!  Easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: John Mors
Reviews.Content: This camera is simply amazing and by far the best camera that I have ever owned.I am even taking photos of birds in trees, which was not the intended purpose.Takes virtually no learning.Only issue is that some times hard to set focus on a small item in a larger view as a mind of its own, but I just need to learn how to do it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!
Reviews.Author: Tink
Reviews.Content: After having this camera a couple weeks now went back and deleted my original review. I originally only gave it 3 stars. When I first got this camera I was so disappointed in it. I thought it was all hype. Out of the box the shots I was getting were not of the caliber I was expecting.I didn't see them as good as my SX-40. and at over 500 MM were not that great. I had considered sending it back. Over the next 10 days it seemed to be a bit better. In talking to my brother in-law he said he had encountered the same thing and was advised to buy a class 10 SD card. I did and I can not believe the difference..My shots are clear and great image quality even up to the 1200 max. Either I had a less that stellar SD card or this camera works best on class 6 or 10 SD cards.I live near the Smoky Mountains and the fall colors I am taking are coming out clear and beautiful. I am so pleased with this camera. Folks if you are experiencing what I was try another SD card before sending it back...just might make all the difference...

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot sx50 digital camera
Reviews.Author: pata
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is so easy to use- point and shoot. Always takes good pictures. It is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera , Not the first one
Reviews.Author: omid
Reviews.Content: I ordered SX50 and after I got that it had a problem with lens retracting, when I tried to zoom on or off something there was a noise like it the camera needs to be lubricated, I sent it back and get a replacement.This one works great without any issues,the zoom is great and the 24mm makes the camera very easy to get a wide view photos.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy but not a perfect product, just close.
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Viewfinder is not great, and I wish the FULL instructions came printed out with the product and not just on a disk. The quick start guide is there and that is OK.Quality product, battery strength is just OK. Looking forward to everything it can do, and I have managed to take some very nice photo's from a good long distance.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Laurie A. Dankovchik
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my son's 20th birthday.  He has a photography class in college.  This camera is amazing ~ he loves it!! I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Bought as a gift
Reviews.Author: Shane Gunderson
Reviews.Content: No problems after gifting this to my father-in-law who takes too many pictures.  He absolutely loves it and can't fault it all.  He has told me that the battery doesn't seem to last as long as he thought but nevertheless loves it.

Reviews.Title: Completely satisfied!
Reviews.Author: ET
Reviews.Content: Just returned from vacation and needed a powerful zoom to capture the shots I wanted.  Camera performed great; no problems at all with image stability.  Colors were vibrant.  Very satisfied with this Canon!

Reviews.Title: Amazing zoom
Reviews.Author: Craig Coleman
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for a trip to Costa Rica.  Could not be happier with its performance.  We got some incredible wildlife pictures that would not have been possible with a lessor camera.  When using the zoom at full length a tripod is almost a necessity however to prevent blurring.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera ~zoom
Reviews.Author: L. feeney
Reviews.Content: What a great camera .....first vacation with it..and I was so please with all of the pictures, mostly of people, but also the landscape of Ireland....amazing zoom...high quality zoom...great price point!

Reviews.Title: zoom is great
Reviews.Author: P. Powell
Reviews.Content: know that the camera wll no fit in yur pocket.really love the zoom.  have not noticed any blurred pictures when usng the zoom.  really sharp pictures.quality is above expections

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SX50 HS 12 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: P. G. Crose
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the quality and features of this camera. It is very versatile and takes very good pictures for a point and shoot camera. The only objection I have found so far is that the view finder does not feel very comfortable and clear to me.There are many features to this camera and I have not taken the time to explore many of them. It is much more versatile than most point and shoot cameras and therefor requires more effort to explore them all if you want to use all of features available.I bought this camera for my wife because she was not happy with the quality of some of the pictures she was taking with a smaller sized camera. I saw some pictures taken by a friend with this model and was amazed at the quality of pictures that were taken.I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a camera that will take high quality pictures that does not require the size and expense of SLR cameras and lenses.

Reviews.Title: Real close to being the perfect camera
Reviews.Author: darrell miller
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect camera, very good in all respects.  over the years i have bought like ten cameras from the point and shoot tho the SLR, and this one is about as good as it gets.Highly recommended, there are no dislikes for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: rosa kilgore
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty easy to use and takes great photos! The quality of my pictures is greatly improved. Love my new camera!

Reviews.Title: I couldn't be more happy
Reviews.Author: MCK
Reviews.Content: This was a present to myself and I couldn't be more happy with it. It's a great camera with features for a novice or for the more experienced. It's a great introductory camera if you're looking to learn more about setting a shot and not just using the Auto button.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for someone upgrading from a basic point & shoot version
Reviews.Author: Ganapathy Viswanathan
Reviews.Content: Like:Picture quality, functionality, ease of operationUnlike:Operation manual & illustrations need improvements & detailing,packaging (accessories bundled with camera instead of purchasing separately)

Reviews.Title: A Marvelous Camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Edwards "GuitarPlaya2000"
Reviews.Content: If you're a novice or close to being expert photographer, this camera will come mighty close to or meet the " pro" model cameras. The feel, material and workmanship is of good quality, and the controls are ergonomically placed around the camera. The only problem I have with the camera is the Function/Set button is at a place where my thumb is always inadvertantly changing the ISO, exposure or other settings. I had to continually remind myself to remember to keep my thumb away from that area.  Otherwise, the camera is a gem. I like to use to use the camera to capture images of animals and to document family events. Whatever the scene, the result is always a perfect photo with sharp images, and deep colors. I submitted my photos to an online photo service that'll convert your images into a book form and I couldn't believe how beautiful my photos where. I am no way a pro photographer, but 'dang-gum' my pictures looked great! Furthermore, there is an option to use the camera either in manual mode or auto for even more control. I've had this camera since February and I am really enjoying it. I can't remember the last time I had so much fun with photography, now. I'm glad I purchase the PowerShot SX50HS.

Reviews.Title: My second Canon Powershot camera
Reviews.Author: C Bear "biker"
Reviews.Content: I had used the Canon Powershot SX40 before deciding the extra zoom on the SX50 would be nice for birding. Some of the buttons had been moved but overall the usage was the same. A pixal rating above 12mp would have been better but the RAW pictures are awesome. I had always shot using JPEG until giving it a try with the SX50. Why did I wait so long? Detail, color and clarity is far beyond the JPEG photos. Software to work with the RAW images comes with the camera. I recommend using RAW for your best photos. Get a high capacity card and you won't have to worry about running out of storage space.The software will convert the RAW image to TIFF to use with Photoshop. The included software allows some capability to work with the photo but not as Photoshop or Photoshop Elements so this is a nice choice to have.The SX40 produced good photos and the SX50 does as well. Powerup is very fast. Color is very good and there are many options for different situations in lighting and environment to help get the best shot. I'm very happy with this camera for the class it is in. You can get better but the alternative is much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Suzette "To bring Him glory"
Reviews.Content: The zoom on this camera is one of its best features. Also, the quality of the pictures are amazing, even when zooming in from long distances; the colors are very vibrant as well. I like the fold out screen; makes it easy when video taping.I would definitely recommend this to a friend. Great camera, great price!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Review 1234
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of internet research to find a good quality camera.  I have friends with camera's with very large & heavy lenses that need to be put on and removed.  I really like the zoom functionality of this camera.  I also takes pictures well in low light.It does not have the sensor size or some of the functions of a more expensive DSLR.  But, for my purposes it is great.  Used on July 4th and got some really nice fireworks shots.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Sue Stathopulos
Reviews.Content: This replaced  a 4yr old Samsung digital. I started out on full auto, and I was very impressed with the zoom and overall picture quality. I have used the flash several times and those shots are well lit, good color and no red eye. The face recognition and AF work great. Now getting beyond full auto and controls are easy to use. Very satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot for the price.
Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: I checked out a few different cameras and kept coming back to the SX50. The pictures are clear and crisp unlike the Olympus it is replacing. The zoom on it is awesome. I took some pictures of the half moon a couple weeks ago with no tripod, just the camera resting on the rail of my deck. Zoomed in and wow! I work with a guy that has an expensive SLR and is a great photographer that told me ha has never been able to get a picture of the moon that was as clear as the one from the SX50.

Reviews.Title: A real winner
Reviews.Author: Phil Gates
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific camera that provides wonderful flexibility and excellent, clear and sharp photos.  It has amazing image stabilization to complement its powerful zoom capability.  I recommend it heartily.  Two things to be aware of: 1) the lens cap has a propensity to pop off and is easy enough to forget to replace anyway, so getting a UV filter has been useful for me as a way to protect the lens itself; and (2) it's also easy to forget to turn the LCD screen around when putting it away so I recommend a screen cover for it.

Reviews.Title: My New Camera
Reviews.Author: Teena W
Reviews.Content: It's a little heavier than my previous Canon, but it's easy to use and takes great pictures.  I take it everywhere I go.

Reviews.Title: Great product for family use
Reviews.Author: Usman
Reviews.Content: Great zoom, build quaity and excellent for family use. Noise is better than many competitiors. 12mp is good enough to deliver printable results.

Reviews.Title: After several days of field testing, I am impressed with many of the capabilities of this camera. The 50 x zoom really delivers.
Reviews.Author: Frank N. Hawkins
Reviews.Content: After several days of field testing, I am impressed with many of the capabilities of this camera. The 50 x zoom really delivers. The pictures are acceptably sharp for a 12.1 megapixel camera and the color is excellent. There is an amazing range of features and controls useful to advanced photographers able and willing to venture beyond the green auto exposure button. My main complaint about the camera is disappointing 2.8" LCD, which is noticeably smaller and less handy than the 3" tiltable LCD on the Nikon Coolpix P510. There also are occasional struggles with the automatic focus. The Coolpix P510 is only 42x, but its 16.1 megapixels seem to produce sharper images. There can be moments with the Nikon when the automatic focus also is balky. Both cameras do acceptably well in low light. Anyhow, the more you use either of these cameras, the happier you are likely to be with them.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: phowa7
Reviews.Content: More than I expected for the price! Picture quality is exceptional. Easy to use, even for a beginner. Definitely a 5 star camera.

Reviews.Title: Effing brilliant camera.
Reviews.Author: Myke Duncan "clanduncan"
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to go over the minutiae of how this thing works, except to say it is effing brilliant. Changed up from the Kodak Max Z990 (with the same size and tech of sensor = 12M CMOS), and there is no comparison. The pictures are so much sharper, focus is easier to acquire, and shot to shot speed is just superb. Particular favourites are the 'stitch-assist' feature, the multi-shot feature, the HDR feature, and the HD movies where the zoom is totally silent.If you are in America (as I was recently) then you can get this on Amazon dotcom for just £245 (@$360) equivalent. That's one hell of a saving on the UK price of £360+ (where Canon seems to think one dollar equals one pound). Even though the misers at Canon won't give it a worldwide warranty, and Squaretrade at the moment are backing that up, it was worth it. The savings alone will let me get accessories like lens hoods, extra batteries, and still be on the up.There are various comments online about battery life being poor compared to the SX40HS. However, I actually found in real world use, that I went back to using the EVF as if it was an SLR like old times. This will save battery life, and I had no problems at all with using the camera all day, in a mix of situations, pictures, videos, zooming etc, and I only recharged it every 3-4 days as a precaution.Get one, immediately, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Don-WWF
Reviews.Content: The 50x zoom and auto focus are amazing.  HD video is really good.  I love it!!!  It fires up almost instantly.

Reviews.Title: Can't get it back from my daughter
Reviews.Author: BJS81
Reviews.Content: It was supposed to be my new camera, but once my 15 y/o daughter got ahold of it I have not been able to get it back. She asked to borrow it for a photography class. She has learned how to use it for all kinds of shots (low light, stop motion, moon shots, etc.). It takes great photos. She was even able to sell a few of them.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: I haven't learned all the ins and outs of this camera yet, but I am very impressed with the photos I have taken so far. I look forward to practicing and becoming more adept at working with it. I love the way it zooms in to see objects far away!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX50 review
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: My wife & I love the camera. We have yet to fully utilize all the functions, but we love the results so far.

Reviews.Title: SX50 great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Shorty
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat familar with Canon Cameras since I owed a couple of them.  For first timers it may be a little complicated to operate.  Does so many things difficult to remember it all.  But overall this camera is amazing and does what it is advertised to do.

Reviews.Title: Good for beginners
Reviews.Author: Jorge
Reviews.Content: I'm just starting in the photography world and I gotta say this camera is excellent, good specifications for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality!! Why people buy DSLR???
Reviews.Author: Nahian Khan
Reviews.Content: Photography is my hobby. Actually I'm at the beginner stage. I was looking for a dslr. My primary target was canon t3i or nikon  d3100. But before buying I just did a market research and I found this one. It is made in Japan, so no doubt about the longevity. I was little bit worried about the photo quality, but after takings some snaps, I felt happy because I made the right choice. This camera is really good for wild life photography. It has 50x optical zoom. (215mm) Maximum ISO level 6400. Overall, It is really a great deal! I would highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: works as I read it would
Reviews.Author: J. D. Lohr
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it much. Taking my time and reading up on it. We had the largest full Moon that's been seen for years. I went out, after dark, and zoomed in on it. The Moon filled the screen. I took several pictures and they were  really  sharp. Amazing, I was just holding it in my hands.Also it's the first camera I've had that works fine in the "auto" setting. Colors, sharpness, contrast, etc.are almost perfect. Putting it on "P" didn't improve the picture.

Reviews.Title: It's a learning curve for beginners but the pics are amazing
Reviews.Author: B. Stromeyer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have had a couple of weeks to play with it and actually also got a book on digital photography to get a better handle on all the lingo and functions on the camera. It's a bit overwhelming and I have barely scratched the surface but the pics that I have taken are incredible. It gets a bit frustrating at times as I accidentally hit/change something and then don't know how I got there but that's not the camera's fault, more my novice experience. I have taken some amazing night shots of the moon (handheld), very impressive.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Results - So Many Modes, So Little Time
Reviews.Author: Thom
Reviews.Content: Excellent pictures, and that's what you want in a camera.  This has more than a dozen modes, and I'm still exploring them.  Auto is a good fall back, and give good results.  Low light performance is also excellent.  Quickly shifts from SLR viewfinder to flip screen.  Zoom is huge.  And I bought a spare battery so I wouldn't be disappointed by running out of power and missing that great picture - only necessary for a long day of taking many, many pictures - but why chance it?

Reviews.Title: Zoom, zoom, zoom
Reviews.Author: Tom McLaughlin
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Some quick-action options. The video is decent, though the camera itself can be loud during filming.This is the third or fourth Canon PowerShot I've owned or used. It's by far the most fun to use with this zoom lens.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom
Reviews.Author: pshead
Reviews.Content: Takes really good pictures and videos. Have taken several videos with it and when I transferred them to dvd and watched on tv the picture and sound was really good. In door pictures are a little more challenging but can be done quite well. Very happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Cathyraew
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, easy to use and navigate with various options and functions! It takes good pictures and not extremely expensive. I love Canon!

Reviews.Title: awesome camera!!
Reviews.Author: Dusan Nedeljkovic "dootzky"
Reviews.Content: i love this camera. I know Canon has high standards, but I was amazed how good this camera looks, feels, and WORK.photos are awesome.very easy to use.would recommend.

Reviews.Title: it's a great cammera
Reviews.Author: Luis Pillajo
Reviews.Content: it's a great cammera, 50x zoom is useful, a memory card from 16 GB or more is recommended because of pictures size

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: A. Holton
Reviews.Content: Recently bought my wife a Canon DSLR for her birthday.  She has  been carrying her camera when we go on scooter rides and taking pictures whenever we stop.  I've been bitten by the photography bug watching her.  I wanted something that was easy to use, as well as easy to carry (no extra lenses to lug around).  Read the reviews here on Amazon and watched many videos on Youtube about this camera.  I am really enjoying the SX50 and have taken some pretty cool pictures.  The zoom capabilities are awesome!  My wife and I are enjoying the quality time together.

Reviews.Title: Meets my expetations
Reviews.Author: Leonard H Stump
Reviews.Content: So far I am satisfied with the quality of the pictures I have taken. The menu is different from what I was used to working with but in time it will be easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Extremely pleased
Reviews.Author: C. Gonz
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon PowerShot SX50 HS to use on a recent trip to Namibia.  I was extremely pleased with the photos I took with my camera since I am not an experienced photographer.  I did make some mistakes with taking pictures in very strong sunlight.  They turned out a bit washed out but this was due to my lack of expertise.  However, overall most of my pictures are way above what I expected.  I was taking pictures through vehicle windows and of birds/animals at great distances.  The stabilizer was excellent and I did not use a camera support at all.  I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Cannon camera
Reviews.Author: Darrel
Reviews.Content: This camera was recommended to me from a fellow worker that takes a lot of pictures daily and I am well pleased.

Reviews.Title: about the sx50
Reviews.Author: ag
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best camera made,and about the iso, there is no limit,you don't need a flash even in the dark, just turn up the iso, why do some people say that there is a limit of 200 on the iso, you can't do it in auto,look for night mode in scn setting,The iso on the sx50 will go all the way to 6400.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: amazoncrazy
Reviews.Content: everything a-ok so far. no hot shoe cover in the box though. wish the flash popped up on its own but that's not a major deal. just got the 32gb extreme sdhc card today so we will see how videos turn out as well. Lots of features, incredible zoom. will update more after taking newborn pics and seeing how that goes.***update*** the case logic DCB-304 case works but it is a tight fit. I managed my charger, card reader, extra battery, mini flexi tripod and camera in the case but it is snug getting in and out and that is all that would fit. For my needs I would go with something a tad bigger but I will make do for now.-videos look great even when zoomed, just need to try watching them on my tv to see how they turn out.

Reviews.Title: Almost a perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Erwin Francisco Ruiz
Reviews.Content: It has all you can desire from a camera of its price and level.  The RAW format is now supported and that is a must in this type of products.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Byron J. Huebschen "byron"
Reviews.Content: This camera not only  has a super zoom lens, but is fast, smooth, and has so many additional features for creative editing, shooting in Raw mode, and the ability to add the remote shutter trigger.  Also, does well in the design dept as far as ease of handling and moving through menu options.  In comparison to Nikon,  Canon's menu options far exceed Nikon's confusing and limited scene modes.

Reviews.Title: cannot shoot inside basketball shots
Reviews.Author: Mark Peebles
Reviews.Content: Great camera but only 3 stars as I needed to take action shots of my son playing basketball.  The lens can't handle it.  Going with the FZ200 which has  a much faster lens.  Alternative is the heavyweight DSLR cameras but I still want the mega zoom.

Reviews.Title: Rocks My Socks!
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  I have been using Canon cameras since I was 18 years old (I'm 44 now). My main camera is my Canon 7D but I have hardly picked it up since getting the Canon Powershot SX50 HS for my birthday in March (2013). The color is spot-on and the zoom is amazing.The only con about the camera that I've found is that the photos aren't so great in low light. I knew that was an issue but it's not really an issue for me because I know to use another camera if the light is less than ideal. I've added a few photos that I've taken with the camera. I highly recommend the camera, maybe not so much for a beginner (unless you don't mind studying on all the features - it's totally worth it), but if you have even a little bit of knowledge about what settings to use when you're shooting then this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Canon Sx50hs
Reviews.Author: Usborne Book Consultant "Lamoureux"
Reviews.Content: Amazing zoom.  Love the fact that you can record HD video, Zoom and the camera will continue to auto focus the entire time.  I have used other cameras that would not focus properly when zooming in and out.  Also the auto focus is super fast.  Love this camera.  Still learning to use all the features on this camera.  But love it so far.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom
Reviews.Author: F. Hankins
Reviews.Content: Zoom is great and video is super, am able too shoot birds a long ways and the 1080 video is fantastic

Reviews.Title: It's great, but
Reviews.Author: jim Van Ness
Reviews.Content: If you are a black rapid strap user, you'll have to unscrew the strap to get to the batteres and memory card. The plastic body does not have a sturdy feel to it that the sx 10 had. If you have filters for the sx 10 to 40 they will not fit the 50. The 50 times optical works great; This a great high end point and shoot for the person who wants to shoot wildlife, but doesn't or can't go the expense of a DSL.

Reviews.Title: Amazingly versatile!
Reviews.Author: ppcbob
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It gives you the ability to take shots of anything from macro shots to photos of things that are so far away no one else could consider trying to photograph them. In bright sunlight you can use the view finder and compose your photos that would be difficult with only the LCD screen.  It is a terrific camera, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera.
Reviews.Author: bkat
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by the telephoto zoom. The camera is light and simple to use. The pop out screen is a good addition and the manual lifting of the flash prevents the camera from automatically pop it up. Highly recommend this camera for beginners.

Reviews.Title: Really good camera
Reviews.Author: BridgeImages
Reviews.Content: I had the Canon S1 (I think) 5 mp camera which I liked a lot.  I admit that this camera produces better images and has more bells and  whistles that I can imagine.  The sensor must be greatly improved over the last few years as I get much better images at higher iso's.The stability control is also rather impressive.I didn't need the camera.  I was impulsive to buy it.  Not my smartest financial decision.  I am so glad that I did.  For me it is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Power Shot SX 50
Reviews.Author: grubsam
Reviews.Content: The reason I bought this was to have a viewfinder. I take pictures outdoors and sometimes its difficult to make out what you are really taking a picture. This camera met my needs and does way more.

Reviews.Title: Capable mega-mega-zoom
Reviews.Author: One Happy Retiree
Reviews.Content: With an optical zoom of 50X, the possibilities for extreme telephoto images is very much in hand, and the anti-shake mechanism works well. This camera has so many options that the printed owners manual runs to 258 pages! It functions well as a point-and-shoot on auto, but the full range of options for control of any feature is very much available. I personally love the fact that it will date and time stamp images if one wants, solving the "when did I take this image?" problem, though many may not see that as a problem. I don't use the video features of any camera, so I can't offer an opinion there. It does burst images, best image select, panorama stitching and just about any other feature one could want. I don't find the controls particularly intuitive; a proud owner will need to spend some serious time with the owners manual to really take advantage of many of the features.The printed images are glorious, crisp, well saturated and capable, if one wanted, of 24" x 36" poster size images with no loss of resolution. Extreme cropping also is possible without loss of visible resolution. The camera comes with a lens cap, a strap, one battery and a CD with the owners manual. Nothing else is available; spare batteries can be found at any good battery store; the proprietary batteries seem to be hard to find but others seem to work well.In summary this is an extremely capable camera, but a complex one with only mildly intuitive controls. Time with the owners manual will lower the learning curve. I think at the moment this 50X super zoom may be the winner in the SZ wars; more importantly, the camera does deliver superb images including those shot at very-long-telephoto ranges. The LCD in the back is large and swivels out at any angle one likes; this makes shots in close quarters much more fun. As background, I'm in a large category of photographers usually called advanced amateurs; pros would probably prefer far more expensive SLRs and casual photographers will be well served by much simpler compact cameras, which offer amazing resolution and imagery these days. For those "in the middle" who like super-zooms, this is a winner.

Reviews.Title: Much Faster
Reviews.Author: N. Barabas
Reviews.Content: Much faster than previous Canon's of this series.  I do note the artificial limitation of ISO on long exposures.  That is really about the only thing not to like about it.  Maybe if enough of us complain to Canon about it they will change their minds?

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Wayne C. Alderman "Wayne C Alderman"
Reviews.Content: I can take super clear photos and videos and the zoom is awesome 50x optical 200x digital, 200x it does blur out but thats ok I can still take pictures just by guessing, I even take pictures at night time with the flash, I been taking pictures of the planes from the Sun N' Fun Fly-in even though they are like 3 miles high I think it is, I still take pictures and when I zoom in I can read the writing on the planes, also I took a photo of a christmas chimney thats in my neighbors front yard I was like half a block away and you could read what was on the chimney oh yeah I even took a picture of a bird sitting on my fence from the same place I couldn't see the bird with my own eyes I was far away

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot for travel.
Reviews.Author: Narciso Cruz
Reviews.Content: I love this camera because of its mega zoom. If you have to travel abroad this is the camera to bring instead of bringing your SLR.Also bring a spare battery and Flash just in case you shoot indoors .. not good for sport activites though.

Reviews.Title: Very good!
Reviews.Author: Maria Villafane
Reviews.Content: I read pretty much all the reviews on this camera before buying. I like to take photos, that's it. My expectations with this camera are first to learn a bit more about photography and start using the manual settings, to have a massive zoom without spending a lot of money and to be able to just point and shoot if that's what I really want to do. My previous camera is the Lumix FZ-50. A fantastic camera that still holds up pretty well next to this one, at least for what I want to accomplish. I have to agree that shooting at full zoom the picture gets blurry, it's not that big a deal tho, on a tripod or just using your body to keep the camera steady you can get a decent shot. The controls feel fancy and easy to use compared to my other camera and yes, there's a lot to learn, but if you're used to cameras like this it can't be all that difficult. Image quality so far is great. For someone who doesn't know a lot about photography, that's just beginning to learn more and that wants to be able to point and shoot as well and still get great looking shots this is the camera. The zoom is incredible and making videos while walking is super smooth. I feel my dollars were well spent on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Skylar
Reviews.Content: I got this about a month ago and am still working on figuring out all the options on it.  I'm very impressed and have only had to do post processing once or twice to correct the white balance, and that was due to taking pictures of a snow-covered mountain on the high end of the zoom.

Reviews.Title: The Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12.1 MP - Great Camera if you can understand what all the settings are
Reviews.Author: Silent Think Time "Karen Stryker"
Reviews.Content: This Canon PowerShot takes awesome distant pictures, but it will take me years to understand what all the settings are.

Reviews.Title: Bridge-camera compromise.
Reviews.Author: Chef E
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera as a perfect camera, for travel. If you appreciate, and can utilize, the many advantages this camera offers, it is a perfect combination/compromise between a good point-and-shoot and a high-end DSLR. It can give great results in full AUTO mode, but, has even more to offer, if you wish to fine-tune its performance. I like the fact that Canon doesn't make you pay for accessories you may already own. I spent less than $500 for the camera and all the added accessories I desired.  (My second choice was the Nikon P510. Its features paled, in comparison.)

Reviews.Title: The best one yet!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ed D. Walker
Reviews.Content: I love taking pictures of scenery, wildlife and my travels.  I started out with SLR cameras and switched over to point and shoot with the SX10.  I gave that away when I bought the SX20, sold that to buy the SX30 and now have that as a spare while having fun with the SX50.  Each camera sets a new standard with ease of use, power of the zoom and quality of the pictures.  I can take pictures of the craters on the moon, which just amazes everyone who sees them.  Sunsets are amazing.  Zooming in on birds at the top of a tree and seeing all the details in their feathers is just unbelievable.  Best of all, it is all in one and so easy to carry around. No more camera bags full of different lenses.  This camera does it all, and it does it so good that I haven't met anybody with a DSLR that can do what I do with this camera.  Pros will disagree, but if you are not using it to make a living, you won't find an easier camera to use that does what this one does.The battery lasts all day, but I still want a second with me when I travel just because it makes me feel better that I don't have to worry about it dying on me.  I also went with a 32 gig card so I never have to worry about filling it up or keeping track of a card once it's full.

Reviews.Title: beautiful
Reviews.Author: Homer
Reviews.Content: We brought this on a safari in East Africa and were glad we did.  It took excellent telephoto shots without blurring thanks to the anti-vibration feature.  This is a very sophisticated and complex instrument that we are still learning how to use.  You can, however, start using it at once in the auto mode with great success.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: James1916
Reviews.Content: I really like this Camera! Great value. It does just about everything an armature photographer could ask for, and the 50X zoom is incredible. It even has a manual focus option, which is cumbersome, but it works. The optical image stabilization is remarkable as well allowing me to take crystal clear pictures, even zoomed way in. This camera takes beautiful HD movies as well. No need for a separate movie camera anymore. It can capture movies up to 29 minutes in length, but you will need a large Class 10 SD card. The biggest downside I’ve found is that it stores its movies as “MOV” files, not “MP4”. Even a 2 or 3 minute movie can be several Gigabytes in size, plus, not just anything will play back a “MOV” file, especially files with this much data in them. You will need some good software capable of compressing the movies way down before sharing and uploading to the internet. This camera's strong point is taking pictures, of course, and it does that very well.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pictures!!!
Reviews.Author: Carlos A. Castillo
Reviews.Content: I am not a photo expert but this was a huge jump from my previous cammera...very nice pictures, in the easy/auto mode, great videos in HD, easy to find controls, spectacular zoom!!! incredible... I love my new cammera...Pictures are so well that it made me feel like I am a professional photographer !!!  :-)

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Glen Harriman
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and the nice changes made compared to the SX 40 IS I have.  I've only had it a little over a week and although we're stuck indoors because of Winter weather, I've been able to take a number of long distance pics and love the way they look.  the 1080P video is also very good.

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing!!
Reviews.Author: Honey Dew
Reviews.Content: I got this camera mainly because of the zoom capabilities.  When I got it, I started taking pictures just to see what the zoom really is.  I started off taking pictures of the trees around my neighborhood.  I was amazed, even at the 200x digital zoom, I was taking pictures freehand.  With one tree, it is about 120 feet tall and 150 feet from where I was standing.  I got some shots of the branches at the top that were so clear and close that you could see there were leaf buds on them and they looked like they were right in front of my face and there was no blur.  Then I took some pictures of a mountain that is about 25 or so miles away.  I was completely blown away by the zoom and the detail that this camera brings out.  There are some cell towers on top of it, and you can see them plain as day kind of like you are about a mile away from them.  Then I got one of the side of the same mountain and you can actually see trees, the outlines of all of them, etc.  All the pictures I took are set on auto.  The antishake mechanism works like you wouldn't believe also.  Like I said I am completely amazed with this camera, it was definitely a wise purchase.  My wife and I are going on an Alaskan cruise next year, and I am really excited to be taking this camera with us!!!!

Reviews.Title: You will not regret buying this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Gail Hebert
Reviews.Content: Best All-In-One camera I have ever owned.  I live on a ranch and need zoom for many wildlife photos and this camera does not disappoint!!  Have not tried the macro or other features, I do know the photos I have taken are sharp which is of upmost importance to me.  And recovery time after each photo is so much better than others I have owned.  I am very pleased with this purchase!!

Reviews.Title: big zoom
Reviews.Author: Michael  Evans
Reviews.Content: My primary camera is a T2i and a wide range Tamron lens. Bought the sx50 for it's huge zoom. It takes a while to get used to the 1200mm equiv. holding steady without a tripod is a challenge. We have a lot of wintering bald eagles here, I've gotten great shots of the birds in trees. Flying birds/moving objects I haven't perfected yet as I'm used to the faster focus and shoot of a DSLR. It took a month before I wasn't changing settings because of accidentally grabbing the buttons. I missed several good shots because I activated the self-timer inadvertently! Other than those accidents the small size is big plus for walking around with. Image quality at lower ISO is great, I can shoot in RAW, battery life is above what I'd expected. Image stabilization is excellent and it's got loads of advanced features (that I won't ever get to)

Reviews.Title: Bob in Albany
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Nelson
Reviews.Content: When you are taking a river cruise in Europe for thousands, don't wimp out on the camera.  Thesis is a great camera for all kinds of shots.  The zoom is a feature that made all the difference for landscape shots and castles.

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera for me. (i'm graphic designer) recommended / La cámara perfecta para mi. (soy diseñador gráfico) recomendada
Reviews.Author: Ysmael Guzman A
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX50 HS is a awesome camera, firstly by its amazing optical zoom of 50X, price, image quality, controls position and others, recommended (by be a bridge camera) for amateurs, in my case graphic designer.La Canon SX50 HS es una cámara impresionante, principalmente por su increíble zoom óptico de 50X, precio, calidad de imagen, posición de los controles, entre otros, recomendada (por ser una cámara bridge) para aficionados, en mi caso diseñador gráfico.

Reviews.Title: CANON SX50 HS.EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: PAUL
Reviews.Content: The SX 30 that I bought about a year ago was lost due to " @#@@^* "..on my part. It performed well especially in low light situations. This SX50 HS is even better. When I hold it steady enough, even with the long lens it performs I suspect equally with DSLR's ? There is in fact a comparison on the Internet of a Point and Shoot and a DSLR and they are hard to decipher which is which.I shoot for the effect of an image not the technical excellence so there isn't much reason to say how good it is technically. From all the tests it has it's limitation but so does a 5 pound 10 inch by 10 inch SDLR or an 11 x 14 View camera. It compliments my attempts to be a Creative Photographer. In low light, long shots, animal photography scenic back lit and on and on. I am very pleased with it and would recommend it to anyone.There are a few things that I believe could be an improvement, which I have already made. The various buttons are to smooth and difficult to find when you in a hurry so I have put a dot of "Goop" on each so that I can feel them in the dark. It works very well.The rubber used on the viewfinder Eye pice is too hard so I will be replacing that with some High-density foam and possibly an Eyecup.It's easy to use quickly once you become accustom to it. I wear it around my neck pretty much all the time and have take some fairly good photos because it's there and because as I become more familiar it can be used more effectively for those quick shots. I will be submitting some photos to someone to give my example of the type that it can take.Once again I would recommend it to all people even the people who believe they need an expensive DSKR to shoot good photos. Remember it's the photographer not the camera that makes great pictures.X X X X X X X X X X X X

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT SX50HS-A GREAT UZ CAMERA
Reviews.Author: g.k. downs "the doktor"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my damaged OLYMPUS SP590UZ which was a pretty good camera but this is light years beyond the OLYMPUS. I didn't notice until it was too late to do anything about it but the tripod socket on the OLYMPUS was PLASTIC! & broke out in a relatively minor fall ( $130 to repair ) & still plastic! Without a tripod it was very difficult to get clean uz shots with that camera. When the SX50HS became available I had already done some research & decided on a Canon as a replacement. So far I've only used the AUTO setting & found the image stabilization & tracking systems so superior to what I had that I've used it more without the tripod than with. The only faults I've found are the diopter is a bit stiff & difficult to fine tune & the Canon battery drains faster than the Photive backup I bought for it. If you're considering this camera there is an adapter ( $8.00 ) you'll need to attach filters, hoods etc. My setup has one w/uv filter & standard hood which I expect will break off ( the adapter ) without damage to the camera & only the replacement cost of the adapter in the event of an accident. This is a fantatastic camera & with the quality of the shots I'm getting ( mostly birding )I can't justify the price of a DSLR. Also, the software suite that comes with it is so good & easy to use that most of the time I use it rather than the Corel Photo program I have. good shootingP.S. CANON DOES NOT PROVIDE USB TO MINI CABLE FOR THIS CAMERA. YOU'LL NEED ONE TO TRANSFER YOUR SHOTZ TO YOUR PC

Reviews.Title: Absolutely great
Reviews.Author: Jerold P. Interlicchia
Reviews.Content: I used to have a rebel 5.0 MP camera years ago and that awesome. This SX50 is so close to clarity its scary what I had paid for the rebel and this SX50. The zoom is truly out of this world and I couldn't of zoomed in on anything with my Rebel without a lens costing much more than the camera itself. I'm not a professional but do enjoy the quality and ability to take wonderful pics with my new camera.

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera
Reviews.Author: Jason Smith
Reviews.Content: I've had point and shoot cameras all my life from old 110's, disc cameras, 35 mm and assorted digitals. I have really enjoyed this camera. I think it's a great camera for someone wanting to raise their level of photography. There is some of the same features that you would find on a DSLR camera. This is a good way to learn some the settings and modes without jumping off in to a high end DSLR with multiple lense. Don't be fooled it's not a DSLR. Go to Best Buy and look at this camera and then pick up a DSLR and you will see the difference. Just the feel of weight and quality is night and day. You also will not get out the door with a DSLR for under $400(which you can with the PowerShot SX50). You'll have to shell out another $200 for a bottom end DSLR and you still will not have the zoom power of the lense on the PowerShot. So enough of that, back to the camera. So far I've gotten some great pictures with it. Maco shots are good on it and the zoom is insane! I've gotten some great shots of the moon, with great detail. It's a little tight between the lens and the right side grip. The strap they send with the camera is junk and the battery is so, so. It has definately gave me the fever to get more into photography and get a $4000 DSLR(That's not in the budget for now). There's some great resources at the local library on photography(books and DVD's). Bottom line is I personally love the camera and you can get some great photos with it. That's just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: 5/5 Canon delivers!
Reviews.Author: Walter Glass "computer geek"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a replacement for my old S3 IS.It's a much bigger camera with much bigger features thatI am still learning the finer points of. I am so happily surprised at how muchmore advanced this camera is than the old S3 IS.I tried many shots of a mountaintop and was happy with the hand-heldclarity at full 50X zoom. The IS works great. Overall I am quite happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Gudorf
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised of what this camera can do.  I seriously considered going the Rebel T3i route but decided to go "point and shoot".  It was a good decision.  While the price seems high, there isn't anything this camera can't do.  The zoom is great and the features are endless.

Reviews.Title: Super zoom camera excellent for birding.
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Cantu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the 50X which I use for birding and It works very well for telephoto.  It has many features which I have not tried out for other purposes.  The problem I have with the camera is that it doesn't work well with my hands which are small.  In holding the camera, I am pressing on control buttons and changing settings I don't mean to change.  I don't like the swingout screen as I moslty shoot with the evf and have to stop and open the screen to review.  The photo quality is similar to my Lumix DMC-FZ35.  In spite of the akwardness to use, I would buy this camera again for the awesome zoom.

Reviews.Title: Pretty COOL camera
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I really like my Canon SX50 which replaces an older Sony DSC-H5 7mp camera.  There are many things the Canon doesn't do which I had hoped for, but all-in-all it's a great camera.  While few of these bridge camera's can compete with DSLR's for image quality, the cost of a single lens for a DSLR can buy you a second camera.  I will say that the SX50 is a great camera in this price range, but like any camera, it's up to you to learn how to use it within it's limitations.  Also, You'll never know what this camera is capable of until you take it out of auto mode.  Finally, the RAW images are better quality than the jpeg so you can step the quality up a notch by going RAW.What I like most about this camera is the zoom and the articulating screen, both of which I find indispensable for fun photography.  While DSLR's are arguably better, there are many shots that a DSLR owner will pass up because they can't get close enough.  As an example,  You've all seen shots of a huge moon hanging over a boat/tree etc... Very impressive photo, in my mind!  To take this kind of picture you need a boat/tree or anything else so far away that from where you are standing that it is smaller than the moon.  You zoom in until the moon and subject fills your frame and snap the photo.  This can be done with a DSLR, but many times requires a zoom lens that is too expensive for the average human being.The articulating screen is fantastic for those shots that require you to play twister to get.  In addition, when it is very bright out you can reposition the screen for better contrast.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Tom Dunn
Reviews.Content: Was debating between the SX50 and the t3i. After much research I decided on the SX50 due to the price and the flexibility in one lens. We've used it almost everyday since Christmas and have been impressed each and every time. We took it sledding today and I was amazed at how good the zoom was from the bottom of the hill we got some great close ups then action shots as they came down the hill.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!!
Reviews.Author: Joan Pillera
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and takes super sharp images. I love the zoom and I love the quality. Canon rocks!! :)

Reviews.Title: Great point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Ben "MBen"
Reviews.Content: It's amazing how quickly technology has improved since I bought a Canon Xti a while back.  I consider this point and shoot a much better camera as I'm not a photography buff and I probably overbought when I did the Xti.  The zoom and clarity on this is fantastic, as I've taken maximum zoom shots that have clarity and detail.  This is very important to me such that the little glitches like repeatedly pressing the timer-set function is not irritating (yet).Now if I can get someone to buy my Xti, I'll really be happy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: I'm not professional, however this camera is awesome. I love it.No problems until now. Good image, quality, size and weight. No issues with the zoom. Battery life is good. Videos and Pictures are awesome.Update:From Dec. 2012 until Oct.2013, this camera was excellent product.The facts:PROS:- Pictures of distant Birds with zoom are amazing. With +50x, you will need a tripod or base for best results.- Flower pictures with real colors- Pictures of people in action are fantastic getting the exaclty moment of the activity. No blur.- In terms of videos, I usually don't use the camera for videos, however I have some of them without noise of the zoom mechanism.- Moon pictures. Wow, this was the best part using my Canon camera. The moon pictures are really impressive, when you can see clearly the moon surface details.  I use full zoom (200x, digital zoom included ). I have a tripod and a the Canon Remote Control avoiding undesired movements.- Weight and size perfects. The camera quality materials are very good.CONS:- I use a lot the viewfinder during sunlight and I think that it could be better in terms of definition.- I some cases, the options/buttons are a little bit complicated to use. Over time you will get used.NEXT:- I will explore the camera capabilities, taking pictures of dark skies with the stars.- I will make videos in slow motion (fps 240).I recommend this camera for general use. After almost 1 year of use, I remain loving it.

Reviews.Title: JuSt excelent
Reviews.Author: benno dubach
Reviews.Content: This ist the best you can buy for a $ 340! Amasing camera!!! JuuSt buy it, an you will be suprised abot this excelnt pRoduct. Notthing negative at all!!!!

Reviews.Title: Takes Photos like a DSLR for the Point and Shoot Photographer
Reviews.Author: LAURA MCDONALD ""Magistrate Mother""
Reviews.Content: For the amateur, mind you, this is a great camera.  Can't speak for all you professional or semi-professionals, but the zoom on this camera is amazing for those of us who have the point and shoot mentality.  The wonderful thing about this camera is that it has many of the self-adjusting options of a dslr, but it will do it all automatically for you as well.  We really love the slow motion video, and the incredibly close-zoom

Reviews.Title: Great Zoon and good camera
Reviews.Author: R. Sutton
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.,  The 50 x zoom really is the same as a 24mm to 1200mm lens costing Mega bucks.  Don't misanderstand, it's not the quality of the $$$ 24-1200mm lens but it does a very nice job.  Word a caution:  Don't expect to take pix or video at full zoom without a tripod or way to stabilize the camera.  At full zoom you WILL see camera shake if the camera is not stabilized with a tripod of some other means to steady the shot. But for home video/stills, this camera does a great job.  I have many rigs from Canon 5d Mark 2 down to GX1 but this unit fits the bill for casual walk about use.  Highly recommend.  Only one minor downside, you'll need to purchase a seperate filter "Adapter" if you want to use filters.  Standard filters that screw onto the camera are NOT supported without the adapter.Update:  I just purchased the filter adapter for the SX-50 that also comes with three filters, a soft rubber (?) hood etc that works just great.  Kit also included a new lens cap that is necessary as the adapetr allows 58mm filters (etc) to be used.  I now leave the included 58mm UV filter on the camera to protect the lens.The Accessory Kit for CANON PowerShot SX50 HS Digital Camera - Includes: 58MM Lens Adapter Ring + Vivitar Filter Kit (UV, CPL, FLD) + Carry PouchSold by Digital Goja.  Sells for $29.Here's the Amazon link:B00C9L6JYY

Reviews.Title: NIfty camera
Reviews.Author: Anatolij Strangar "mr t"
Reviews.Content: I planned to buy super zoom camera and was waging in between Panasonic and Canon. After reviews and comparison I decide Canon would be the better candidate. I'm old Panasonic customer and was unpleasantly surprised with their new product. They don't use Leica lenses (at least not on this product) and Canon is superior camera even it is a year older than new Panasonic. Strange and weird.

Reviews.Title: What a great camera Canon made here!!
Reviews.Author: Stormy1
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon SX-50 HS digital camera early in 2013 when it went on sale & also to replace the Canon SX-40 HS digital camera I had before. Both the Canon SX-40 HS and SX-50 HS controls are laid out pretty much the same. Both cameras takes great photos, but the SX-40 HS had a few quirks that bothered me for the 2 years I had that camera, but the SX-50 HS does not have any odd quirks when taking photos yet.Anyways, I have used the Canon SX-50 HS digital camera for awhile now and took it on vacation as I required a digital "point & shoot" with a pretty decent optical zoom and this camera has the zoom I require for my long-range scenic photo needs of mountains and similar items.The good stuff: Long 50X optical zoom [1200mm zoom power] and it works quite well & pretty fast. Very easy to use.  My outdoor photos seems to come in quite well, especially in lower light situations such as sunrises or sunsets. Using the optical zoom, the photos will vary and the more zoom you use, the worse the photos outside turns out. Modest zoom usage and the outdoor photos are still pretty good. Marco/super close up photos with this camera is absolutely great!!! I have got bird photos so close and clear with this camera, you can see the feather textures so easily with this camera....simply amazing!! Moon shots with this camera is excellent & as good as the Canon SX-40 HS. Indoor shots seems pretty decent with this camera too, as long as you're using the flash. Overall, photo quality with this camera is very good. Controls are laid out decently for the most part. Optical viewfinder is a nice touch, even tho I use the flip out LCD viewfinder most of the time, but in real bright sunny weather outside, I will use the optical viewfinder instead. The SPORT MODE on this camera is very nice to have & very nice feature!! This camera uses the common SD and SDHC photo card, a nice plus. Video quality with this camera is decent. I only shoot short videos with any digital camera and the video quality with this camera seems as good as my prior digital cameras I have had over the past few years.Photos are a bit "softer" with this camera compared to my former Nikon P-510 camera, but that's just a minor issue.The bad stuff: The video button is placed right next to the thumb rest on the backside of this camera and it's easy to activate by mistake. Canon should have placed the video button on the top of the camera instead of the backside. The external flash hot-shoe on top of the camera lacks a cover, something the SX-40 HS had [a cover].Battery life with this camera seems pretty good and uses the same battery the SX-40 HS uses. Battery charges pretty quick also, 2-4 hours usually with the supplied Canon battery charger. Get a few extra batteries also if you plan on taking a trip or taking lots of photos at any public event.Overall, I think that if you need a pretty long zoom in a point & shoot camera without having to fumble around with a few different lens & still want a very good photo, this Canon SX-50-HS camera will do the job just fine.I am pleased I now own the Canon SX-50 HS digital camera and it hopefully will serve my photo needs for a year or two with minimal problems. I even bought a second SX-50 HS digital camera because I like this one so much and the second one works just fine too and is my "back-up camera" now. I have given this camera 5 of 5 stars....to me, it's a great camera!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera for bird photography!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Thompson "earthsea-imagery"
Reviews.Content: I shoot professionally with a Canon 7d, mostly, I'm a wide angle photographer.  I bought primarily this for my wife, although with the thought that I'd use it now and then as well.  We just moved near Klamath Lake, OR, one of the best birding locations anywhere, so the 1200mm equivalent telephoto very much played in our decision.In testing/learning about the camera, I've found that the stabilization works very well.  I've gotten some very sharp images of a bald eagle feeding on a fish, from 150', 1200mm @ 1/160th !  The images over the entire range of the zoom seem quite a bit better than I expected.  I may have to buy a 2nd one, just for the telephoto, a quality  long lens for my 7d is 4-5 times as expensive, weighs a ton, and no way can I justify it.The downsides to the camera;1.  It tends to clip highlights, shooting RAW files helps a lot to recover them.2.  The buttons on the back are almost impossible not to bump while holding/carrying the camera, I wish they took a firmer pressure/click to activate.3.  The menus and the various ways they are accessed are quite confusing, with many things grayed out or active, depending on whether you are shooting jpg or jpg + RAW and also depending on what mode you are in.  Having the 200+ page manual only as a PDF file doesn't help matters.Although somewhat of a pain, these things don't stop me from giving it 5 stars, it's an amazing camera that, even on full auto, takes exceptional photos.Steve

Reviews.Title: Perfect for birdwatching bird photography. This zoom rocks!
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because of its zoom and size,  and to be honest I was quite skeptical. I have a DSLR camera and I'm used to its quality. I just wanted something lighter with an incorporated zoom since a DSLR and its huge lenses are a lot to carry on long hikes.Well I have to say this little camera is AMAZING! Much more than I expected, excellent quality of long distance pictures. It has an image stabilizer or someting like it since pictures are SO sharp no matter how far you are from the objective.I absolutelly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Haines
Reviews.Content: This is my first modern camera in quite some time. Needless to say it blew me away! I can sit on my porch and video or photograph the deer on the mountainside across the valley. Wow. This camera has a learning curve but once you read the manual a couple times everything makes sense. I like the manual is online since those teeny tiny books they usually are printed so small that it makes sense just to download the pdf and stick it on the smartphone to keep with me.Pros: Quick lens speedAuto focus works wellBattery life is goodOuter display flips aroundSelf time has lots of featuresSlow motion is nice featurevideo looks greatWide angle is surprisingly wideCons: Needs tripod or mono pod for best results at maximum zoom 200xlearning curve is high going from 7 year old three button pocket shooterlittle bigger than i am used to physicallyIn conclusion get a 32 gig card, 1 extra battery and a light tripod or stick to use with this camera. Take lots of shots and just sort out the best. My days of having the dark spot of what i wanted to photograph in the pictures are over. Now people can see what I saw even at a distance.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon User "Rose"
Reviews.Content: This camera is so cool!  The zoom is incredible,very clear at even long distances.  The basic features are easy to use, looking forward to learning all the other features.  Photos are clear, great clarity with image stabilization.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: excellent optical zoom and picture quality
Reviews.Author: Kiran Pentapati
Reviews.Content: The optical zoom and picture quality are excellent. It is very easy to use. It looks like a D-SLR camera in performance.

Reviews.Title: Great camera-great zoom.
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace a older PowerShot SX10 that I had for a few years.  The zoom is fantastic!  The only thing I wasn't keen on was going back to a battery pack instead of rechargeable AA batteries. I purchased an extra Canon battery to ensure I always had power.

Reviews.Title: A Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I have had the SX30,the SX40,and now the SX50. I use it mainly when birding with binoculars and spotting scope on a tripod and do not want to carry my DSLR gear as well.For this use the Sports mode works surprisingly well. Lillian Stokes has on her Web site some very good pictures and her tips would be useful to beginners with this camera who are into birding or other wildlife.Having RAW was selling point for me although CKDK did well on the SX40.The viewfinder could be better but do not forget to use the diopter setting to the left of of it to get the best result.The lens is slightly different in size from the SX40. See Lensmate if you want an adapter that will fit well.All told the zoom is the thing but this is a fun camera to use for most anything realizing it is not a DSLR

Reviews.Title: satisfied so far
Reviews.Author: Richard Z
Reviews.Content: Am still learning all of the functions and have only used on auto so far. I have used it for both photos and video and am very satisfied. As a former SLR film photographer with multiple lenses and a darkroom, I'm now totally enjoying the freedom of a single camera and lens. Less weight, more versatile, more fun. Can't wait to travel with it.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've Used So Far, Incredible Zoom
Reviews.Author: Grant
Reviews.Content: It feels great knowing that the camera in your hands has the best digital camera zoom ever made. Battery life is fantastic, ~60% more than the next-highest zoom camera (Nikon P510). That camera, the NEXT-HIGHEST, has 8x less zoom! This camera is truly in another class!As for future versions, both the main screen and viewfinder should get a resolution boost. Resolution is important when zooming in on small objects, and I've had a slight problem with that. Also, more megapixels is something I would pay for.Besides the small resolution and megapixel issues, this is a great camera. I can't stop having fun with the zoom!

Reviews.Title: 50x
Reviews.Author: B. Adams "awalleyeguy"
Reviews.Content: Well I am not by any means an expert.But this camera takes great pics and I love the 50x optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Poor EVF mars otherwise usable platform
Reviews.Author: MysticJaguar
Reviews.Content: I have a love/hate relationship with Canon I'll admit. I love their Elph pocket cameras. And I hate the ergonomics on their DSLRs, they can never get the grip right at least on the lower end Digital Rebel line. Nikon has far better feeling DSLR on the low end.For this camera I had high hopes. But I find the electronic viewfinder (EVF), the heart of the user experience, to be one of the worst implemented EVF ever. I'm not a snob on EVF. I thought the EVF on the Sony Alpha a55 were well done when most other users hated it. I have a Panasonic DMC-G5 and think the viewfinder is very good. I have owned a number of Panasonic FZ long zooms going back to FZ28, FZ35, FZ47, etc and I think the viewfinders there are very usable. But this viewfinder on the SX50 is so small its feels like a toy camera and really reminds me of some poor Fuji EVFs from years ago.I compared the SX50 and the diminutive SX510 side by side. I really believe that if you are going to have a digital camera that you really should have a viewfinder of some sort. This was part of the secret to the success of Canon's A-line of cameras of the 2000's. Even if you just have an optical-approximating viewfinder it works. There is something about boxing in the composition in a viewfinder that really helps you project in your mind what the final image will look like. That's something you can't really do with just a LCD screen that you likely cannot even really see in bright sunlight. (And you should note that Canon's A-series took a sharp dive when Canon started making the SX cameras years ago, so in many ways the (S2 IS/S5 IS) SX is the descendant of the A-series.) But in comparing the SX50 and SX510 my surprising conclusion is that I'd rather use the smaller SX510 because the EVF on the SX50 did nothing for me. Even the diopter adjustment on the SX50 felt like it was thrown in at the last minute, just not polished, not easy to find, and moved with the most of difficulty (almost like it had sand in the mechanism and would try and move past the setting you wanted. The tactile experience on the diopter adjustment was just bad).Besides EVF my other main concern with the SX50 is 50x zoom. 50x?  The rush to the long end of the zoom lens is as misguided as the other tech trends such as more megapixels. You can barely compose a shot at the longer end due to camera shake and focus hunting in many conditions. So it's great the temporary zoom-out control/indicator is on both the SX50 and SX510. And Canon is thinking about the image quality by staying with a 12mp sensor instead of 16mp or 20mp like some of the others.  A 20x or 30x option is better if you are looking for an all around camera and not just taking shots of birds or other creatures where the awe of the shot outweighs the other compromises in optical quality to get you there.Overall this camera did not feel like it has the same polish as other competitors in it's class.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Pete "Pete"
Reviews.Content: I found that there is a great difference between specifications and actual practical use of the camera. I did quite a bit of research and compared the reviews For each of the top-rated magazoom cameras Including the Panasonic the Fujifilm and the Canon. I purchased the Canon in part because of the highly rated reviews on several professional websites and the 50 power telephoto lens system.Auto Focus Problems:My telephoto target is a bird feeding station about 15 feet away I would also try to capture birds in tree branches about 25 to 30 feet away. 90% of my shots were out of focus. The lens seems to be constantly searching with green focus squares popping up in various parts of the lens field but almost never dead center. I tried numerous adjustments including turning off any face detection or other gadgets but to no avail.Macro close ups were no better. A great deal of searching with many out of focus shots.Now in fairness, those images that were in focus are of good quality but the percentage was much too low. I ordered the Fujifilm hs50exr and was extremely pleased with quality, ergonomics and focus speed and accuracy right out of the box.I returned the Canon SX50 after four days with no regrets. Thank you Amazon for being the best consumer friendly retailer in America!

Reviews.Title: Amazing optical zoom
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jim B"
Reviews.Content: The SX50 has an amazing 24-1200 optical zoom capability. Camera also has many terrific features. But it suffers from a tiny sensor (1/2.3 inch), which negatively affects picture quality, especially in low light.

Reviews.Title: Lens Failure after 7 days of use
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera to a trip in the rainforst. On the last day of the trip the camera displayed a "lens failure" error and was useless.  When it did work, I really liked the camera and the 800 pictures it took.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX 50 Warning
Reviews.Author: Mary G. Johnson "gran computer guru"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon SX 50 SD based on other reviews.  I am a semi-pro photography who has owned and who owns many other Canon cameras.  IF you purchase this camera, be aware, that at this point in time, there is NO editing software from Adobe which recognizes the proprietary RAW files generated by many of the modes of this camera.  JPEGS are OK.I found that Aperture will open the RAW files for editing.  Other than that, the camera offers many fun features, and lives up to it's hype for the most part.
