Be prepared to study the manual which has to be off loaded from the included DVD.

Reviews.Title: Try optical viewfinder before buying.
Reviews.Author: josephus
Reviews.Content: The optical viewfinder on this camera is tiny and nearly useless. And you can't attache an eye-cup magnifier to it because they they didn't leave a groove or anything else to put one on. I got it as a gift, so I didn't see it beforehand. If you prefer to compose through an optical viewfinder, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot not the greatest ultra-zoom for picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Candee Lynn Wilson "Saving Lady"
Reviews.Content: I was expecting much more from this camera in the way of picture quality. There are times when the only mode you can shoot in is automatic. In this mode, it is very difficult to get clear, crisp images, especially when conditions are less than ideal.

Reviews.Title: Perfect replacement for DSLR
Reviews.Author: Jonathan D. Walz "bent rider"
Reviews.Content: I was tired of walking around with a camera and bag full of glass worth thousands of dollars.My former camera was the Canon 5D MK II and a beautiful camera it was.  Had lots of L class lenses.In short, I was insured to the hilt.This camera does everything my 5D Mk II could do except bulb shots, a technique which I used perhaps twice in three years.The zoom on this camera is amazing.  I was never a big fan of auto focus but with this camera it is quick and accurate.I love small details and with the zoom on this camera and its ability to shoot in relatively low light, I can capture all sorts of oblique scenes that would have escaped me in the past as I would have had to get my camera out of my bag, unscrew a variety of caps, attach the appropriate lens, remove the lens cap, set the shot, focus, find and frame the subject... and the light has changed or the moment is gone.  Another missed opportunity.That doesn't happen much anymore. Now I see it, grab camera, remove pinch lens cap, shoot.Shoots HD and SD video.  The image stabilization is a whole other topic but suffice to say it is a quantum leap for me and coming from the 5D, which had no stabilization at all, the SX50 is absolutely mind blowing.I didn't intend to write a huge review but wanted to highlight that in this reviewers opinion, the Canon SX50 is as good as the Canon 5D Mark II.  Better in some regards.Yes, it doesn't have the prestige of a $2500 camera.  But wherein lies the prestige?  All of the quality is there along with the functionality.  If your thinking of ditching your expensive DSLR kit, this is the camera to look at.  It won't impress your friends, but you will be impressed and sometimes amazed with the images you capture.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, a few drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Mrs. C
Reviews.Content: I am giving the Canon PowerShot SX50 a 5-star rating because the photos and the zoom are amazing.  I am not a "photographer" by any stretch, I'm just a girl with a blog who loves nature and enjoys photographing birds and such.  I had a Kodak Easyshare with a 21x zoom and was very happy with it until I started blogging, and following the blogs of some nature photographers.  It was soon apparent that my little camera was lacking.  A photographer I respect  recommended the Canon PowerShot SX50, saying it would do everything from macro photos to long-range bird photos without having to mess with lenses or complicated equipment.I have only had this camera a couple of weeks and so far I am very pleased with the quality of the photos and the zoom.  I have posted many photos of birds both on my blog and facebook to rave reviews.The camera itself probably rates a 4-star review.  My biggest complaint is that there are several function buttons on the back right where you would place your thumb.  I am forever accidentally hitting something I don't want to, and once I even messed up my settings because I accidentally hit a button, had a bunch of stuff pop up on the screen, and then couldn't undo what I did.  Also, the PDF manual that goes along with this camera is very complicated for a simple person like me.  Like I said, I'm not a photographer, I need simple and easy to understand.  The manual uses a lot of icons and symbols and also skips around a lot - giving you partial information and then referring you to another page for further information.  This is not very convenient.  If you are not already familiar with the lingo of photography, you will find the manual a bit overwhelming.  Even my photographer friend said the manual is not very user-friendly.I am not crazy about the auto mode on this camera.  I've been shooting in program mode, which I find easier to use.  I am slowly educating myself about the different settings and reading different photography books to improve my skills and understanding.  I also think it's rather chintzy that the camera does not come with a USB cable, you have to buy one separate.  Even my $200 Kodak came with all the necessary equipment.If you are looking for a longer zoom with a fairly easy to use point-and-shoot, you will like this camera.  It is a good value for the price and takes awesome pictures.

Reviews.Title: Mixed Results
Reviews.Author: wiltay
Reviews.Content: It goes without saying that any camera that tries to do too much is going do to some things less than ideally. With the long zoom and tilting LED I bought it mostly to photograph people on the street or at events like rodeos, festivals,etc, and also birds and wildlife without having to carry around a big, heavy and intrusive, neck-breaking SLR.  The 50X lens though needs a whole lot of light and the viewfinder even in good light is disappointingly dim so finding things can be tough and uncertain. My SLR is so much brighter and easier to use. Forget about photographing in the deep woods too. Even without zoom the camera often does not have enough light to focus when my little PowerShot could do it easily.  So it's not a great all-around camera, but I didn't get it for that purpose either.  With enough light the manually initiated image stabilizer works stunningly well at high zoom and the image processor gets thing right 90% of the time.  The camera is like having a small, powerful telescope and for the money, Canon has really made this technology work.

Reviews.Title: very prompt
Reviews.Author: hbl2
Reviews.Content: I love the ease of this camera.  I have had a canon rebel for many years but when traveling it is hard changing out lens for different pictures all the time.  I take a lot of pictures.  Once a friend of mine showed me her pictures from this camera and I knew I wanted it and wasn't going to stop till I got it.  Well I too love my Canon PowerShot SX50.  Haven't quite gotten the hang of everything but am enjoying learning all about it.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Okie
Reviews.Content: I've only been using this camera for 4 days, but it's already apparent that it's a wonderful camera.  It has the ability to do so much.  It's so different from the 3 Kodak digital cameras I had that I needed to print the manual.  Canon furnishes the manual on a CD ... not handy enough for me.  It was 285 pages long.  I'm wandering through the manual and trying things as I progress.  This camera takes excellent photos.  And, the image stabilization is unbelievable to a former Kodak user.  The Kodaks were good, but this camera is way beyond good.  I took pictures at 50X optical and 150X (optical plus 3X digital) ... handheld and on a cloudy day. They are unbelievable, crisp colors and no camera shake.  It's going to be a big learning curve for me, and I'm going to enjoy every minute.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Tillman
Reviews.Content: Best camera I ever purchased!  We bought this camera to take on vacation to the mountains in hopes of capturing the beauty of nature.  This camera rocked!  In daylight and darkness.  The zoom on this camera is unbelieveable and the video feature is second to none.  I am an amateur photog with minimum skills but this camera makes me look like I have a lot more talent than I do.

Reviews.Title: Very good investment if your objective is to go birdphotographing.
Reviews.Author: Goran Nesic
Reviews.Content: This a camera that is close to perfect.It does what I want for bird watching. It is compact and with huge zoom which permits approximation that other people, including myself, with large and expensive DSLR envy.However, there are couple of points that are not favorable:1. You can not find easily a bird in a electronic viewfinder (n comparisson with the DSLR cameras which have optical viewfinder).This will create some problems and many times, not being able to find your bird while zoomng in, you will loose the shot.The other problem is that ina fast birst mode, the autofocus is not precise.In any case, I was able to make some for me, very gratifyuing outputs (photos): [...]

Reviews.Title: Great shots in Alaska
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an Alaska Cruise.  I took several wildlife pictures that were astonishing.  To the naked eye, the goats on the mountain side were just white dots but the pictures I took were clear and well focused.  I used a monopod to steady the camera and shot the pictures.  The white dots were a mother and her baby.  Also shot pictures of a convocation of eagles that I had to shoot on rapid fire because they were flying so fast.  When I looked at these pictures on the computer, several of them blew up into nice clear pictures of eagles.  Great camera.  glad I got it in time to take on the trip.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, still struggling with the video format - wish it was something else.
Reviews.Author: Darla Doty
Reviews.Content: The video file format has not been very friendly, shutting down after some 10 or 15 minutes.Burning those to DVDs on Windows 7 has also been a science project.The zoom and photos are fine, for the most part.I must say, though, at maximim zoom, taking pictures of very small turtles some 40 feet away (using a tripod and 2 second delay), the actual clicking of the shutter seems to knock the focus off and make that final picture a bit more blurry than the crystal clear image in the LCD showed the instant before.Any remedies for that?Thanks,ddd

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: sam
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I worked with my sister for five years in wedding photography and I am a artist. I have used non digital and older digital cameras before (Canon and Minolta.) I love the minolta because I trained on it and knew that machine inside and out, but it was an older camera and I needed a new camera that I did not use film. The zoom is a very nice feature on this camera, and the clarity is superb. For the price the camera is a steal.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Candace Selkirk
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before picking this camera. My main reason for getting this camera was the super zoom for wildlife and outdoor pics, and I wanted a camera for concerts, so I could get better close up pics. So far I am very very pleased. My daughter has been using the camera to take video's of her boyfriend's band, and they are all amazed at the quality of the pics and the sound. I am not a professional - so for all those people out there looking for a good camera without having to take a lesson in photography - this is the one. The price was very reasonable for the quality pictures that you will get. The only thing is the camera is a bit bulky so if you are trying to sneek it past a security check point at a concert you will not be able to do it. So make sure they allow personal cameras.

Reviews.Title: Incredible....
Reviews.Author: Fenway1
Reviews.Content: For those looking for some super technical review, this will probably disappoint. I consider myself a recreational photographer at best. The best feature in my opinion is the 50X zoom. I recently took it on a day trip to Vermont and thoroughly enjoyed getting to know this camera. I only used the "auto" setting. The colors are bright and very crisp. Another thing that impressed me was a picture that I took on Mt. Equinox in Manchester Vt. The day I was there it was a bit hazy. Both myself and my brother-in-law (who has a Pentax) took pictures of the same scenery. While his clearly showed the haziness of the day, you could not even detect it with this camera. The battery life seems pretty decent (although I will make up my mind more definitively as time goes by). I zoomed in on a bee that was on a flower from at LEAST 10 yards away and it looked like I had the camera practically on top of it. The last camera I had was another Canon back in the day that I was also very happy with as well. Again....no super technical observations found here. But in a nutshell.....very happy that my research led to this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for all types of daily picture taking
Reviews.Author: bnjgiff
Reviews.Content: Excellent zoom lens. Quality pictures. Still learning how to use, but completely satisfied! Great camera to take pictures of movement!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50 HS review
Reviews.Author: Bee
Reviews.Content: Overall I like this camera's features and ease of use.  One feature that I especially like is the hot shoe, which many cameras in this category and price range don't have.  The camera takes very good telephoto shots, especially considering the price of the camera.  The autofocus is very quick for a zoom lense with such a wide range.  One negative is that the electronic viewfinder (EVF) is smaller than is desirable.  Canon may have opted to use a smaller EVF to reduce power consumption so that a battery would last longer on a charge or to take some of the load off of the processor, but I would prefer to have a larger viewfinder that makes it easier to view and compose shots.  The camera has a photostitch mode that assists in taking sequential shots that can be used with Canon's software to produce panoramas.  This is a feature that I hope Canon will keep, but I would also like to have an in-camera sweep panorama mode that works somewhat like the Sony cameras.  And I would like to add an option to take 1080p video at 60 frames per second (FPS).  With everything considered (features, price, etc.), I would give this camera a rating of 4.6 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: This is the camera I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: I am not a photographer but I want to take great pictures, even from a distance. This is the camera I was looking for!I have a Canon EOS Rebel that I love, and I recently bought a zoom lens for it. If I had known about the Canon Powershot SX50 before buying the Rebel plus lens I could have saved myself a lot of money.  It takes great pictures in Full Auto, but it also has all of the manual options as well.  And the zoom is much better than what I could ever get on a lens for my Rebel--it has 1200 zoom PLUS digital zoom.  I am really happy with how portable this camera is and how great the pictures are and it is very affordable at just about $400.

Reviews.Title: Super for photos of birds
Reviews.Author: John A Speech
Reviews.Content: While birding one day I saw 4 people with this camera.  After reading the reviews and asking the owners, I decided to buy one.  I am still learning, but the sum total so far is that it is a great camera for everyday use, but especially good if you don't want to lug around a camera with a huge lens.

Reviews.Title: Good Everyday Camera!
Reviews.Author: jblah
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not your DSLR camera, but it does take good quality images. It is perfect for those who want to step up from point and shoot but are not willing to shell out 500+ for a DSLR and lenses. We went to the DC Cherry Blossom festival and took several pictures using only autosettings. We also tried the full zoom out aswell. Several of the images came out really well. The colors were vibrant and popping in the sun. Without the sun, the images were slightly washed out. The details in the images were awesome. Also the full zoom on the camera is something else. It was fun to zoom across the lake and be able to see what people were doing at the steps of a building far away. The auto settings sometimes tend to zoom in on the background when you really try to focus on the foreground. There are also times where it just does not know where to focus at all since there are too many things going on with the image. I'll upload some pictures to show examples of this.Before purchasing this camera, we took a look at the Panasonic Lumix FZ200K, Fujifilm Finepix hs30exr, nikon coolpix p510 and canon rebel T3 (Entry level DSLR). From the images on Amazon, we narrowed it down to the SX50, FZ200k, and rebel T3. We went to the store and played around with the rebel T3. Although the image quality for it was excellent, there was hardly any zoom with the 18-55mm lense (the standard lense that came with the camera). It would have been another additional $200-$400 on lenses if we wanted to get that camera. So we were down to FZ200k and SX50. This was a very very hard decision. Luckly, we found a website which helped us select the SX50 over the FZ200k. Google "panasonic fz200k review" and it is the 6th link from cameralabs.There is definitely a slight learning curve with this camera coming from a straight point and shoot. However, I think the autofocus does a good job of allowing people the flexibility of taking normal everyday pictures. The other options definitely gives those willing to experiment a wider capability. I've only used this camera extensively for one day, but i'm sure to try out other features with this camera and report back.

Reviews.Title: Very good but the viewfinder is not sharp.
Reviews.Author: cross
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures and the zoom is great, but I thought it was smaller, and the viewfinder is really bad. Not sharp at all.

Reviews.Title: This is an amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Stanley Fleming
Reviews.Content: I was considering purchase of a 500 mm Sigma lens for a used Nikon DSLR when I discovered this gem.  Just the lens was going to cost $1000 + an the camera body was another $300 used.  I wanted/needed a long lens for my new found fun activity - bird watching.  I had a Canon G10 and it did an admirable job but I wanted some more telephoto capability. For under $400 I was able to get a camera body and 1200 mm lens that gets fantastic results in the AUTO mode.  And, it has all the other modes I was used to on my G10.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX-50 is perfect
Reviews.Author: Darien
Reviews.Content: There are no limitations with the Canon SX-50.  Add an adapter to the lens to accommodate a UV Haze filter to protect the lens, then add an 8-star filter for effects or a polarization filter for dramatic blue skies.  Then add a screw or snap on hood and 58 mm lens cap.  The remote control is really great and an external flash just puts icing on the cake.  This is top of the line without going to an SLR.  The zoom is incredible.The only misses of this camera is, I wish it at a wider and smaller aperture, a little bit longer exposure capability and an eye cup for the viewfinder.I highly recommend this camera to anyone who just doesn't wants all the bells and whistles of a SLR.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Ziggy
Reviews.Content: Great camera you will find for the money!. The 50x optical zoom is unbelievable. I love it!!! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Rufus
Reviews.Content: Nice upgrade from sx10. Very clear pic even in zoom. Don't like where the video button is. Way to easy to hit lol. Minor annoyance . I like that the lens cap has a tether the sx10 did not.

Reviews.Title: Great for small birds not for lanscapes
Reviews.Author: S. Sweeney
Reviews.Content: Out in the field, I need to be always ready for the wildlife that can pop up at any time but, in between, I need to be able to capture decent landscapes. After using the SX50 outdoors for about a month, I have to agree with the other reviewers that find the SX50 is awesome for small birds. However, the landscapes are mostly disappointing -- not nearly as good as the SX40.  I haven't done much macro work with it yet so don't have an opinion on this.  I'm hoping that an SX60 comes out in 2013 that combines to best features of the SX40 and SX50 as I detest having to carry around 2 cameras or switch lens.

Reviews.Title: Zoom is not enough for what doesn't work for me
Reviews.Author: Fauxfyr
Reviews.Content: Disclaimers: I own several cameras, the main use ones are a Canon T2i with multi lenses, a Fuji xp60 for quick underwater shots, and an old Kodak Z612 (a 6.1 mega pixel camera). I am not comparing this camera to the T2i or the Fuji. I am comparing it to the Kodak which, for it's time, had one of the longest zooms available (12x). I get perfect shots off of this camera, and it has nearly all the adjustments of a DSLR. I also acknowledge that I could have just gotten a bad camera, but the bulk of the camera makes it a no go for me, anyway. This review is for anyone who might really want a camera with one lens that will also do a lot of what a DSLR will do. This camera doesn't do it easy, if at all.I had high hopes for the SX50. I like a long zoom, and have no problems getting a great picture zoomed in. My problems were are follows:Much bulkier than the Z612 (makes sense, due to the long zoom, but adds one more negative for me)Bright sunlight, standing still, half the pictures still came out blurrier than the Z612. Tested on all settings, not just Auto.I cannot force a flash on the "Auto" setting. Sometimes "Auto" is almost what I want, but I want the fill the flash gives me. I don't want to the set the whole camera just to get a flash, but on Auto, in sunlight, even if there are shadows, you can't force the flash. The screen even says so, if you couldn't figure it out for yourself.Hard to set the "Manual" settings. I don't have big hands, but I was constantly hitting something other than what I wanted. The shot is gone.Controls are not intuitive for me. I liked the controls on the Nikon P520, but that camera was too slow to focus.The focus isn't "on" for this camera. On Auto settings, it frequently will focus on something in the background instead the the face in front of me. I had to re-focus several times, and still did not always get what I was trying for.Flash shots took three times longer to process that non-flash shots. What the hey?No way to take multi shots in auto settings. Once again, the screen said so.....Too many button pushes to set scenes, get your stored settings, set everything. Setting one thing is not difficult, setting f-stop AND shutter speed AND flash compensation AND ISO AND whatever else is cumbersome. (I don't have this much trouble with my T2i, although that was not the comparison-the Z612 is a breeze compared to the SX50)Viewfinder was useless. Too close to the body. Where do they think you are going to put your nose?Lens is VERY sensitive. It would try to focus in on the dust particles near the lens. No, it was not on macro.Too much lens flare in sunny situations. I had to keep moving around to avoid pink spots in my pictures. No, I was not looking into the sun, although my friend's Samsumg One Note got an incredible picture of the sun through the trees. The SX50 couldn't even hope to get that shot due to lens flare.It didn't equalize the picture on Auto settings. In a forest, where there is some shadow and some bright areas, the bright areas are over exposed, and the dark areas are still dark. Not so with my Z612.There may have been ways to accomplish what I wanted, but it wasn't easy to do.One the plus side, close up pictures were VERY sharp, but any standard vacation pictures were soft. The auto focus on the zoomed out setting was much quicker than any other camera I tried (but not quicker than my Z612). The zoom was phenomenal. The depth of field was better than the Z612, but not better than the Canon Powershot 260 a friend was using.Bottom line for me, I can't give this camera more than one star. The zoom and macro seemed very good, but I could not get a really good picture with it when it wasn't on zoom or macro. Auto settings were not usually sharp, and it took too long to set for conditions. I can see how this could be a good camera for birders, but I like a one-camera-does-all for vacations and arty pictures while on vacation. Your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Mindful Element "Mindful"
Reviews.Content: I have other heavy duty camera but I want to look for a universally travel camera and this is great for the purpose. It takes sharp photos, especially with distance. The Image Stabilizer on this camera works even better than that of the expensive camera. The pictures came out sharper than I thought it would, and it zooms further than any other cameras of its kind. Totally recommend this camera for those reasons.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: LOVE this camera!  excellent quality pictures, easy operation, compact and the zoom is awesome!  The macro shots are clear and capture the detail without blurring.  I have been very impressed with this camera.  It's a dynamo in a small package.  The video is great....good clear videos and very good in low light.  It's a very good bridge camera for the money.The only thing I would change is that I keep accidentally hitting the self timer button somehow....that button does not need to be so easily turned on and I have small hands!  I accidentally hit that self timer button and then I have to wait for it to go off before I can take my shot resulting in some missed shots.  The way the buttons are arranged, I have to be extremely careful not to mash one or more buttons on the camera every time I pick up the camera, The battery life seems to be kind of short also.  I purchased 2 extra batteries and have had to rely on them several times when out shooting pictures.  If you buy this camera, spend the extra money and get extra batteries.  But except for a few aggravating features like the battery and the buttons, the camera is excellent.  I'm giving it 5 stars on the picture quality and the awesome zoom capability.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50
Reviews.Author: silverswan
Reviews.Content: I'm pleased with the camera, except for the annoying placement of the movie button at the top right, which makes it easy to shoot video without intending to.

Reviews.Title: This camera has exceeded my expectations.
Reviews.Author: Perry Miller
Reviews.Content: Purchased this to photograph nature and it is performing far better than I expected. It's great to be able to go from macro to 50X zoom without having to change lenses. I like the semi-manual settings and I'm impressed with the versatility of the camera. The only potential drawback is the casing which feels like cheaper plastic.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for wildlife
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C Meadows
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to camera for my wildlife shots. It has a great range (1200mm) without spending the thousands of dollars needed for a telephoto lens for my 60D canon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Joseph Burbach
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife and she absolutely loves it.  Seems to be as simple to operate as a point and shoot but takes near professional quality pictures.  Can't beat it at that price!

Reviews.Title: canon sx 50
Reviews.Author: terry
Reviews.Content: great little camera...I have taken a lot of images they are coming out with good quality images... thanks so much...

Reviews.Title: My wife Loves it
Reviews.Author: August J. Peterson
Reviews.Content: So far this seems to be an excellent camera Very well satisfied.Takes very good pictures and have had no problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX50 HS
Reviews.Author: Tami Beckham
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after seeing some photos a friend of mine took in Yellowstone using one.  The telephoto capabilities are amazing for a fixed lens. We took it on vacation to Costa Rica, and got some photos I wouldn't have been able to get as easily with any other camera.  Great camera for wildlife!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: M. Goodall
Reviews.Content: Wow!  really great zoom and the photo quality is really good.  I take photos to use as reference in paintings and this is the perfect camera for zoom and detail. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: What a camera
Reviews.Author: md resident
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use, takes super shots, and is priced so reasonably.  Had the cannon point and shoot before and this is just as easy and the quality of photos are substantially different.  They look professional.  Bought for a trip out west; can't wait to see these photos when we return!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Carl Maerz
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera! everything about it is amazing, and it is so easy to use right out of the box!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50
Reviews.Author: Jeff Mann
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a better camera than the SX10 that I bought a few years ago  and  this one was the best choice for me. The price was right ($318). The thing I love about this camera is the 50X optical zoom. If you want a lot of the qualities of an SLR, but don't want to carry around several lenses, this is the one. This camera is not a perfect solution, but a very good one.

Reviews.Title: Happy I bought it!
Reviews.Author: nature lover "nature lover"
Reviews.Content: Every time Cannon brings out a new Power Shot I buy it. I love my 35, 45 and now the 50-I hope they don't do a 60 soon because I'm still learning some of the new things on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Maurice G Black
Reviews.Content: I have worked my way up through a variety of Canon digital cameras and find this one  surpasses the others in all aspects. Most impressive is the zoom lens which brings in extremely sharp details, the light weight of the camera,  and the convenient access of the controls.

Reviews.Title: On the fence
Reviews.Author: luckybug
Reviews.Content: Nice, light camera for travel. I love the HDR feature on this camera, but it requires a tripod to take a really clear picture. Also, it does not respond quite as fast as I am used to on my DSLR. Good battery life; no need to purchase spares.

Reviews.Title: Captured!
Reviews.Author: H. FISHBURN "mohala19"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  I've had almost every Canon DSLR out there and this one is a great value for the price and quality.  Its not a small camera that fits in your purse or pocket, but if you don't mind carrying it in addition to a purse or in a backpack then this is the only camera you need.I am blown away at the quality of the images and video.  The optical zoom makes me incredible photos even when all the way zoomed to a subject.  However, as with all digital zoom features, the image gets grainy and slightly blurry when zoomed out to max digital capacity.  This should not be a surprise to anyone who knows cameras though, they all do that.  With the 50x optical zoom, i haven't taken a bad photo yet.Highly recommend this camera to the enthusiast or hobbyist.My only suggestion is that you purchase an additional battery or two so that you don't run out of battery life and miss "the" shot.  I always have 2 additional batteries that are fully charged in my case.

Reviews.Title: Beats the competition, especially at that price point.
Reviews.Author: Gunter J. Steffen "mpbikeman"
Reviews.Content: Am very pleased with the results I'm getting from this camera so far.  It's very close in size, weight and balance to my previous Canon and the controls are located where I expect them.  The zoom exceeded my expectations and the camera is far easier to take into the field than I thought.  I can now get up close and personal with birds, wildlife and even insects like never before.  This thing is just plain fun with a rich feature set that I've just begun to explore.

Reviews.Title: Great video cam
Reviews.Author: Sushi
Reviews.Content: I normally shoot stills with my Sony A57, but it is too limited for long zooming, and not very smooth in video mode since it is manual zoom. The SX50 fills this void very well, plus it even has better stabilization in video mode than my a57 at longer ranges, not to mention 50x magnification. Plus with the SX50 I also get the option of 12mp stills which are not bad either, try that with any camcorder for the same price.

Reviews.Title: Great compact zoom camera
Reviews.Author: Kendal C Bowman
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to Disney World.  Did not want to lug my big Digital SLR.  This camera took great pictures and video.  There is a slight hesitation in taking pictures and you don't get that instantaneous shot like with a SLR but overal very good camera.

Reviews.Title: Indoors vs Outdoors and Comparing to what?: Great Point and Shoot. What are your needs?
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: Coming from an SX30, and standard point and shoot cameras, I was very hesitant about this camera. I owned the sx30 for about 4 weeks before selling it. The image quality was horrid...The lens on the 30 wasn't sharp, the images were blurry and out of focus, the colors while accurate, were often overexposed.  So when I heard about the sx50 I was very hesitant. But I took at look at the images side by side with the SX 30, saw that the lens on this camera was much much sharper, and decided to give some credit to all the reviews that were raving about the improvement on the image stabilization system on this camera. It arrived and I had a chance on a nice sunny day to take some photos. I was blown away. The color is there, rarely did I have any overexposure (something commonly seen on many of the compact canon point and shoots), and the image stabilization allowed me. to capture moving birds at a decent 1/150-1/300 second all the way zoomed in. Full zoom. For a point and shoot camera for outdoor photography, I am very impressed by the images that this camera can put out. It balances color well. If you wish, you can take a look at some of the pictures I have uploaded on flicker. You will find samples of unedited, full resolution on program mode that I took outside in the late afternoon early evening hours. They look great.  To view them select the links below and copy and paste them into your browser. (please note for full size download on flickr, you have to click on the three dots on the right hand side of the page. It will show download all sizes. Click on that and then select the Origional size and click download to view the photos in full resolution These are all 12mp unedited full size photos. Make sure the images are viewing as SX50. Here they are:https://flic.kr/p/mRb32Whttps://flic.kr/p/mRaVhohttps://flic.kr/p/mRbTkfhttps://flic.kr/p/mRbRduhttps://flic.kr/p/mRbVydhttps://flic.kr/p/mRadCMTo put it the least, I am very impressed with the outdoor shots on this camera. As it so happens, I take the majority of my photos in conditions where there is sufficient light, as I enjoy nature photography and vacationing, most of which even in a dim forest, is still outside and allows enough light to this sensor to get great images.  But if this doesnt fit you, and  if your into indoor photography, and want to take pictures WITHOUT the flash, than I would encourage you to keep looking . The reason I say this is that ISO beyond 800 is not usable on this camera (as is the case with most point and shoots). You can still get some good shots in well lit rooms, but if you think your going to take this camera into a church and take wedding photos where there isn't sufficient light and have it look as sharp as it would outside without flash, I would look elsewhere. In fact there are two cameras I would recommend in this case.  Half the people on here are claiming that DSLRS are super expensive, which is what led me to this fairly camera. Its called the olymus EPM2. Its one of the new interchangable mirroless cameras on the market.  However instead of using Sonys expensive NEX lenses, it uses the Micro 4/3 system that is shared by both Panosonic and Olympus and that is taking off like wildfire right now among photography companies. If you can nab one for around 300-350 with the kit lens, its a good price as of April 2014.  The camera:The EPM2.Its a 16 megapixel camera that costs nothing next to a DSLR.  You can use hundreds of lenses and the image quality will put most point and shoots on the market to shame...save for the SX50 which im still just blown away by with good lighting. Anyhow the samples for the OlympusAgain to appreciate the optics, click on the three dots on the right hand side once the page loads and click on view all sizes, select the origional size, download and view. The senor on this camera is used in another 800 dollar camera made Olyumpus:https://flic.kr/p/eSzRgchttps://flic.kr/p/eSMwAChttps://flic.kr/p/eSzLR8Plus you can use lenses of various types as low as f1.2 for indoor photography.  Another one to look at on flicker is the Panasonic GF3. Here is a sample photo of that one:https://flic.kr/p/9T34MZ  (same process. Click on the three dots on the right side of the page and click download other sizes and select the origional size, download and view on PC).Anyhow the senors on those cameras are much larger and are on DSLR level without being nearly as expensive.  The Olympus is 16 MP, the Panasonic is 12 MP. You can find the panasonic for under 250 with the lens kit. Its a GREAT price!  Find a zoom lens 20-150mm for under 100 and your at the right at this price point.That being said, if your into the long zoom and you think you will be shooting mostly outdoors, I cant recommend the canon Powershot SX enough.  Its an amazing camera for what I use it for, and Im very impressed by the improvements in auto focus, color reproduction, lens sharpness (its a sharp lens for this focal length. Two thumbs up for canon on pulling that off!!), and while it may not be the best low light camera, you can still use flash inside and what you get outdoors with this giant zoom monster.. Besides the zoom itself, even zoomed out, the camera is sharp and takes great photos just as it is. I would highly recommend it if you are looking for a high quality megazoom out there.One last comment: Im not sure about how Apple processes preview pictures, but in windows viewer, you have to zoom in one or two clicks for the sharpness to pop on higher res. photos.  Particularly with the 16 mp samples.

Reviews.Title: Marked improvement over the SX40
Reviews.Author: Don Feldhake
Reviews.Content: This camera, while reputed to be not up to the image quality of a DSLR, more than makes up for the difference in convenience, weight and simplicity. The images are plenty good enough for my purposes.  I previously owned the Canon SX40, and this newer model has noticeably shorter shutter lag, a needed improvement which shows up in my action photographs. For example I just attended an air show with the Navy Blue Angels performing. While standing at the front of the viewing area I was using the zoom function between 400mm and 1200mm, and captured a number of maneuvers being performed at 350-450 mph, in a couple of instances with jets entering the image area at 400mph from opposite directions, a total of 800 mph. I actually captured close-up images with the planes virtually nose-to nose, in one case actually overlapped - one with cockpit up, one down, all in single-shot mode. Certainly I had some misses also, mostly with planes zipping out of the image area in tight crops, not unexpected because I wasn't using a tripod..The SX40 would have been useless for this scenario. I also feel that the improved Auto Exposure  scene selection logic gives more consistent results in varying light and contrast situations. I love the new larger and sharper LCD. And all this capability fits into my fanny pack with a spare battery, 1200 mm and all.  Love this camera.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Turtleshack
Reviews.Content: Perfect for capturing wildlife, the zoom is awesome, now I have the picture of a lifetime, the Bald Eagle that landed across the lake ! Just a super little camera ! Took some time to figure it out , I guess that will take about 1000 or more pictures ! It does so much. Only downside is the Owners Manual does on CD, I have no way of looking at it....

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: Kellie Moya
Reviews.Content: Takes wonderful pictures. There isn't a better camera in its class if you ask me. I wife is going to get one today, she loved it so much. Just wish the price was a little cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Canon XS-50HS
Reviews.Author: freddyfricke
Reviews.Content: I just can't believe how popular this camera really is.. Two of my friends have the same exact Camera...  They paid lots more then the $319.99 I paid at Amazon.. Every thing That I have read about this Camera is totally 100 % correct as to speed, ease of shooting..  The camera is just un-real .Its as if it has its own memory..  My pictures are just breath taking.. Thanks Canon for making a superior product.  I Highly recommend this Camera
