Reviews.Author: James H. Mansfield
Reviews.Content: Excellent for the money. There may be other long zooms that are stronger in some particular feature but this camera is hard to beat for overall image quality and usability for a long zoom. Decent images even with 50X opitical and 2X digital zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom lens.
Reviews.Author: GozoGuru "GozoGuru"
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Canon SX40 HS for some time and have always enjoyed excellent results.  The SX50 produces just as great results with the added telephoto capability of the 1200mm.  I also own several Canon EOS cameras with lenses of all focal lengths.  The SX 50 allows me to be lazy and not carry a heavy camera bag with the EOS of choice and all the lenses necessary to match the capabilities of the SX50.  Oh, for the simple life!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for distance shots
Reviews.Author: T. McGinley
Reviews.Content: Though this camera is a bit bulky, it takes great distance shots with its 50X magnification.  Also like the fold out view screen which helps me see what I am photographing when the light is very bright .

Reviews.Title: AMAZING PHOTOS AND CLOSE UPS!!
Reviews.Author: mary Bastoni
Reviews.Content: I would HIGHLY recommend this camara for it's zoom lens. The color and detail of my photos were terrific. A+

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: Bear
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Easy to use and does well with both stills and video. I have only 2 complaints. First, why did Canon not include the $5 USB cord with this camera? And 2nd, why was Canon so cheap and put a bayonet mount on the lens instead of the normal thread on for filters? All filters have threads, so why would you NOT put threads on the lens? Just plain stupid.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous zoom!
Reviews.Author: Cassandra Hartley
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my beloved, much-used Kodak z981. Like the SX50, it was a beyond-the-basics point and shoot camera, meaning that you can put it in Manual setting easily.My Kodak had about 26x zoom. The Canon has 50x zoom. And it is WORTH.EVERY.PENNY! I went to a lake outside town last night after work. Geese and duck species often can be found here. I was standing about 40 feet away from the shore and got outstanding photos of wood ducks, mallards, and Canada geese. The colors are true to life and the images are crisp and clear until you get ALLLLL the way zoomed out. I had to do minimal post-processing cleanup.WORD TO THE WISE, THOUGH: You have to flip open the back screen of the camera to know what you're shooting in a hurry! Coming from the Kodak, I was used to being able to aim as I moved without having to fiddle with the screen covering, and I missed an amazing shot of a heron yesterday because I forgot about the screen. Live and learn....but I'll never make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: Does a great job
Reviews.Author: NickJ
Reviews.Content: I recently went on a 5 week trip to Hong Kong and China, and wanted a smaller, more flexible camera than my digital Nikon SLR.  I took 2,800 pictures and a dozen video clips with this camera and it fit my needs almost perfectly.  The incredible zoom capability was especially useful in two ways.  First, I can frame any shot exactly the way I want it.  With the old camera, I'd have to switch lenses or accept a shot which didn't frame the subject the way I wanted.  Second, the extra long zoom provides the ability to take candid closeups of subjects which are fairly distant.  It's also great for wildlife.  I even used it as a telescope to read signs or examine things at a distance.  The image stabilization works pretty well, though not 100% of the time.  Sometimes I would have to take a second or third shot to get a good image when on high telephoto.  The camera also compensated for low light very well up to a point.  In early evening or indoor light, sometimes pictures would come out better without a flash than with it.The video clip capability works well, but eats up a lot of space and will shut off after a few minutes.  It's really not a video camera.  A couple of negatives - the viewfinder was worthless, but the screen is bright enough to use in the sun unlike some other cameras.  Also, the video button is right where my thumb tends to rest when holding the camera, so it's easy to accidentally start a video.Overall, I'm very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera for someone wanting to start a new hobbie! This is a quality product. I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Wow, Wow, Wow!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a game changer for the camera world!  I almost got the top competitor, with a 42x, but found four independent reviews between this and the competitor and the Canon won all four.  There's no cell phone in the world that can come close to doing what this does.  Any DSLR would need a massively expensive lens to match what this 50mm can reach and you wouldn't want to hike with it!  I love everything about it!  I could go on and on echoing the positive reviews and features, and countering the negative ones with stuff like, "there's a fix for that, just move your thumb."  Make sure you get an extra battery for it - it's easy to get carried away shooting!  The "Case Logic DCB-304 Compact System/Hybrid Camera Case" is a perfect fit.

Reviews.Title: I like the camera
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: it's a good Brand, it has a good zoom , it's perfect to go everywhere, maybe in the future I can get a professional, but now I am OK.

Reviews.Title: NIce Camera!
Reviews.Author: Gerald Wendel
Reviews.Content: 24 -1200 optical Zoom!  Nice optics, I haven't had a chance to really get some good photos taken yet but I am excited.  I had a canon SX10 so it was definately time for an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: very good for starting photography
Reviews.Author: Thierry
Reviews.Content: i didnt bought this camera off amazon,but a few days ago i bought this model at a local storebefore my daughter was born i spend $300 dollar on a 16 Megapixel camera from Sony (the point and shoot type, full automatic)so my daughter is now 5 months old and i realized all of the pictures i took since birth where blurry, noisy, under exposed etc...my smartphone a samsung galaxy s4 was shooting more crisp and its only 13 megapixel, so i realized megapixel means nothingits just a marketing term, so i went to electronic shops checking out and testing some various brands and modelsalso with a not so expensive price tag in mindi stumbled uppon this model, im a complete newbie on photography and i managed in a few days following some tutorials on the internethow to take crisp and clear photos in dark rooms, artificial light, outside in the sun or when its cloudyand i managed in just 3 days to adjust iso, shutter speed, aperture manually and take very nice picturesi was really blown away how this camera handles and how the quality of my photos arethis camera has 12 megapixel and so far i was able to shoot photos that and 10x more crisp then a 16 megapixel point and shoot camerashoot your photos in raw and with canon's software you can really patch up the colors and other stufflike a professional has shot your photos

Reviews.Title: Certain I made the best choice for what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Cyril J. Stanton "Basil Fawlty"
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure - I am not a professional.  I am a serious armature who love learning about photography and improving my skills.  I currently own a Canon 7D DSLR with the kit lens and also the Canon 70-200 L F4.  I love that camera and use it when I am out on an event or outing where I really want to try to get some great pictures.  However, I decided I wanted a good light, small, bridge camera that I could use as a "grab and go" camera to use at events like Birthday parties, social gatherings, etc., where I'd like to get "good" pictures, but not out for great photography.  Just something I could keep in a small tot to have handy when I didn't feel like carrying the 7D with all it's lenses and associated trappings.I did a lot of research and it came down to this camera and  Panasonic FZ200.  Which camera takes the "best" pictures depends on which review you read, but in the end, after looking at may comparisons, the SX50 seemed to fit what I wanted.The Good:- The zoom is amazing.  And the IS is so good that I can take fairly good telephoto shots, even when hand-held.- Very fast multi-shot capability with the right SD card.- Lots of nice "Picture Type" settings that help you get a good shot under a variety of conditions, when you don't what to take the time (or don't have the time) to mess with manual settings.- Light weight, but doesn't feel "cheap"- Articulating LCD is a must!- Hot shoe for better flash- Shoots RAW!  This was a must for me!  I am starting to dabble with Photoshop and Lightroom and the ability to import RAW images was a must.  There are not many bridge cameras I found at this price point with RAW capability.- Excellent image quality, even at Telephoto distances.  It's "Only" 12MP but unless your printing huge posters, 12MP is plenty for most applications.The Bad:- Image noise when you get much above 400 - more noticeable than my 7D for sure so this Camera may not be a great choice for low light situations with no flash - a trade off I was willing to make to get the 50x zoom.- Flash does not automatically pop up.  You must lift it up manually to take a picture with flash.- The F-stop is not constant across the Zoom range.  The one thing the Panasonic I mentioned had in it's favor was a F2.8 across its full (30x) zoom.  Sine most of my shooting would be with decent light, or in situations where I could use flash, this was not a huge concern.  I can always fall back to the 7D if low light is an issue.- No USB cord.  Not going to ding it a star for this, but come on Canon, really?- The AVF (View Finder) is not the best.  Not as bad as I thought it would be based on some of the reviews I've read, but still not nearly as good as it could be.  Serve's it's purpose - just.Bottom line - I love  this camera and feel it will do just what O need it to do

Reviews.Title: Power shot SX50HS
Reviews.Author: sue schaefer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to capture wildlife and so far love it. I still have a lot to learn about the camera, wish they still would have a manual  as I do not have a computer to down load one.

Reviews.Title: Simple and amazing
Reviews.Author: Fernanda Pirmez Magalhaes
Reviews.Content: Best camera, I was in doubt about this one and the sx510. But after MANY researches with experts on the subject, I decided for this one and couldnt be more satisfied. The sx510 is nice, but I think this one can do more things and is more "pro" than the sx510. Tne SX50 HS camera has more functions, is more robust and, as I am NOT a professional photographer, this one is a great pick for a regular person who just likes a nice zoom, good photos in daily routines, trips, hd films and playing around with different photos. I would definitely recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: A Fantastic Camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Crotts
Reviews.Content: This camera was exactly what I expected - it is an awesome camera and I am extremely happy with it and the vendor I ordered it from through Amazon.com - using the TheImagimngWorld - they delivered a great product on schedule.  I have owned Canon cameras for about 8 -10 years now and they have always performed extremely well.  I did review other similar cameras to the Canon SX50, but for the most part, regarding what I was looking for , the Canon SX50 won out every time.  The picture quality, zoom quality, speed with which the camera is ready for the next picture is remarkable.  I wanted a bridge camera, opting for the more automatic options compared to a DSLR and this camera fit the bill perfectly.  Canon cameras are a great product - they are a world leader!  I have been able to zoom in to the max (by hand - no tripod) and get excellent pictures - the EVF view finder is excellent - I generally use it and not the LCD screen and it works out great - probably less battery drainage also when doing this.  The tracking options are fantastic - very easy to use it and get crisp and concise picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Amazing zoom, fast
Reviews.Author: Christine Holmes
Reviews.Content: You can't do better than this if you like an amazing zoom on a point and shoot camera.  I bought it for an extended vacation in the Rockies and got some breathtaking wildlife shots which gave me little time to do anything but turn the camera on, point, zoom and click. I have owned several Canon digital cameras and this is wonderful. I agree with other reviewers on some artifacts, but the zoom is fast, autofocus is fast and responsive, and you have plenty of scene and special effect options as well as manual control options. There is a continuous focus mode I used a LOT to track birds and animals while riding in a car, even at highway speeds. One complaint is that I hit the timer control all the time when shooting and it is very annoying. Picture quality on macro is also spectacular for nature photography. The full moon photos I got are wonderful. For the size and price, fast shutter, incredible zoom, ease of use, features, quality feel, great battery life, you can overlook some of clumsiness and take this on your next vacation. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Canon makes a great camera! Had Nikon for 30 years but made the change.
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Griffis "nyrobee2000"
Reviews.Content: After 30 years of using Nikon I bought this Canon. My wife has a SX10IS and I like it. Didn't have a camera for a few years and caught the bug again. Glad I got this one!

Reviews.Title: A worthy upgrade
Reviews.Author: Katherine Fling
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased to upgrade my number of years old Canon PowerShot, and so far I'm very happy with it.  There has been some learning curve, but the meat of the issue is that I am obtaining good, clear shots including nice close macro shots of textiles (my main reason for purchase), as well as good general shots.  I look forward to spending some time learning to use the bells and whistles.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: C.DEARAUJO
Reviews.Content: I am not a pro but I am in love with this camera! The nice thing is you don't have to be a pro to take nice pictures with this camera! I breed dogs so I am constantly taking photos of very active and wiggly puppies and sometimes in low light and this camera takes beautiful photos with very little light and the shutter speed is fast so I don't miss those special moments with my puppies.

Reviews.Title: Many features
Reviews.Author: Bruce L. Chandler "Greyfox"
Reviews.Content: Haven't had the time to really check out all the features on this camera yet, other than sort of cursory.  So many!  I doubt I'll ever learn everything this camera can do. However, so far so good.  The only thing I wished Canon would have done, is to provide a written manual instead of having to go online to  either print it (some 280 pages) yourself of try to browse through it on one's own.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Earlayne Chance
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying getting to know my Canon camera....so many options available... it will take a while to figure them all out!

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Edward L. Pesanti Jr. "ep"
Reviews.Content: A good replacement for the similkar one that I left in a cab - never to see again.  Impressive zoom, decent images -especially if edited with Topoz Denoise.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Lisa A.
Reviews.Content: Love my PowerShot SX50!!  I've put away my Nikon D50!  This is easy to use and the clarity is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: This Camera is really great
Reviews.Author: Juan B.
Reviews.Content: I buy it and when i finally learn how to use it, and how to take pictures properly, i enjoy it so much in my journeys, is really great all that you can do, see and immortalize with this awesome Camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: R. Mumma "RM"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my M-I-L who is not a techy and she really likes it. Very easy to use for a novice photographer and takes great stills & video. Also has many many advanced settings for total adjustability. Its a great camera when compared to similar models from other manufacturers. Zoom is clear and stability aid is helpful. For a point & shoot compact its a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Recall
Reviews.Author: Michael Donner
Reviews.Content: Camera takes very good pictures. After using it for 2 weeks we find out the eye view window is recalled due to wrong chemical placed in plastic. We sent back not wanting to mess with getting fixed as we had less than a month.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: David E. Arnold "dea"
Reviews.Content: The camera was recalled for problems the day after Christmas. If this is an omen of its abilities, I, and the camera's recipient as a Christmas present, will be unhappy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice of Camera
Reviews.Author: Oliver J.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Cannon Camera because a neighbor of mine has one. I used it at Christmas time and was convinced that this is the Camera that I wanted to purchase for a long time. There are so many Cameras on the market that I was confused as to which one would fit my needs. When I had the chance to use the one that my neighbor owns I was sold on it and ordered one the next day. It takes beautiful pictures. The zoom is great because it allows me to get a close up shot without my being close up. I just love this Cannon Camera. I now consider it my Christmas present to myself.

Reviews.Title: Great piece of gear!
Reviews.Author: Phil Buglass
Reviews.Content: I am still learning to use this, but it is a wonderful machine.  The 'reach' on the zoom lens is just unbelievable.  There are many pictures available around the net of the moon taken with the sx50, and it fills most of the frame.  I have photos of squirrels up in trees, and with the wide-angle look, you cannot see them at all.  Zoomed in, you can fill the frame with the head and shoulders alone.If you want to equal this with a dslr, be prepared to spend at least 10 times the price.  Would the pictures be better?  Sure, but I say again, 10 times the price!One of my best purchases ever...

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: PaulyPrint
Reviews.Content: In general it's just what i expected, a good quality camera with a high power optical zoom. I am very pleased. It doesn't come with the computer cable to down load the pictures,but it's just a standard small usb cable you might already have. It's the same one as the sony play station 3 uses to charge the hand controllers. I already had it,no problem. The Battery pack seams to last a long time. It only comes with one battery so, I am going to buy another one to keep as a spare. The pictures look great! the camera has a auto mode, it is great! it kicks in the macro automatically when needed. It is a camera I would recommend, if you are looking for this type of camera. It's not a slim unit, It's got a very powerful lens.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera but amazon dropped the ball
Reviews.Author: Mike Powers "katydid"
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her husband got this camera when the had their first baby this past summer. I was so impressed with it so I ordered one too. The zoom and clarity it amazing.  I have no complaints with the camera--but amazon advertised it including a 16gb CD card and when I received it there was no card. Another customer complained about the same thing. I contacted amazon and they said it didn't come with one when it clearly stated what would be in the box. I have to travel an hour to town and back to get this package and got home and no card so no using it this evening. Had I known I would have gotten a card in town. I thought amazon would have at least credited my account.

Reviews.Title: Very fun camera
Reviews.Author: awn
Reviews.Content: I've been enjoying the amazing zoom and the slow motion video.  This has been a very enjoyable camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: cannon sx50
Reviews.Author: Scott Bayless
Reviews.Content: I recommend this camera for anyone who doesn't want to spend a boat load on a camera.this camera takes wonderful photos and is easy to use

Reviews.Title: GREAT  camera
Reviews.Author: Linda Anderson
Reviews.Content: Great camera. No problems with battery running out or any difficulty with extended lenses..beautiful photo's. Only wish a book came with camera instead of computer disk as you have to keep going back to different things in order to learn how to do a new thing with the camera. The camera is well worth the money

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be more pleased
Reviews.Author: Scott Leavitt
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Kenya/Tanzania, and could not have been more pleased with how this camera performed.  Actually had all the folks with the very expensive DSL cameras jealous with the quality of photos I got with the Powershot's 50x zoom - crystal clear! Individual hairs of a lion's fur....got it.Individual teeth in a hippo's mouth....no problem.Rich colors of a sunset....yup.Switch to video without looking up....absolutely.(the VG Laurel DSLR Camera Case was a perfect match for it)

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: What I can say is this camera was my saving grace on a recent vacation; I usually shoot with a Sony A77 but it was out for service and not coming back in time as planned. So this was my only option given the circumstances. When you fine tune the settings the images come out very good. Its light weight and I used it most like a SLR with the viewfinder instead of the LCD screen. Plenty of options for those who like to manually make adjustments and easy to carry around. I cant get too deep into the specifics of this camera other than saved the vacation and I walked away with very nice pictures. See the link below for pictures taken with this camera (post-processing involved).[...]

Reviews.Title: More compact that the SX20
Reviews.Author: Tough Nut
Reviews.Content: We have just acquired the SX50 after losing our older SX20 to the TSA at Logan Airport.  I haven't had a chance to put it through any paces but expecting it to be similar to the older camera.  It is quite bit more compact.  50X will be amazing, 20X at the time was amazing.  Didn't come with USB cable or SD card, which might have added $10 for Canon. And missed the warning (if there was one) that you were going to need to order those items separately.  A 4GB card will hold/take 1000 pictures.  Just ordered two 16GB high speed cards to see if the picture taking speeds up.  Some concerns about low light shooting, but don't do much of that.  I liked the (4) AA batteries the old one used for convenience, after discovering the Sanyo eneloops.  But our experience with LI in other devices has been excellent so not too worried.  The price is maybe $150 less than the earlier version and reviews have it performing better than the SX40 in most regards.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: William Henderson
Reviews.Content: I love the zoom feature on this camera. I'm still learning how to use the camera but so fa so good.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the money
Reviews.Author: Grandpa45
Reviews.Content: We got this camera to replace a Canon Rebel SLR... I don't remember the exact model number.  This one is definitely nice and we love the video function.  We use it for some short 20 - 90 second videos.  The pictures that we have taken are very clear and I would say they compare to our old SLR, but I'm not exactly a professional photographer.  I do have a couple of complaints though.  It seems like it takes a while to focus before it takes the picture.  There have been a few times in low light where I tried to get a picture of one of the grand kids and by the time it finally clicked, they had moved.  The only other complaint is the battery doesn't seem to last as long as out old camera.  Maybe the different technology on this one just uses more battery than the old camera, I'm not sure.  I'll just make sure we carry a spare battery when we take it, not a huge deal.  The zoom on this thing is amazing!

Reviews.Title: Smart camera
Reviews.Author: Kati
Reviews.Content: I had the first of this series, the Canon Powershot SX10. When I was ready for a new camera, the SX50 was the natural choice. I am very happy with it, it can do everything I wanted and some more.

Reviews.Title: Loooong lens.
Reviews.Author: fiverider
Reviews.Content: This more than meets my needs for nature photography. The ability to get the long shot. Would greatly appreciate more night time flexibility. Canon's 'wheel' adjustment is still lacking in ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Sergio de la Madrid
Reviews.Content: Great camera, for those that don't want to spend top buck on a DSLR. This one, as many have stated is a great family camera. I am just learning all the features it has, it takes great video and the picture images. I am just starting as an amateur photographer and I am very happy with. It does have some issues with taking pictures at night, but you just have to adjust your ISO and settings accordingly. Not a DSLR quality but close, Read reviews throughout the internet, watch reviews on youtube. As a hint, buy an extra battery, the video mode takes a toll on power. Absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good crisp images
Reviews.Author: Scott Brinckerhoff
Reviews.Content: This camera has a learning curve, especially to take advantage of all the unbelievable features.  We have gotten some stunning results out of it, and the zoom is all it promises.  The viewfinder is not nearly as good as on my 7D, but that's a camera that costs almost four times what this one does.  I paired the Powershot up with an inexpensive Vivatar wireless remote that provides a way of taking bird shots with the camera on a tripod, from long ranges.  Camera is well worth the money, and the learning adventure is fun.

Reviews.Title: big zoom
Reviews.Author: larry a smith
Reviews.Content: I have taken over 10,000 photos with my camera so far and am still learning how to use it. I have taken some amazing bird shots with it that would have been impossible without spending 100's of $ more.

Reviews.Title: The best zoom ever!!
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: The zoom is so good I had people ask me if I took my moon pictures through a telescope!!!! The cost was good too.  I have a Canon T3 rebel and it would have cost 1600 to buy a lens of equal zoom capacity.  I love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50
Reviews.Author: Vibrarian "Ginger"
Reviews.Content: Just what I needed as my previous, next step down Canon PowerShot just wore out.  However, I'm finding it is very sensitive to movement.  It is amazing on zoom shots.  Craters on the moon smile at me!!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Z. Wilcox "End User"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! The zoom is kick-ass! Pictures are very high quality. Easy to use. I can't put it down!

Reviews.Title: Useful Viewfinder
Reviews.Author: AQS
Reviews.Content: Much has been said about the picture quality of the sx50 which I can confirm in my limited use. From iso 80 to 1600 the results are quite amazing for a small sensor camera. Perhaps more amazing is the sharpness and clarity at full zoom, i.e. 1200mm equivalent. What is phenomenal is the ability to get sharp results handheld at this focal length!In my experience the sx50 evf, despite its dire specifications, is actually quite usable after adjusting the adjacent diopter wheel, and is invaluable in bright conditions.

Reviews.Title: nice camera cool look!
Reviews.Author: Hector Valles
Reviews.Content: this camera is for my wife. she love the super zoom and the look-like pro camera .its totally auto for the pics and is very fast so is nice not to lose the faces of my daughters, always happen with the cel phone camera. the flash is a little small I think but to close pics it ok, the good thing is it have a hot point for external and bigger flash. The battery life is good enough to take a lot of pictures before it drain. it will be good a Wi-Fi conection o something like that but for the price I guess is ok. about the price I get this with the case and a 32g memory for about 30 $ less that the price of best buy (camera only) so it was a pretty good deal

Reviews.Title: Best non SLR on the market
Reviews.Author: Jerry T. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I  have had all of the SX series and the SX50 is the best yet. The zoom lens is great and this camera has all of the features that you could want. I do a lot of wildlife pics and this camera fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Top of the line super-zoom point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: J. Maher
Reviews.Content: This is top of the line for what it is: a super-zoom point and shoot camera. The lens is excellent, providing great range and a nice wide-angle when not extended. Low-light performance is good. Don't expect this camera to defy the laws of light and optics. There are many reviews that provide substantial details about how well the camera operates. Read through those before deciding this is what you are looking for. It will take some time to filter through all of the information in the .pdf of the operations guide to understand and utilize the full potential of the camera but you can take great pictures right from the start in auto mode in decent light.

Reviews.Title: definitely pick this one.
Reviews.Author: Lisa Gonzales
Reviews.Content: this camera is the leading edge of canon`s territory. we took it on vacation with us. and literally used it as a telescope. and when we wanted, just clicked the photo. great price on camera too..  I recommend this camera, above any slr.

Reviews.Title: Love my new baby
Reviews.Author: kelley
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a chance to really see what this thing can do, but I have been able to play with it a little and I love it. It takes amazing pictures that look crisp and professional. I took video of my daughter's performance and the quality is great!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: crobin1
Reviews.Content: Great camera but I did have some initial problems. I love Canon cameras and have always had Canon. This one that I received was slightly defective. There was an issue with the white balance going from outside daylight to indoors. The display would not change and the screen looked whitewashed. I also notice that when I took a picture of something that was perfectly clear in the display, the actual was coming out a little blurry. This was mostly on far away shots. I returned my camera but am strongly considering getting another one just like it. I may have just gotten a bad one which is always a possibility with electronics. I have the SX20IS right now and was upgrading. The SX50 is still a new Camera and maybe they don't have all the bugs worked out yet.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: Keith M. Corey
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the features you need unless you are a professional photographer. The zoom is insane and I have taken multiple shots full zoom without a tripod and the pictures have little to no noise. Overall solid camera.

Reviews.Title: great ZOOM
Reviews.Author: RDavid3748
Reviews.Content: First off, thank you so much to Sammy Camera. they went out of the way to correct issue with shipping due to FEDEX driver.  this camera is amazing, the zoom is just outstanding.  SX50 allows you to zoom in so close, unlike a DSLR, no switching lenses which makes me a happy father taking pics and video from my children performances.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point-n-shoot camera !!
Reviews.Author: Allin2max
Reviews.Content: Another home run from Canon ! Packs most of the features that an amatuer would desire in an DSLR along with a 50X zoom, which is perfect for a novice photographer. The auto-focus is the icing on the cake, that takes care of hard to focus far-away objects.Excellent point-n-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: More than meets Expectations!
Reviews.Author: April Simpson
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful photos and lives up to all my expectations. Easy to use! Zooming capabilities are awsome!! Very well made.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: Tarik Johnson
Reviews.Content: Fabulous camera, definitely good deal to have such featured by that price. With this one I am now retiring a Nikon, an Olympus and a Pentax. Will just keep my pocket-size Sony besides this Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: T. Harper
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I have 2 other smaller Canon cameras so I was familiar with their OS. I'm glad I picked this item.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Bryan Beckman
Reviews.Content: It takes wonderful pictures at long distances.  I love the zoom lens.  The battery life seems to be very good too.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeronimo
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, great zoom, great for sports, nice size, perfect screen, fantastic camera, great option and I`m very satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Nanu
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  The zoom is awesome!  I am getting beautiful wildlife pictures with relative ease.  Still trying to learn some of the features, but the auto mode is wonderful meanwhile.  I'm getting the zoom down, now just need to learn the super close stuff...this is a really fun camera.  The battery charges up very quickly too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my needs.
Reviews.Author: Michele Vagle
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, easy to use. Takes great action and still shots as well.The quality of my printed pics far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Superb
Reviews.Author: Terry L. Stanaway
Reviews.Content: Lens is fantastic.  Takes great pics, able to have some creativity.  Really enables you to get pics you could not get with other cameras.

Reviews.Title: sx50
Reviews.Author: melvin short
Reviews.Content: met all my expectations with no problem, i would recommend it to anyone thinking of purchasing a bridge camera.  i would say only one step down from a aps-c camera

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Steven Herrera
Reviews.Content: Had it for 3 months & it works great!  Lots of fun features if you want to take the time to learn them.  I wish it had a vintage setting though.  I can't find it if it does.  Light compared to the EOS.

Reviews.Title: third time's a charm
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: The first one was sent back due to a minor problem .  the second one was sent refurbished by accident. the third one was perfect. The camera is amazing. it takes beautiful pictures, zoom is amazing, HD movies, slow motion is unbelievable. Just buy it you will not regret it

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but!
Reviews.Author: Hawk
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about six months now and as for the bridge cameras it holds its own as far as very good image quality, great zoom and great image quality on up to the 1200. The only thing that I found was the video button is right by the thumb rest and unknowingly I've hit that button and had several videos of the ground as I was walking. The view finder does not give a good image, but, the pic's come out great anyways. I have read that Canon is coming out with an improvement for the SX50. Has anyone out there heard this also, if so what info do you have?Hawk

Reviews.Title: canon powersshot sx-50 Hs camera
Reviews.Author: Traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera and I do not regret buying it.......Has a wonderful zoom and takes professional pictuures. A friend of my was next to me in a religious activity and was suprised........She thought it was a professional camera.........

Reviews.Title: Camera bug
Reviews.Author: w.j.constantine
Reviews.Content: light in weight, easy to use and takes great pictures.have recommendedthis item to all my friends. Have taken a varity of pictures and am wellpleased with the results.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Tarcila Mariana
Reviews.Content: I loved.I was looking for a good camera with a good price a long time ago.This Canon was a good price and delivered fast!I am using and I reallyn loved.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: victue82
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before a recent family vacation to the mountains. It was easy to use and took great shots. The telephoto lens was so powerful we were able to use it to identify and photograph objects several miles away. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good price on great product.
Reviews.Author: Stephen W Lewis
Reviews.Content: Way better in low light than my old Canon.  The  50x optical zoom is both more wide angle and way more zoom.  I'd recommend at least a mono pod for using the high zoom!  I didn't realize how much bigger the LCD screen was...I like!  Plus it's swivel option is one of the reasons I love canon.  You can hold the zoom at high or low angles or even for self portraits or even around a cornerand still see it perfectly.  I love shooting candid shots by holding the camera at a right angle to my face and taking a shot when others don't think you can see what you're shooting.  Only down side is it is a bit larger and heavier than my old Canon PS2IS.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: S. Reynaud
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price, amazing zoom lens, improved menu navigation over my last Canon camera, Very fully featured. Easy to use.  The lithium battery is far better than the old AA rechargeable batteries. I am very pleased with the overall performance of this camera, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: OBillyBob
Reviews.Content: Even a stupid person will take professional looking pictures. I am taking amazing pictures and I did not even read the manual. Very intuitive. It is worth every dollar spent.

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: LUCINDA
Reviews.Content: I brought this work only the employee who use it love this camera, and the picture quality looks great the color and images look very sharp

Reviews.Title: Nice HDR Camera
Reviews.Author: R. V. Cadena "Arkantos"
Reviews.Content: Easy to Use Digic 5 camera, don't forget to buy the USB cable, memory, tripod :pIt is fast, reliable.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Fabiano Perina
Reviews.Content: Works pretty well and the camera was according I was expect to. Pretty nice zoom and stabilization is the differential.

Reviews.Title: excellent product I recommend.
Reviews.Author: Antonio Martinez C.
Reviews.Content: excellent product I recommend. descricciones fulfilled with all that mentioned in advertising and expectations that I had thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: Birthday present he loved
Reviews.Author: Laurel
Reviews.Content: My husband has only started to learn to use this camera, but he's delighted already at the clarity of the pictures.  And for a man who won't read directions to pick it up and start shooting in 2 minutes, I'd say they designed the camera well.  It wasn't exactly "unbox and go"; I did have to charge the battery the night before and  a mem card separately.  Still, it's a fabulous camera and we're both really happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, so far
Reviews.Author: Michael I Walsh
Reviews.Content: I like the vivid color, the crisp focus and the ease of operation.  Low light shots are difficult.  Still learning to use the camera.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: D. Barnhill
Reviews.Content: This camera is a replacement for the Canon SX40. It takes beautiful photos even on the fully automatic setting. The auto focus is much quicker and more accurate than the sx 40. Of course the huge zoom lens is wonderful. This camera takes great low light photos. I have taken many indoor photos using existing light and all have come out great. I do not like flash photos and it is rarely ever needed with the SX50. I very highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Best little point and shoot for the $$
Reviews.Author: M. Abney "msabney"
Reviews.Content: Normally, I shoot Nikon but I needed a camera I could take with me kayaking and hiking without lugging my pro gear all over putting my equipment at risk. This camera has met almost every expectation I had. The impressive zoom will really go all out and has a reach that far exceeds my pro tele lens. I use this a LOT for birding. I was able to nicely photograph baby eagles in the nest from at least 600 or more feet away with a lot of detail. There are a lot of pros with the SX50. It's lightweight, great zoom, focuses well. It's best use is in full sun. It is really hard to get the shutter speed up on days with lesser lighting. The ISO can be cranked up but I have found this camera to lose image quality quickly with ISO over 200. Indoors with the flash it does a pretty good job also. The flash isn't very powerful though. The most aggravating thing I found is the dimness of the viewfinder. I was used to the clarity of my gear so that has been a switch for me. That would be one thing I would really suggest Canon upgrade on future models in this series. For what I use this camera for, I am happy with it. It doesn't replace the dslrs I work with on a pro basis. Keeping in mind the limitations and for what I use if for, I and quite a few other personal friends of mine, are very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Sports Camera
Reviews.Author: Picartist "Pastalover2"
Reviews.Content: I spent about eight hours testing this camera for it's sports capabilities.  I shot fast moving jet skis, boats, etc and in quick rapid fire succession at full zoom it stopped the action. If you are looking for a camera to shoot the kids playing sports, then this is a great buy. If all you want is to take snapshots, then spend less.

Reviews.Title: Great for zooming in
Reviews.Author: J. Haggerty "Radar1"
Reviews.Content: I have a couple of digital cameras that were considered "superzoom" at the time. One was 12X and the other was 30x. This one is 50x optical zoom, which has helped me create some great close up shots of far away scenes and birds.Both my former cameras were plagued by slow shutter lag, so the picture I took was sometimes not the picture I got, and then the recovery time before I could take the next shot was too slow for wildlife or aviation shots.This camera has a quick shutter and very fast recovery time so I can take the next shot quickly. No longer do I take a shot of  bird and then realize that the bird has flown off before the camera shows anything in the viewfinder again. Now I can take a shot of the bird, and then take a shot of the same bird lifting off.Sometimes when you are at maximum zoom, it could be hard to find what you were looking at because you may have moved the camera, but the Canon helps solve that problem by supplying a button that will zoom out to a wider field momentarily so you can find the subject again, and then it zooms back in. Great feature!Batter life is great, over 500 photos on our 4 day weekend camping trip and the battery still didn't show as needing a charge.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Holly Allin
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect middle road camera-between a small point and shoot and an SLR. The 50x zoom is amazing and very stable even when zoomed in at low light.The monitor is super easy to see even in bright daylight but viewing through the viewfinder makes it even nicer. Using the diopter to adjust for those who need "reading glasses" is a phenomenal feature.I love the articulating monitor. It lets me see what I am looking at from above a crowd, around a corner (stealth-like), or from my lap where no one knows I am taking photos and therefore they still act natural. It is even lighter weight and slightly smaller  than the earlier models with lesser zoom ranges (i.e. SX30IS). I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: VERY comfortable
Reviews.Author: John R. Armantrout "arma9628"
Reviews.Content: this camera is easy to hold & it takes great pictures. Very clear. I have not tried the video yet. But I expect it will be the same quality. So far, I'm quite impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Louisette belanger
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Tough to get accessories at reasonable prices. Having problem finding adaptor ring that fits the lens for filters.

Reviews.Title: So super excellent
Reviews.Author: Ashley Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. It works great for snapping "fast" moving sports pictures of my 5-year olds soccer team or nice family shots. I can always guarantee to get a good photo of my always on the move 3 year old. The zoom is insane. You tube this bad boy!

Reviews.Title: Wonderfull
Reviews.Author: Claudinha
Reviews.Content: Exceeded my expectations. Great camera for beginners. Was an indication of friends and take this opportunity to also indicate. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: It does the job :)
Reviews.Author: AnneMarieHRo
Reviews.Content: I needed this camera for video blogging and also to make pictures. You might think "ok... for vlogging you can purchase a cheaper camera" but I won't invest in a camera just for that. This camera has a greeeeat zoom! Last night I pointed at a far building and used the 50X zoom. it was amazing. I took me a while to stop shaking the camera so it could focus, but when I did, the picture came ot perfect. Also took a few pictures of my dog with a beautiful closeup and the camera did a great job. Tried with a video and zoomed while filming and there was no noise at all!! At least I could not hear it. Video quality and sound were great. I am not a Pro Photographer, but I loove to take pictures everywhere I go and this camera is not heavy, and is easy to carry, so its great for taking pictures while going out for a walk. The Con i have for this type of camera is that they cannot go into the water and I also take lots of pictures on vacations, but for that I have my Olympus Though Camera ;)Happy Shopping!

Reviews.Title: Great camera....BUT!
Reviews.Author: Peter J. Coldagelli "Pistol Pete"
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I decided that this was the way to go. The versatility alone is incredible, and I'm just getting started. Takes a beautiful picture with the lens all stretched out. All you need is a steady hand, and I mean steady! (Bought a mono-pod for it, but haven't tried it out yet.) Functions are easy enough to figure out, and the ergonomics are tremendous. You'll like the "gnarled" thumb grip. The only reason I didn't give it a "5" is Canon chinced on a manual and a shoe cover for the light attachment. Keep in mind that the manual is 276 pages! You can find the manual on Canon's website, but that's a butt load of printing. They also make a "cheat sheet", but the print is so small, you can hardly read it. C'mon Canon! Step up! Overall, a great "hybrid" camera. I would recommend it to anyone that is looking for a great all around camera that has incredible zoom. That's the highlight of the camera!

Reviews.Title: Canon is #1
Reviews.Author: D. Litcher
Reviews.Content: I made a serious mistake and bought a Nikon a couple years ago.  I had always had Canons before that.  I had to go back to Canon and this camera is incredible.  In spite of its multitude of capabilities, it is still fairly easy to use and get the results you want.  I just love it.

Reviews.Title: The Best of the Powershot SX line !! Zoom To Spare
Reviews.Author: Oscar Levant "Bruce T"
Reviews.Content: I have had the SX10, SX20, SX30, and onward. This obviously is the best of the bunch. The addition of a RAW option completes this experience for me. You would spend many thousands of dollars get¬ting a similar optical zoom hooked onto your DSLR body for similar effects. Admitted this is a Powershot point-and-shoot camera and as such its sensor has its limitations. You are not going to get the visual clarity of a T3i, T4i, T5i, etc. But for a relatively inexpensive zoom "bridge" camera, this does the job quite nicely. I am especially pleased with the battery capability. Prior models have required AA's, but the lighter, proprietary battery makes the SX50 much lighter to tote. I picked up several extra batteries on line for cheap and they work just well as the official Canon ones. Optical stabilization is very helpful, especially when using the lens out to its full zoom lengths. Digital zoom is fun to play with, but you don't use it for anything other than seeing the moons of Jupiter (which I have done). The vari-angle LCD is a little bigger and makes shooting in the dark much easier.  The drawbacks?  It has a slower lens that some others in this category, so low light photography is not so great. Considering its other features, though, it's a bargain for what Canon has packed into it. After almost a year's use, it's still my favorite. Highest recommendations the SX50 HS, especially at the price I see now.

Reviews.Title: SX 50 review
Reviews.Author: shelzane
Reviews.Content: A great camera. Now I have to learn how to use it. Sharp pictures. Needs a tripod for far away zooming. Light weight. Good price. Rapid delivery.5 stars!!

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've had
Reviews.Author: TxAggie
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this camera. I primarily use it for taking videos and it is fabulous. I use a Mac and upload to YouTube. No problems with compatibility

Reviews.Title: Canon Rocks
Reviews.Author: Grannie
Reviews.Content: Really like this camera.  I'm no pro by any measure but I like the zoom on this camera.  I like taking shots of the birds at my feeder and my grandchildren playing their sports.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase for the Amateur
Reviews.Author: W. Graffius
Reviews.Content: Missing a few bells and whistles, but I did not want a professional model. Pleased with purchaseand its ability to perform as I intended.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely excellent camera and photo quality
Reviews.Author: William Hatfield
Reviews.Content: The camera presents a tough learning curve as the users manual is not very good at explaining how one setting affects or interacts with another.  I also use a Canon 40D and a 7D and they are more user friendly with many videos available covering most aspects of the Cameras..  Since Canon does not include a Users Manual (Its on a CD) they at least should produce a good video/tutorials in their learning library.. I would have given this review 5 stars with some decent learning tools.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift and they love it. Easy to handle, great size, take awsome photos and is user friendly!

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot Sx50 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 50X Wide-Angle Opitical
Reviews.Author: Tommy Tummy
Reviews.Content: I very impressed with the pictures that I have taken with the camera.  I use it mainly for outdoors and the zoom is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Boomer78
Reviews.Content: Researched our options a lot before deciding on this camera.  Decided that we weren't ever going to become anything more than novice photographers and that a point-and-shoot would serve our needs best.  This camera exceeded our expectations.  The rapid fire function is impressive and the zoom is unbelievable.  Well worth the month.

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This camera is great love canon won't use any other brand for a camera the picture quality is great nice and clear the zoom is great to works very well

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: ree frazier
Reviews.Content: Camera is great, really love it.  The first camera was defected and returned.  The second camera was working then the little card (that holds the pictures) would not lock in.  The people at Amazon have been so helpful and gracious.  I could not have asked for a better experience and superior assistance with my returns.Thank you.  I will recommend Amazon and plan to use your services in the future.  Customer assistance is a dying feature of the industry, so glad to see that it still exists at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: i like it but found a couple features that are disappointing
Reviews.Author: snapping hobby
Reviews.Content: raw is not available for auto modeauto mode is the only mode with the anti-shake featurewould like to have more options in the scene mode

Reviews.Title: Good Value Camera
Reviews.Author: David Jenkins
Reviews.Content: The SX50 allowed me to take great pictures on back country trails while on horse back.  It was light and had most of the functionality of my T2i.

Reviews.Title: canon power shot SX50 HS is a winner
Reviews.Author: Cheryl J Godon
Reviews.Content: Great photo quality & easy to use.  Love the movable LCD screen especially in bright light.  Battery life could be better.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Jehiel Zif "PEMBERTON"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a previous Canon Power shot.I like the camera, the zoom and the quality of picture.I would have liked a better viewfinder.

Reviews.Title: It makes me feel like I am a real Photogrpher, get it and you will love it.
Reviews.Author: Potiphar
Reviews.Content: I can't get over the fantastic sharpness, near perfect exposure, this Camera provides in AUTO setting.  A true "Point and Shoot" and I am just beginning to understand all, well most, of the Functions.  Don't let all the Whistles and Bells Scare you, if you are just wanting to take pictures of friends and family, you will look like an expert.  You may become addicted and really get into what all this Camera can do, even at long distances it is incredible.  I have shots of a nesting Bald Eagle from 200+ feet where you can count feather and pick out the smallest detail.  The Camera will take a huge 32 Gb card but an 8 Gb is plenty,  just be sure it is a fast one like a SanDick Extreme HD Video.  I also purchased the Two Pack Battery and Charger Kit which was an excellent choice as it is small and works well.  The Case (none comes with the Camera, Booo) which is listed in the "Buy Together" really doesn't fit the Camera well.  While it is well made, It is a tight and awkward  fit and made worse by the Neck strap, you may look at my review, I'm looking for a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50
Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: Best camera purchase I ever made.Highly recommend !!!!!! Quality is perfect and the zoom is incredible. Very easy to use and learn.

Reviews.Title: Best of its class
Reviews.Author: Emrah guclu
Reviews.Content: Before buying it I read most of the reviews on the net but I didn't get to test it myself. The only down thing on device is its aperture rates goes down while you zoom more. Alas it's video and picture quality is very good to its competitors.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use out of the box.  I am very happy with the quality of the photos (even at maximum zoom).  Haven't had much time with it as yet, but very optimistic for lots of great use!

Reviews.Title: Love my Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Black Cat Ravyn "Erin" "Cats Rule!"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a few reasons.1. I needed a good camera to take nice pictures of products for my company, takes nice close up pictures and can really get all the details of the product.2. I needed a good camera that had a really good stabilizer, since my hands shake pretty bad.3. My parents have cameras that are just a few years older (one is about 2 years and the other is about 5 or 6 years older) then this model and both my parents are happy with them.I use the camera mostly for my company but I have taken this camera out twice, once to the LA Zoo and took beautiful shots of the animals; and then out to Disneyland. Taking pictures on the Train was a snap, clear non blurred pictures while moving. I played around on it to figure out the correct shutter speed, but otherwise I am loving this camera

Reviews.Title: Great Camera "the lens is amazing"
Reviews.Author: Hopeful
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for the wife for a seabourne cruise along the Norwegian coast. She hasn't complained - yet.Great camera the zoom is amazing takes a good photo.  A little larger than I thought however the camera features are easy to use.  The camera lens zoom is worth the price alone

Reviews.Title: Astounding..Pictures & Features
Reviews.Author: Daniel A. Garrett "Mr. Wizard"
Reviews.Content: I just got my Canon Powershot SX50 HS from Amazon.com. This camera is totally awesome. I have the predessor SX20is and I was very happy with my old Canon. The comliments I got for the pics I took with the SX20is were multiple due to the outstanding quality of the photos. I took my new Canon out for a test drive today. I am blown away by my new Canon. I was speechless when I saw my 1st pics. Total ease of use is incredible. The zoom is just plain miraculous. I can see objects in my pics that were not visible to the naked eye. The only negative comment I have to say regarding this incredible camera is that Canon should have kept the use of AA batteries as opposed to the propriatery Canon 10L Lithium Ion battery. I overcame this handicap by purchasing 2 more stand-by batteries. I would not want to be out on a shoot and run out of juice. I doubt this is going to happen with a total of 3 batteries on board.I have decided to keep my old Canon as it is still a gr8 camera and a nice back-up to my New and totally awesome SX50 HS. I've been into photography for a long time. I remember having a mirrored Rokor 300mm fixed focus lens and I thought it was awe inspiring. My Canon SX50 HS with its incredible ZOOM is much better !!!I'm a very happy camper with my new Canon.. Of course I will tell all of my friends about this new & wonderful camera from Canon :)

Reviews.Title: best zoom around
Reviews.Author: whenr01
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price with a zoom that is hard to believe until you use it. I like using the zoom when there is a full moon and you will not believe the pics it takes it is like you are only few miles away from the moon.

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: teco
Reviews.Content: best camera ever relly i don't have more word is just amazing simple to use, exelent picture super zoom, and you don't have to spen allot of money in lenses, JUST THE BEST

Reviews.Title: Our new camera -- a great gift to each other
Reviews.Author: CRB
Reviews.Content: The quality of pictures we have taken so far has far exceeded our expectations.  We live in the country and like to take shots of the wildlife on our property and the beautiful views and skies seen from our home.  We have had marvelous results with this relatively affordable camera, which was recommended to us by the owner of a local camera repairman.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Enrique Anton Raffo Pozo
Reviews.Content: Compared with my former camera, a Canon SX30, this one has a lot of improvements so I am really happy with it. Great pictures, great zoom and lot of options for a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent non-professional camera
Reviews.Author: Jose L Vazquez Velazquez
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few weeks ago for my wife.  She is not photographer but enjoys taking pictures.  The quality of the pictures taken is awesome.  It has a very good buit in flash and the zoom is stunning.  but if you really like taking full manual control of the pictures, this is not the right camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom
Reviews.Author: Lisa K. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I bought the SX40 this time last year and have been very pleased with the results.When I saw Canon had brought out the  SX50 I was curious as to the changes. I bought it for Christmas and I am a big fan of the zoom.I took a picture of a Kingfisher which I saw land on a tree way in the distance.  I could only see it with my binoculars. I pointed the camera in the same direction and zoomed in.  The focus was excellent and I was able to crop the photo on the computer to get a really close sharp picture. I was delighted with the result.I mainly photograph wildlife, especially birds, in good light. I haven't had the need to bother with anything in low light.I've had many different cameras over the years, all with attachable lenses, but now I have severe arthritis in my hands it's impossible for me to deal with all the extra equipment.  This camera is ideal for my situation. It's light to carry and easy to manage and I'm very happy with the results.However, on the negative side, I don't like the push button to switch it on and off.What was Canon thinking NOT to include the lead for the camera?  For we, who own the previous model it's not a problem, but it seems very short sighted to ask someone to spend $400.00 plus, and then expect them to have to buy a lead.The SX50 includes a basic instruction book, but it would be nice to see the next model include both the lead and a proper instruction book.If you are used to a good solid camera,and can manage the extra lenses this is not for you, but for convenience and comfort, it's a nice little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great if you don't own a full DSLR
Reviews.Author: Word Seeker "Jayne"
Reviews.Content: I really would havegiven this 3.5 stars, so keep that in mind. It's probably the best point and shoot I've ever used, dut it definitely won't replace my Nikon D5200.  The 50x zoom is fantastic. It also performs well under low light conditions. But for someone who is used to quickly adjusting focal length and focus, this camera is as slow as any other point and shoot with zooming in and out. I missed several good shots when I was out birding because of this. So don't plan on using it if you AND the subject are potentially moving. Then I tried it for an event at my church where lighting was less than ideal. The pics were great!So bottom line is: If you already use a little pocket point and shoot, this is a huge step up. But if you own a full DSLR with exchangeable lenses, etc., you'll spend more time noticing what you *can't* do than what you can.

Reviews.Title: Bit heavy, but I asked for the zoom!
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: Canon SX50HS is a super-zoom and it does what it promises, and does it well. I have to admit, though, that many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the whole picture.The SX50HS is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 12.1 resolution (megapixels), and x50 zoom! The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CMOS-type. That is just a number, but one that matters. Most point and shoots have a 1/2.3 inch sensor, so this is pretty standard.It has a viewfinder, which most point & shoots don't. The ISO rating is 6400 which makes it work better in low light. You will see chromatic aberrations much before 6400. But you don't need this high ISO unless you specialize. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. The camera gives you the option to control manually both the exposure and the focus. It has an external flash option, but the built-in flash should suffice under most situations. The LCD screen has a 461,000 resolution, which makes for convenient viewing. The camera allows RAW processing which would matter if you did not want to be limited by JPEG storage only. The burst rate is 2.2 frames per second. This is a heavier camera weighing 595 grams. The weight is a function of the big zoom. Compared to other big zoom cameras, the weight is not excessive and certainly not a liability.Overall, nice camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Great for long zooms, but
Reviews.Author: Ken Drake "KD"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this from Best Buy for two reasons, one they would price match Amazon and two the ease of returns. Now the price is even lower on Amazon in less than 10 days, so much for price matching.The Pros of the camera are this:1. The long reach of the zoom.2. The pictures are quite good for it being a bridge camera even when not using the zoom. I do use a DSLR and a NEX, so I would know.3. Auto mode functions great for my wife so she can use it.3. It supports RAW, more on this in cons.4. It does have a hot shoe a plusNow to the cons:1. Terrible menu layout. Some features aren't available in some modes.2. Low light and ISO performance well just aren't what I am used to with my NEX or my Sony SLT, but it is a bridge camera.3. The zoom tends to over shoot where I want it to stop at. This has happened a lot and it is annoying... I find myself trying to get the range correct and almost miss the shot.4. No USB cable, come on Canon this is a 300+ dollar camera and it was over 400 dollars to begin with.5 No RAW in Auto and some other modes, or I least I can seem to get it to do this.Overall I like the camera for bird shots and other long zoom shots, but I may return it an see what some of the other super zooms have to offer. The camera isn't as bad as some reviewers make it out to be, but the camera is just to much of a compromise to me to keep it. I gave the camera 3 stars, but I would give it 3 and a half stars if it was possible.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for sporting events
Reviews.Author: Sports Dad
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing.  I bought it to take action pictures of my son during his freshman year of high school baseball and it gave me truly fantastic shots.  I was able to stand to the right of a first base dugout and get shots of my son playing catcher.  I was able to zoom in and see his face inside the catcher's mask.  I went out past center field and was able to zoom in on my son while he was hitting, getting everything from the pitcher's arm slot to my son's reaction to the pitch.  I was able to get multiple shots of his swing from another location and was actually able to correct a flaw that had crept into it.  I also took some video of my daughter's band concert and was able to zoom while shooting video - truly amazing.  I read the negatives about low-light photography.  I have done some inside shots with and without the flash.  With ambient lighting, I have not seen any problems.  Perhaps the negatives are when shooting from extremely low ambient lighting, but I do not see myself shooting in those conditions.  I highly recommend this for shooting sporting events.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Zoom, Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Fujifilm FinePix HS10 that has recently decided to take pictures only 10% of time when the "shutter" button is pressed. With a 50x optical zoom, the Canon SX50 HS could so easily be a "Five Star No-Brainer", but it misses the mark in several key places. Because of the number of extensive and well written reviews of this camera and its features, I'll simply give the bulk of my review in list form of pros and cons.What I Like- "Holy Crap It's HUGE" zoom- Very good image stabilization- Quick focus (when it works) and metering adjustments when snapping pics... no shutter lag at all- Very good quality bright light photos- Very good (for a super zoom) color in images- Did I mention the size of its zoom?What I Don't Like- Auto focus is sometimes quirky- 12 megapixel is a little on the low side... I'd think this camera would've merited 16 MP- Camera body is just a little small for a bridge super zoom camera- Placement of Movie Record, Self-Timer, and Trash buttons ensure you will occasionally press them by accident- Not the best indoor shots (you don't want to go above ISO 800 with the SX50)- Fold out LCD can get in the way- Auto focus assist light blinds subjects, even from 15 feet away- Doesn't use standard AA batteriesThe focusing problem is my biggest issue with this camera so far.  Sometimes the camera will focus on a small object, and sometimes it will focus on the background. For example, I recently tried zooming in on a bluebird sitting on a fence post and it took several attempts before the camera would focus on the bird and not the foliage behind it, even though the bird nearly filled the screen. I ended up having to put the camera in full-time auto focus, get it to focus on the base of the fence post where it met the ground, and then move center frame up the pole until I had my bird centered.In conclusion, I'd be in heaven if I could take the best qualities of this camera (mainly the zoom) and combine them with the best of my old Fuji HS 10. Obviously that isn't possible, so the question really is, if I had a "do-over," would I buy this camera again? The answer is, with a little reservation, yes. Most of the faults of the camera are things I can overcome, and I'm sure with a little time, I will learn to adjust my shooting technique to minimize them.The bulk of my photography is wildlife (mostly birds) and landscapes, so the zoom on the SX50 is perhaps the most important feature for my type of photography. If I did a lot of indoor photography I might think twice about making this my camera of choice. If I were shooting a  high school wrestling tournament or basketball game, this would not be the camera I'd want in my bag, in spite of what the zoom would do for my shots.

I previously owned a Nikon P500 and I had some concerns with that camera, I noticed that picture color was a little bit pale. Also, the camera took some time to buffer after shooting a few pictures in continue mode (I missed a lot of shots because of this). I got rid of my Nikon and I bought a Canon Powershot SX50. There are a couple of things I had to get used to: the camera body (feels different from my Nikon) and buttons layout is also different. Reviews.Title: Buy it for the zoom
Reviews.Author: Jagadeesh K. Venugopal
Reviews.Content: If you want a camera to capture a steady picture of your kid on stage, or in a marching band, and you're standing far away from the action, this is it. Birding and wildlife enthusiasts will love this camera.The image stabilization is top notch. For comparison, I own a pair of Celestron 20x binoculars. I have to hold it extremely steady to see the sky, and even then there is a fair amount of shake. With the SX 50, I was able to photograph the moon, craters and all, with simple handholding. I didn't even brace myself.I can see this being my every day camera, which I use on vacation or when visiting an interesting spot. What this isn't, is a camera that can help you with your photographic pursuits. Some drawbacks are that sharpness is lost at higher ISO levels starting as early as 1600. if you look closely on long zoom photos, some objects have a purple fringe. And the lens has a limited aperture range. You cannot take wide-aperture portrait photos that blur the background, as you can with an SLR. I wasn't very pleased with low-light performance when compared with my four year old Sony Alpha DSLR.This camera makes a great complement to a DSLR. With a DSLR you get a bigger sensor, larger aperture and finer control. With this, you get the zoom, built-in image stabilization, and something you can carry around more easily.Update: After a couple months of owning this, I still like it. Its my go-to camera. There are a few caveats though... the first is that in low light, this does not even come close to even an APS-C DSLR. The size of the sensor on this is much smaller, and there is correspondingly a lot of noise at low light/high ISO. Another thing is that ISO 6400 is a disappointment. I love to take pictures in available light, and to get a better shutter speed, ratchet up the ISO. When I go all the way to 6400, the pictures don't come out very good. The noise reduction within the camera removes a lot of detail.The second caveat is that the range of apertures is fairly limited (3.4 through 8, IIRC). Reduces the number of creative things you can do with this camera, but of course it opens up many other possibilities.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: E. J. Thompson
Reviews.Content: The SX50 HS appears to be a great camera for those times when you just do not want to carry around the weight of a full size SLR and multiple lenses.

Reviews.Title: really is a good buy
Reviews.Author: juan cossio
Reviews.Content: The zoom is really amazing, highlights the image stability,  good improvements with respect to the SX40,the size and weight are ideal

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS
Reviews.Author: Mirian Groeger
Reviews.Content: I already had the Canon SX40 HS that I really liked. However besides the even greater zoom of the SX50 HS I noticed that using it with this camera is a lot easier because of it s fantastic stability.  I just bought it but expect to take great pictures with it.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, but Electronic View Finder(EVF) is Terrible
Reviews.Author: J. Miller "Jim_xinu"
Reviews.Content: This is my third camera in the Canon PowerShot line, I also have the S2IS and SX10IS.What's improved:- The HD video is good.- The Auto mode at least can actually take indoor pictures with the on-board flash worth having--neither of the earlier models could.- The super zoom and IS are quite good.  50x zoom is startling far out there.- The swing out display is clearly better.What's not:- The high speed video modes, 120fps(640x480) and 240fps(320x240), are so low resolution as to be nearly worthless.- The Electronic View Finder(EVF) is terrible--far worse than the SX10IS.  It's so bad I thought I had a defective camera until I went and checked another one at a store.  This alone is enough to knock it down to 3 stars.  If it had the same EVF as the SX10IS, I'd love it.

Reviews.Title: I like it so far so good
Reviews.Author: Jasmine
Reviews.Content: It works well! The seller had really fast shipping (Ordered this around saturday or sunday and received it thursday). I like the features of the camera ill be looking forward to using it. All the parts that they had in the description came with it as expected. This camera has extremely good, long range shooting. It detects something as thin as the spider webs across a bird bath from a distance. I think it's great for people who are starting out in taking more professional looking photos or tutorials on youtube.

Reviews.Title: Battery life could be better
Reviews.Author: PA Guy from NYC
Reviews.Content: I like it very much … especially for the long range lens. The only negative is the relatively low battery life. I have had3 other Canons which had the best battery life in their class. From what I've read, the use of the long zoom is the power drainer. All in all, I am glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Frickin' Sweet
Reviews.Author: voodooprophet
Reviews.Content: excellent camera. Proud to be a Canon fan. The zoom is fast, the autofocus is fast. Love the super slow motion, even with the massive drop in resolution

Reviews.Title: Great for very amateur and serious photographers!
Reviews.Author: Tom Gannon
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this camera! I'm an avid bird and nature photographer-- but just as a hobby-- and it is perfect for me. There are options I don't use at all that a more serious photographer might find useful. The zoom is great!

Reviews.Title: Does not include cord to download pics
Reviews.Author: Sara Sue
Reviews.Content: So far I love this camera.  It is not an SLR, which I'm used to using, but the fantastic zoom and ease of use makes up for the difference.  It is much easier to travel with, it's lighter in weight, and I don't have to lug around longer lenses with me everywhere.  However, I was shocked that this camera did not include a cord with which to download the pictures to a computer.  I was fortunate to have one from my Canon Rebel SLR that works fine with this camera, but it is ridiculous to have buy one separately.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: hcboat
Reviews.Content: have already taken some great shots with the camera.  Zoom is great even though you really need a pod at max optical zoom.  Battery life a little short but two batteries solves that issue.  Video clarity and audio pickup are great.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: AMANDA KEY
Reviews.Content: I have a two year old and five year old so I wanted an easy to use camera that would produce good shots. We took a trip to Alaska and  with the zoom I was able to capture shots of animals up close in Denali National Park. Initially I wanted a DSLR camera but knew I didn't have enough time to learn how to use it This point and shoot gives you good pics.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Marcelo Santos
Reviews.Content: If your are looking for an excellent camera, buy this one.Good image quality and fair price.I love it

Reviews.Title: Wee!
Reviews.Author: Brooke
Reviews.Content: I'm so very excited to start using this camera! I was worried that it wouldn't arrive on time because I didn't get the shipping confirmation until 2 days before it was supposed to arrive, but it came the very next day! I really love the versatility of the camera & I'm excited to learn the ins & outs of all of its capabilities!

Reviews.Title: Good Easy Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen E. Rice
Reviews.Content: You will probably need a tripod when maxing out the zoom. I just shot an excellent handheld photo of a bear however...zoom not 100% maxed out but close...I am very happy with this camera!!!For general picture taking it is excellent. Need to learn all the bells and whistles for it. I like that it has a hot shoe for an external flash.  I have no complaints about the camera that can't be likened to user error. Sometimes the auto focus can't grab the subject (happens with all auto focus cameras though.)  All in all, I recommend the camera but be prepared to have to learn the different controls.I will agree with some of the other comments that the body is just a too small allowing you to accidentally hit the menu wheel and change the settings unknowingly. I accidentally turned on the self timer and didn't know how to turn it off at first. :)  Live and learn!

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price
Reviews.Author: Willem
Reviews.Content: Packaging very simple, no accesory cables. All focused on a good camera for a good price. Have had Canon before, very good experience.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Darby R. Byrd Sr. "db5167"
Reviews.Content: Not a big tech guy when it comes to photos, but his camera is the best. The Zoom is the best.

Reviews.Title: perfection^_^
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: The powershot sx50 hs is perfect for the amateur photographer/videographer.  I received the package earlier than expected, everything that was suppose to come in the box was efficient and I can't put.the camera down^_^ I'm purchasing the led 160 video lamp for video because its a bit dark but other than that I'm in love!!! Thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50 is Great!
Reviews.Author: Michael Bird
Reviews.Content: I sold my Canon 7D and the lenses, and bought this to replace it. I am amazed at the quality and capability of this point & shoot! It is much easier to "lug" along, and I frankly don't see any difference in the quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Zooooooommmm....
Reviews.Author: Fledermaus
