Reviews.Content: When I read how long the zoom is I was sold. And now after playing with it for a little while I am not disappointed. The zoom is amazing. And I also like all the other features this camera has. Love this baby. Can't wait for a full moon.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50 Powershot
Reviews.Author: Scott Mortier
Reviews.Content: The lens on this camera is impressive! No more carrying around a bag full of extra lenses. The features are fairly 'basic'. Still learing how to shoot things like 'fireworks' and get decent quality, but overall, this camera is a beast and the best value in the superzoom range.

Reviews.Title: It's a good entry level camra
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Happy Travaler"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera and it does have a super zoom but I would trade some of the zoom for better low light quality photographs.

Reviews.Title: Just makes me want more
Reviews.Author: Linda Hall "A truck driver"
Reviews.Content: I love taking pictures but my pics have never been very good. Not, that they're professional shots now but this camera makes my other pics look like a kid took them. I've been reading a few books on how to get better pics and I bought a few lenses to work with, though I haven't had much chance (should have bought a rain proof one I guess) to use them. I've still taken quite a few indoor and a few outdoor. My dog has become quite the camera ham. Even the cat isn't camera shy. Still have to fight my husband to snap any of him (maybe one of these days his finger will be healed and it won't be in the way of his face). I'm very happy with this camera so far and look forward to many happy beautiful pics. I wasn't really sure if I would like the wide angle lens or if I should have gone for the DSL, but I think I made a good choice. I think maybe later I will invest in the DSL too just for fun.

Reviews.Title: Replacement for another Canon
Reviews.Author: Thomas F. Marsh
Reviews.Content: I like the fast zoom capability but am still learning what all the buttons are for.  I am keeping my old camera too as it is smaller and handier if I want to carry it in my purse or pocket.

Reviews.Title: Better than Expected
Reviews.Author: DJB "A Creature in Time"
Reviews.Content: The controls are a bit awkward for my hands, but, I seem to be adapting. The focusing as the zoom distance, for me, so far, requires either a monopod or a tripod. The attached gorilla portrait was taken more than 50 feet away, there is no color correction or noise reduction, just cropping.

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Mohammed
Reviews.Content: it is the best camera in the same level in the world the nikon better in price because it is cheaperyou can see the reviews for the camera there are many reviews for it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Telephoto...
Reviews.Author: David Blair "Tonga"
Reviews.Content: I would not suggest the 67 mm adaptor and filters as they don't fit well and are hard to get on and off. I returned this part of the order.I bought some 58mm from lensmateonline  that work great! Both the filters, adaptor, new lens cap and flare cover.I also love the Megagear leather cover as the bottom gives you a good grip on this camera more like a NIKON would have.The camera is just plain amazing with what it can do with the telephoto!!!!  Since I bought mine, many friends also got one. Several of us had other cameras. I like my NIKON D-80 with 18-200 VR lens but it just doesn't get out there like this one. Plus this one would be LIGHT to carry in situations like my Africa trip... and give you the ZOOM to reach out an touch animals you really don't want to touch, ha..

Reviews.Title: Good enough for a dedicated amateur photograf
Reviews.Author: Rigoberto
Reviews.Content: I had already a Canon SX40, which was good. I bought the sx50 because of the larger telephoto and superior image stabilization. So far I had only the opportunity to shot a few photos and the sharpness and stability are within my expectations. Only one problem. There is something with the shut on/off, since sometimes its failed to on or off, but taking the battery out / in its works fine. It is the same replacement battery I used for one year in the SX40, so the problem is not here. I'll continue checking it before taking a decision about what to do. Anyway, the zoom is so good that my problem now is city atmospheric haze, which after 200 meters distorts somehow the picture sharpness. I have to take the camera to the countryside!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: AM ALMOST PERFECT CANON CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Jean Cygan
Reviews.Content: I have had many cameras and the most important feature for me is the Optical ZOOM, and the Canon 50x  to 200x optical zoom  is SUPERB.  The only problem with the camera that Canon has to CORRECT occurs while gripping or holding the camera, when the outside palm of your right hand turns on the Function Set Button.  They should lower this button a little so it would be protected from the gentle pressure of the palm  while shooting pictures.  Every time the camera is in my hand I have to  REMEMBER  to ease up on my grip so as not to activate this function.  I am surprised that Canon did not catch this.  Otherwise, the photos and movies are beautiful - sharp and clear.  A camera worth having !!Jean Cygan

Reviews.Title: Better than the previous generations
Reviews.Author: Tracy Davis
Reviews.Content: I recently took the camera to the 2013 Masters golf tourney (practice day of course).  The pictures were excellent, the shutter speed was good enough to capture some good shots, and the telephoto lens worked well from a good distance.  It was intuitive since I had a previous version, but some of the picture review controls were clumsy.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Diego Musacchio del Brio
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to "carry" around with some complicated camera and lens this is a very good choice, it has most of the capabilities of a professional reflex camera but all in one, the only thing I could say in cons is that it requires more light for pictures and the max exposure time you could use is 15 seconds and when using it you can not use more than ISO 80 which means you will need more light for pictures, however in the overall point of view it has very cood pre-sets and it works just fine for an amateur photographer without having to move around with all kind of lens, I would suggest you get a set of filters in order to protect the lens.The video is good quality for a camera, it also has a very good feature, it takes pictures at 240fps making things go veeeeery slow, it's cool if you want to catch your son jumping or dancing or your dog running towards you :).

Reviews.Title: Hit and miss picture quality
Reviews.Author: OlyNomad
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to take nature shots and I think it is just so-so on picture quality. Sometimes they turn out, sometimes they don't. Often times they look a little blurry.  I can reset all settings to factory default and go to take a simple picture, like of a duck on a pond...and the image is good but it's not crisp and clear and I need to take a bunch of shots to just get one good one in the bunch. I think it is heavily dependent on the lighting outside too, it performs really well in sun. I've gotten some great shots on sunny days.  So someone who lives in a sunny area is going to review it differently because chances are they are getting consistent brilliant pictures.The zoom is pretty incredible and I can't believe how far I can see with it and the shots that I'm getting even at full zoom  (up to 100%)The focus can also be a little wonky where it doesn't want to focus in on what you are trying to get it focused on.I don't regret buying it because I love the zoom and I've gotten some great shots with it, but it can be a frustrating camera at times due to the hit and miss aspect of it.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: After using this camera for a month I can say with no hesitation "I love it". Being an amateur I was looking for something that gave me features that made my pictures look like they were taken by a pro. The zoom is amazing though of course at 50x holding steady is tricky but I expected that. Takes great video and the speed is much better than my old PowerShot SX110 IS. Majority of my pictures are birds in daylight and this camera does a great job for that. My only complaint is how close the video button is to thumb grip. It's easy to hit the record button my mistake and not be able to snap a picture. Of course that can be a benifit as well to start recording in a hurry so it just takes some getting used to.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50 HS is a fine replacement for my Canon SX20
Reviews.Author: Ok Ok I'll review it
Reviews.Content: I love the color saturation and exposure of this camera.  The 50x lens is a marvel.  I've taken a few photos at 100x using the digital zoom hand held and am amazed how sharp the photos are.Night shot does a good job on cityscapes and foreground shots, however due to the short exposures, forget astrophotography.

Reviews.Title: Great bought
Reviews.Author: Marcelo Zoppi
Reviews.Content: This a wonderful camera. The pictures are fantastics. The great zoom is the best in the world in a semi profesional camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon sx50
Reviews.Author: fawzi almudhaf
Reviews.Content: Best zoom I have ever seen up to 1200mmVery good HD video qualityGood for birds  watchingLight weight

Reviews.Title: Super Zoom Made reality
Reviews.Author: ABHIMANYU DEDHARA
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product to my friends. The quality of pictures at 50x zoom are amazing. In low light Manual mode shooting is must else the quality of photos in Auto mode gets blurred.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Rick Sinclair
Reviews.Content: Have a lot to learn but excited about the many features and the quality of pictures. Anxious to put it to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures!!
Reviews.Author: Craig Hogan
Reviews.Content: Finally this camera is becoming reaonably priced.  This camers takes excellent pictures the clarity and color can't be beat. The 50x zoom is great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: John C DiGregorio
Reviews.Content: Fast shipment after payment was made, product arrived as described (new in box), it's an  absolutely amazing camera and i love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: BT
Reviews.Content: Lives up to all expectations. Love it.I still have to learn more of it's features. So far great camera, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen L. Bales
Reviews.Content: Just received my new Canon PowerShot.  So far I am very happy with it.  I like the size of it  ( I had a smaller powershot years ago ).  Love the Zoom Lens!

Reviews.Title: Dead Pixels....
Reviews.Author: DMGATES
Reviews.Content: I normally shoot with a 5d mkII and fixed focal length glass, but keeping track of all of my equipment makes it difficult to enjoy travel. I ordered the sx50 based on my previous experience with quality canon products and a bulk of positive user reviews.  When I powered the camera on for the first time - dead pixels on the main lcd! Unacceptable, especially with such a low res EVF as the alternative. That being said, the zoom was amazing when it could get all the light it wanted. Instead of replacing the defective unit, I decided that the strength of the zoom alone wasn't enough for me and decided to return the unit and buy the panasonic fz200 for faster glass, external mic ability, and better video ability.

Reviews.Title: BEST OF SX  TELEZOOM LINE
Reviews.Author: imp
Reviews.Content: IF YOU ARE ACCUSTOMED OR USED PREVIOUSLY 20,30, 40 SX SERIES, THIS IS A REAL DIFFERENCE YES NOT JUST A NUANCE, IT HAS LITTLE MIRACLE. 1200 MM  IS UNSURPASSABLE BY ANY OTHERS,WITH AN IMPRESSIVE IS. THIS CAMERA IS  EOS KILLER LET ASIDE OTHER ENTRY DSLR'S IT WORTH EVERY SINGLE DOLLAR. READ 5 STAR REVIEWS I AGREE ON ALL OF THEM.  1200 MM YEAS YOU MUST EXPERIENCE. BREATHTAKING.

Reviews.Title: "Lens Error" right from the start
Reviews.Author: Jen R
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera yesterday. Fully charged the battery and took some pictures to test it out. When I tried to turn it off, I got "Lens Error, Restart Camera". The only remedy I found was to take the battery out, wait about a minute, then put it back in and it would usually retract the lens. It would only fully retract when the lens was fully set at 24mm wide angle setting. I would expect a camera with a zoom should be able to retract the lens at any optical extension. So I'm sending this one back and getting a different camera. I found out that "Lens Error" is very common with Canon Powershots and that Canon typically blames it on user error (like dust, sand, or dropping it). I had done none of this and it happened right out of the box. Yes, this camera may have been defective, but I don't want to take the chance that replacing it with an identical one wouldn't do the same 6 months from now.It's such a shame because I was able to take an amazing picture of the moon last night ([...]). All the craters of the moon were visible at 50x zoom and auto settings. And it was taken without any tripods, fully handheld. I'm impressed with the photo quality, but not worth having the lens error every time I try to turn it off after use.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: maggiesm
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera because of the flip-out LCD view screen, and I am happy with this feature; however, there are a few features  that I do not like.1:  I had to spend another $20 to purchase a USB cable that would fit the camera.  I think that if a product requires a special fitting like this, that it should be included with the product.2:  The lens cap is totally awkward to take off and put on because the clip is located near the center of the cap, rather than on the sides where it could be easily pressed (as in earlier Canon SLRs which I used for a number of years and never had a problem with).3:  The on-off button is not well located and difficult to press (a sliding switch would have been much better).4:  The flash unit does not automatically pop up when it is needed, rather has to be manually lifted before use.5:  While I like saturated colors for my photos (and this unit can be set in program mode to do so), there is only one setting and I find that it is too much saturation.  The Kodak camera that I am replacing with this one has a choice of three degrees of saturation.6:  Although I've had the camera for a month now, I haven't been able to test the long-range focus, which some people have complained about.7.  The same day as this Amazon.com request for a rating arrived, I received a notice that there is a problem with the rubber viewfinder on certain models of this camera, and it happens to apply to mine, so now I have to return the unit to Canon in order to have this repaired.  Fortunately, the weather in my area happens to be dismal just now and I won't need it for a while yet.8:  All in all, the camera is a huge disappointment.  Canon no doubt thinks that the more buttons, dials, and switches, and settings the camera has, more people will like it because it makes them (the user) think they are smart.  That is simply not true.  Simplicity is always a wiser choice.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Amazing Camera!
Reviews.Author: firefly
Reviews.Content: i don't usually use such descriptive words for products, but this camera is simply and truly amazing.My background: An amateur/hobby photographer for 35+ years. Do mostly landscapes and birds/wildlife. Started with a Pentax film camera years ago, then went to Nikon. So I am very familiar with adjusting F-Stops, shutter speed, etc., to get a good pic. Took many courses on photography over the years. Traveled around, years of some pretty great photos. Fought the change to digital, but finally gave in about five or six years ago. The digital Nikon SLR I have now is about five years old, and the auto focus always gave me problems with birds. Bought a Nikon "advanced" P&S; (similar to this) about three years ago. Same problem, plus the quality of pictures were never quite up to snuff no matter what I tried. Though I have a 400mm lens with the SLR, still isn't enough for birds much of the time. Along the way, bought three Panasonic P&S.; Fabulous pictures every time! Was set to buy latest Panasonic like this Canon....then they took away Leica lens, and build them in China. That was the end of that.This is one terrific camera. I've been taking loads of shots the last three weeks. I purposely have not even done anything in the way of making "adjustments" other than to adjust the exposure, just to see how good it is, or where it may be weak. That's it. The 1200mm lens is unbelieveable. No camera shake whatsever....although, I will have to say that if you are not steady, you may want to use a tripod at that length. It IS possible to get a great handheld shot at that length, but you must be steady enough to do it. Where I live we have high winds almost all the time, so it's a bit of a challenge! But I managed to get some fantastic shots despite it. (And mind you, I'm very particular about what is acceptable vs. what has a real "wow" factor.)Adjusting the exposure, which is easy to do quickly, allowed me to get terrific closeup shots of many birds (think always-on-the-move palm warblers and hummingbirds, goldfinches in flight!) in low light conditions and on overcast days (of which we have had far too many lately).The macro is also terrific. I always had a hard time getting good closeup shots of flowers with any of my other cameras. This one is right on. I'm really impressed with the results, with no lenses to change out!The crispness and clarity of the shots I've taken is amazing beyond belief. Color is right on. I am still in awe of this camera. I may never buy another SLR!  I can take this birding with me, too, and not have to lug around a heavy SLR. That way I can watch the birds and still hope to get a few good shots along the way!I have medium size hands, and the camera feels very good to hold and manuever. The moveable LCD screen is great. I've not had one before. You can use it to shoot (I prefer the viewfinder....a big reason why I got this type of camera), or it works really well to review a shot. The viewfinder has a diopter, so you can adjust it to your eyesight. You can actually see the LCD screen very well outside (unlike any other digital camera I've had before).Only drawback is that I worry about the card/battery latch at the bottom of the camera. It is not a rigid/tough plastic, and I'm not sure why they cheaped out on it. Though, in reality, if it should pop open or break off for some reason, the battery and card will not just fall out (they are secured). Also, I do wish it had a Landscape setting. My Panasonic has that, and it's great. Not a big deal; I simply put it on Landscape and adjust the exposure accordingly. I have more flexibitiliy in getting the shot I want that way anyway.Canon has a new fan! I've been told by my photographer/birder friends for years Canon was the way to go. Why didn't I listen?Be sure to always have an extra. fully-charged battery on hand. I have been shooting a lot of pictures lately over a span of a few hours, and the battery usually does go out during that time and I have to change it out. But this is not necessarily any different than with other cameras I've used.

Reviews.Title: It's great but not the ultimate camera I had hoped for.
Reviews.Author: Faisal Zafar
Reviews.Content: I love the zoom on this camera, which is unbeatable, but it has a hard time getting a really sharp focus in Auto mode.For a camera at this price range $370, I expected a sharper focus than my iphone 5.If I figure out how to take better pictures on manual mode, I will consider upgrading my rating to 5 stars.I have seen some amazing pictures posted on Facebook taken by this camera, and I am still hopeful that it is the user and not the camera that is at fault.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom
Reviews.Author: Brigitte Malessa
Reviews.Content: This camera really does deserve a five star, but my heart was really set on an SLR and so I ended up returning this for that reason only. An SLR just has a solid feel and crispness to photos that this little guy doesn't have. Still, this thing can zoom like no other. I literally can see details of the craters on the full moon, and got details of the little faces of seals and bears from a distance. You can work on all of your Manual settings. A great camera and light and handy for running around. Just not an SLR...which they never claimed to be. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: 1200mm Magic
Reviews.Author: AFPD
Reviews.Content: As a long time Nikon user, I was more than curious about the 1200mm zoom reach on the SX50. I was skeptical to say the least. But its true, its a long neck reach into the 1200mm range.Although I have 4 DSLR's already, and a slew of lenses, the small size of the camera coupled with the talked of the fast focus made me want it.I like to travel with the smallest lightest equipment when I do street photography and or travel. I need a camera that can keep up with me in all light conditions. A camera that can shoot very fast FPS. This camera shoots 10 frames per second. The onboard lens is a 24-1200mm (35mm). Quite a focal length. The aperture ranges from wide at f/3.4 to zoomed out of f/6.5. What this tells me is that you will need lots of light when you use the longest reaches of the lens. The optical zoom has a button of the left side of the camera body that helps refocus the image when you are zoomed to the maximum. But again, this features works best when outdoors in strong light, indoors its not effective, resulting in blurred images.I also bought the YN 560II, an all manual flash for $60 here on Amazon. It outperforms higher priced Canon speedlites. The best feature is the "slave" mode, for off camera flash photography. You can use the on board or built in flash to trigger the YN 560II to fire at will. The YN 560II, was surprising good. In fact the flash is so large that it makes the Canon SX50 appear even smaller.Cons: Low battery life, about 250 images on one charge. Buy extra batteries. Won't last a full day of shooting. Slow to process in continuous burst mode. The self timer button area should be moved. I have hit it by accident several times when using the mode dial. The on and off button should be placed near the front of the camera. The image review, and on and off power button, are too close for me. Macro settings are only in preset shoot mode. You can still get very close with the non macro option. The flash use is very odd. You have to manually flip up the built in flash. The flash icon on the side is for flash options only.Overall image quality is okay, nothing super. The camera has trouble focusing in the longer focal lengths. A tripod helps and the more light you have the better this all works.Pros: Small and compact body. Durable, light weight. Fast auto focus. 24-1200mm great for all around picture taking. Intuitive menu options. Great quality video at 1080p. Good audio quality.  24-1200mm (35mm Equivalent) Lens  50x Optical Zoom  12.1MP CMOS Sensor  DIGIC 5 Image Processor (Same as Canon 5d MKIII)  2.8" Vari-Angle LCD with Viewfinder  Full HD 1080p Video with Stereo Sound  Optical Image Stabilizer  High Speed AF Focuses in 0.19 sec  High-Speed Burst HQ for 13fps Shooting  Built-in Hot ShoeEmail with any questions.Cheers!

Reviews.Title: canon Power Shot SX50
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I did not not like this camera. I'm not sure if it is a true 1200mm lens. Had shutter lag. Images were soft. I returned it. It didn't fit the bill for me. I'll stick with a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: Marion Wood "Mainganikan"
Reviews.Content: I own several cameras and have awards for taking scenery and wildlife photos. I bought this PowerShot SX50 because of the reviews recommending it. I am very disappointed in this camera. The photos are NOT clear. I tried different settings in different locations - experimented a lot - and used a tripod. No matter what I did, every photo was fuzzy.  I didn't want to give this camera any stars, but I had to in order to post this review.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS
Reviews.Author: Lisette S. Marquez "Lisette"
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Canon and have never purchased any other type of camera.  Canon keeps wowing me with their cameras, and this is one of the best yet!!!!  It is unbelievable everything this camera can do, and amazing at how user friendly it is!!!!  Picture quality with Canon is always impeccable!!!

Reviews.Title: Camera's make perfect presents
Reviews.Author: L. Mayfield
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a gift and had to shipped to a different address than the billing address. The camera arrived right on time and to the gift recipient who was extremely happy. The tracking was wonderful I knew exactly when the package was signed for and I received a phone call with a big Thank You within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: This is the camera I have been looking for, plus I am using more features than I thought I would by learning via how videos online.

Reviews.Title: almost excellent
Reviews.Author: tish
Reviews.Content: Haven't exactly got it all figured out yet, they put way too much stuff in there. A lot of functions and adjustments that 90% of photographers will never use. But, that's true of just about all cameras these days. I got about everything I was looking for. Wanted super zoom (got that). Wanted good resolution, image quality  and focus at high zoom settings (got that).  Wanted these features without the expense of a high quality SLR and a long telephoto lens (got that).  However, Canon should have known that the arrangement and locations of the various buttons are inconvenietly located. Also they are so sensitive to the touch that it's difficult to handle the camera without  activating some unintended function.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: info "infoplease"
Reviews.Content: awesome camera, easy to use, great zoom! great for the price! I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a reliable camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon sx50 review
Reviews.Author: Harry Kowalski
Reviews.Content: Camera is good overall. Low light operation is fair.I would have given it 5 stars,except there is no manualwith the camera. Whats with that?????

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Rodney Small
Reviews.Content: I just charged up the battery, set the date and time now off to get a 16 memory card.  I have a friend that has the same one and it is the best.  Compact but you can zoom in on a subject from 200 yards off and get a great picture.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Melnurse
Reviews.Content: Use it nearly every day as we live on a lake and there is always something to photograph on the lake.

Reviews.Title: Love the Zoom
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Haven't had the opportunity to explore all the capabilities of the camera, but the "point and shoot" allows me to get straight to the business of taking pictures.  Shot thousands of pictures already, mostly nature.  But I miss the low-light capability of the SX30.

Reviews.Title: best of the best
Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: It was recommended by a professional photographer and it is really the best on a market for its price. Outstanding zoom, a lot of functions, easy to use. I am extremely happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera!
Reviews.Author: Retrievin'Gold
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after reading reviews from a very well known birder.  I'm astounded at the quality of shots I can get of birds at the feeders while I'm inside the house.  The zoom capabilities are extraordinary.  It is easy to use.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Faulty Lens
Reviews.Author: Sean Canavan
Reviews.Content: I never had the lens get stuck so many times, Canon replaced the whole camera once and the second time they wanted to charge full price.They DO NOT repair them but replace them completely.Why build something that you can never repair?!My guess is something is stuck behind the lens enclosure, whether its sand or something else.From what I've read they glue on the Lens!I previously owned an SX 30 which I was really happy with and had not even one Lens Error.I thought the SX 50 would be a great step up, apparently not.I am not happy now that I have a pretty much dead camera, at least when it was working it took good photos.Was good for a year but I would avoid this camera its no substitute for a good DSLR with interchangeable lenses.For the investment spending another hundred or two hundred is worth it if your a serious about your photography.And...Glue?!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50
Reviews.Author: Douglas G. Holland "Doug H"
Reviews.Content: You need this camera in your arsenal of equipment. Stunning photos and capabilities and this camera completes my last purchase. Close-ups and the zoom range will blow you away. Have an XSI with L lenses and this camera beats that. So glad to own it. Shoots RAW as well. It doesn't get any better and I have about 8 cameras.

Reviews.Title: Probably my best Amazon purchase yet
Reviews.Author: Jasmine Hicks
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas gift for my wife and we both love it to death. We actually fight over it! This is the first camera either on of us has owned that was not a typical point and shoot. This thing takes awesome pictures and is mind blowing with the 200x max zoom. There are so many features available on this camera. I won't list them in this review. I have gotten myself very familiar with this camera and I love what it is capable of. My only gripe is the somewhat lower quality when taking pictures in really low light.

Reviews.Title: This has become my favorite camera.
Reviews.Author: turquoise gal
Reviews.Content: So easy to use. I'm still getting the hang of all the bells and whistles. I don't think I would ever want the bigger models with massive lenses because I am studiying the work of some of the photo journalists and artists who worked with smaller Leicas and Nikons and other older model cameras. This one pushes me to work and not just rely on the automatic settings. It is so much fun. I go on "Photo Safaris" and challenge myself to look and see the world around me.

Reviews.Title: cannon Powershot SX50
Reviews.Author: Billy P. Leonard
Reviews.Content: I could not rate the SX50 with 5 stars because it is difficult to focus on flying/ moving objects. Otherwise the camera is great, I keep it with me all of the time. It is light and easy to carry around, takes great picutres and can zoom in like big expensive lenses.

Reviews.Title: My Review of the Canon PowerShot SX50 Camera
Reviews.Author: spacepegs
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with this camera and my transaction with Amazon.  My camera was delivered before the actual delivery date which made me very happy.  The camera provides the distance photos I had hoped for.  I have owned about 6 Canon cameras and I do believe Canon could have used a body for the camera that didn't feel so cheap, but otherwise it performs as I expected.

Reviews.Title: Limited aperture range - why?
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in the limited aperture range of F3.4 to F6.5 - where is my manual setting of F8-11 when I don't want my background out of focus?

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: donald
Reviews.Content: pretty much what i wanted.  I bought it for birding, very pleased with it, only thing I dislike on it is the auto focus it is hard to focus on birds in trees it tries to focus on the tree branches in front of the bird. Only other thing is i cant really see to much out of the view finder but I still think its worth it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera, great price
Reviews.Author: tcon
Reviews.Content: This camera has some great features, price is very reasonable and the zoom is incredible.  My only complaint is that the manual is on a CD.  A little hassle up front, but fine after you save the pdf on your mac/pc and then sync it to ibooks or your reading app of choice and access it on your phone/ipad/tablet.  Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: A Look at Canon's SX-50
Reviews.Author: F. Sharp "Frank -  Semi-Pro"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price.  I use it for travel and bird photography.  My other bird camera, the Nikon P-510 is a great camera but doesn't have the reach of the Canon at the telephoto end.  However, the Canon's focusing ability is greatly reduced when shooting thru a window at my hummingbird feeder.  Perhaps manual focus might work but the birds are so fast that time is often only in seconds.  It doesn't have an ability to accept filters.  One has to buy a filter adaptor kit  from Vivitar or Wal-Mart.  My Vivitar kit includes a collapsible hood and three filters: UV, polarizer and sky filter.  The lens cap stuck and had to be pried off with a screw driver.  The sound quality of the video is in my opinion subpar compared to a camcorder but I think that is generally the case with DSLR cameras.  Best thing is that that it is the first super zoom with 50X to offer RAW format - for true sharpness this is a necessity for large enlargements.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Elliott "Fanjack12"
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera at a good price through Amazon rather than local Ritz Camera store.  Easy to use for pics....need to give the video some time shortly.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly
Reviews.Author: Jessica Kulik
Reviews.Content: The lens fogged up on our trip to the Bahama's, and there was a delay on some of the settings, but it does everything we wanted it to do.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, poor lens cap!
Reviews.Author: LaNelle Caudle
Reviews.Content: Camera takes great pictures! Would have been a 5 star had an instruction manual accompanied the camera an d a better lens cap! The lens cap fell apart before a month was up. Now I have to purchase a replacement lens cover.

Reviews.Title: I'm happy that I bought this instead of a cumbersom SLR.
Reviews.Author: Anne Roughton "MaxTheCat"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes terrific "near" shots, the lens captures a clear in focus shot even when people or animals are moving.  I am mostly using it for taking distant bird photos and have been delighted with the results.  Getting used to the swing-out viewing screen will take a while.  The viewfinder is not very good.  One reason I bought it sight unseen was some online comments by "serious" photographers" who said carrying this camera was much easier that lugging around a camera with a lot of lenses.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS
Reviews.Author: elizabeth allen
Reviews.Content: My husband loves the camera. Took good pictures during our trip to Europe.  He is still learning on how to use the other features. For me, it is a little too heavy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for money
Reviews.Author: Raja Sen
Reviews.Content: The optical zoom of this camera is awesome and it is excellent value for money. However, I find the fold-out viewing screen a bit unwieldy. Besides, when it is out of the recess, I am always aware of the somewhat flimsy build, and how easily it could break-off or get damaged when extended, if it were to bang into a hard surface. I wish the camera had been a little heavier for the sake of stability, maybe with a heavier battery?

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Baldwin "Bill Baldwin"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera about a month and love every element of it. I was debating on stepping up to a full sized DSLR but, for cost considerations bought this model.Our community sponsors a Youth Fest during the 4th of July week. There are a lot of activities planned for the kids, from tykes to teens. I shot photos of the kids on the practice tee and putting green. One of the photos i took will be featured on the cover of a local magazine. Not bad for learning the camera over just a few days.Only negative is that it comes without a manual. You have to download the manual, which is about 270 pages. I really would prefer to have this information in hand where it is more usable, than online.

Reviews.Title: Super Zoom at its best..!!
Reviews.Author: Mihir B "Mihir3308"
Reviews.Content: This is one the best cameras i have owned.The super zoom telephoto 1200mm is unbelievable.I got this camera for my upcoming trip to New Mexico, Colorado and Utah.And in this tenure the camera has performed to its expectations.However its not that great in Low Light situations but performs okay..(Well its a Super zoom Bridge Camera..Peopleusually buy it for nature,wildlife,zooming photography.)i liked the feel of it and ergonomics wise its a great camera.RAW format is a Win here great for those who use it for editing, touch up, finishing in Light room and Photoshop.However one limitation i saw was while i was cropping a lot for few pics i had to compromise with the qualitybut that's not a big fuss.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever...
Reviews.Author: Luis B.
Reviews.Content: Been using a lot of Canon cameras for a while, even DSLR... but this one is my new love. Excellent picture quality, beautiful colors, big display, LOT of functions and the zoom... the zoom... oh boy! Is like having a camera attached to a telescope, sometimes it gets tricky to handle it, since at full zoom you move the camera just a little bit and youre pointing to a totally different place. With the image stabilization you'll always get sharp images.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC Camera! WELL worth the money!
Reviews.Author: IKECH545
Reviews.Content: Are you wondering what this thing can do? For high-quality photos, sports mode, video, etc.? Go to my photography page where photoshoots and videos are posted with using THIS camera. Facebook.com/DiligoAmabilisPhotographyThat'll bring you to the page and you can see all the work I have done with this camera, I am so happy I got it! If you want to handle it before buying it on Amazon, go to Walmart, Target or Best Buy. They should have it on display (I got mine at Best Buy).By FAR the best thing about this camera is the zoom! It probably shouldn't be legal for how far this thing goes... Haha! And no, it's not some big blurry blob of nothing when you zoom all the way, the quality is amazing for how far away it can be.Got questions about it and wanna talk about it? Email me! DiligoAmabilisPhotography@aol.com -I'm happy to answer ANY of your questions!Good:Lots of different modes/settings to make wherever/whatever you are shooting the best quality it can be!I do professional photography, and the "C1" setting vs. auto...? C1 makes a crystal clear photo, the megapixels makes you want to shout with joy... lolSports mode shutter speed is crazy fast!The screen will come out, flip over, go sideways, etc. When you shoot up, you can aim your screen down. Or when you shoot down you can aim your screen up. Just about anyway you need to shoot, the screen can be combatable with.Okay, as I said... THE ZOOM! Speaking about it doesn't do it justice...The sound quality when you are recording video is so good it's almost annoying... I was once was making a video in my basement, and had to stay awake until 1am when everyone in my house was asleep... Why? Because the camera picked up floorboards squeaking upstairs... No really, you could probably mumble something and somehow, it'd be on audio...Good, anti-slip grip when holding it.LONG battery life... When fully charged, mine goes for about 12hrs.Anyways... I could go on and on and on about good stuff. So email me with specific questions... Hah!Bad:(I'm sitting here trying to think of something negative, and it's not working... Geez. There has to be SOMETHING that is slightly wrong with it)...OH. When your shooting in the evening, sports mode takes pictures slower...Um um um... That's all? I'm sure there might be another thing or two, but that's all I can honestly think of..-Again, please do not hesitate to email me if you have any questions!!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING  ZOOM !
Reviews.Author: rdsully
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera with a good zoom lens.  Read all the reviews,  and decided on this one.  The zoom is so good that holding it by hand is tuff at full zoom.  I use a mono-pod and it helps a lot.  Its low light performance is only fair at best, like most small sensor cameras. Its auto focus is fast and exact. Image quality is very good.  Battery life is also very good. Movie mode is good and like shooting stills wile its recording video. Wide angle (24mm) is not the best but theprice for a 1200mm tele-photo lens. All in all very happy.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera; good for bird watching
Reviews.Author: Lynn "reads-a-lot"
Reviews.Content: I heard about this camera from my sister who is involved with many birding friends. They recommended this camera to her.  I have a camera with 15X zoom, but wanted one that could get much closer  to take pictures of birds and wildlife.On our recent vacation to Canada we both tried this camera for the first time.  After practicing getting used to how it works (we only did auto setting) we both found this camera to be great for nature photography. We got some great closeups of birds and animals. The zoom is very convenient as it is placed right by the shutter button, and can be dialed in and out with one finger without taking your eye off the object. The camera also did well with scenery & close ups.An additional feature we liked is that it is relatively light weight and does not have the bulky, long lense to weigh one down.The one feature we did not like was the eye viewer.  The object was always blurry  and it was hard to tell what kind of photo would result.  Often the picture was clear, but the blurr was annoying. I've found in sunny situations that the eye viewer generally works better that the screen which exacerbates the blurr problem.The screen viewer was great always clear and can be manuvered several ways to help in picture taking.In general we liked this camera and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Canon power shot sx50hs for kids and general photo
Reviews.Author: kmyo
Reviews.Content: this camera is convenience to shoot general events like playing kids or birds or festival etc..Photo quility is good enough for general use. With this camera you can get more photo opportunity than DSLR.Very good zoom with effective IS. I like the sport mode for playing kids. I am taking this camera everywhere for general purpose use, taking my kids, bird, insects, plane, moon etc.. Video quality is good as well.Better than buying a cheap zoom lens only.My personal opinion, you can get good quality photo if you use properly. For pro photographer this one is really nice to play for personal use. For general people it is lot of fun using this camera. For someone who want to learn photography don't buy this, buy basic DSLR.ISO and noise handling is good and I got some nice bird photo but I would like to point out some facts. It need a lot of lights for zoom. If subject is in the shade you could get noisy and blur image. If subject is 45 degree or so against the bright light you could get most part blow out image with chromatic aberration, hight light cliping. Anyway you have chances to get nice bird photo with this lens. Practice using tripod and play around with IS disable. Sometime focus doesn't work properly, using auto mode and zooming a subjects in full size filling the frame, focus doesn't work and keep hunting in enough bright light and distance. You can take macro  close up without using zoom. If you use zoom it could not focus in certain distance.F stop is very limited f4.5 ~ f8. You can't go further than f8.Built quality is normal. Battery life is short. Viewfinder is useless.Overall, this is good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Lee Ann Brandt
Reviews.Content: Good telescopic lens.  Battery does not hold a charge very long, especially if you are filming movies.Overall very pleased

Reviews.Title: Gotta love the zoom
Reviews.Author: Tom Smith
Reviews.Content: I am no expert but I think it takes great pics.  I bought it for the zoom capabilities to capture wildlife and it has not dissapointed.  The detail it captures is great and even when doing 50x zoom being hand held it can capture a good pic.  Some have been a tad unclear but I blame myself being hand held going out that far on the zoom not the camera itself.  It gives you a lot of options which I am still learning about but for a point and shoot it is a nice starter.  The view finder is a liability so I use the LCD 100% of the time.  All my time has been outdoors so no comment on the flash.  I did a lot of comparison research with an entry level DSLR and while a APS-C sensor would be great the zoom won out for what I want to do.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS
Reviews.Author: rossj61
Reviews.Content: I have two Canon DSRL cameras and I have used the preceeding four versions of this one and I take it everywhere I go.  I like the features and the versitility.  Some of shots at the extreme end of the telephoto were not as clear as I had hoped as with some of my indoor shots in low light.  The camera has been very good overall.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam with awesome zoom
Reviews.Author: M. T. Armstrong "ImBatGirl"
Reviews.Content: Takes excellent pics and I love the zoom. Only thing that could be better is the location of some of the buttons but otherwise it's perfect so far.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: aucifer69
Reviews.Content: got it a few hours ago and so far its very good,The camera is just fantastic and expect great things from it

Reviews.Title: Canon Does It Again!
Reviews.Author: Pierre J. Rioux "Main Sail"
Reviews.Content: I have purchase several Canon cameras so far, the last one being the stellar Canon S3IS, which has been a great all around camera.  It has outperformed many of the cameras which my associates carry, especially in the stereo audio catagory which was a pleasant surprise.  After having the Powershot SX50 HS, it is obvious that Canon has produced yet another great camera!

Reviews.Title: Loving this Camera
Reviews.Author: rivergirl
Reviews.Content: I am still in the learning phase of this camera but so far so good.  Buying accessories for this lens is a bit of a learning curve as well.  The filters I ended up with are 67mm rather than the actual lens size which is 52mm I think.  NOTE!  You must buy an adapter to transition the 2 lens sizes together and it remains on the camera.It is light for it's size.  One thing to mention is that the focus assist buttons on the side of the lens are difficult to locate by touch.  You must look at the lens while you are in fact trying to lock in the focus of your subject.  A simple raise bump like on a keyboard would allow better awareness of it's location.I would recommend this camera to others for sure.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX 50
Reviews.Author: David Ryan
Reviews.Content: Great photos, remarkable zoom ability in a point and shoot. I did not test the video on this camera, but am sure it will work great!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Carole Brennan
Reviews.Content: I am a shutter bug and needed a new camera.  This one was much less expensive than purchasing it in a store.  Love all the features.  And it's not too heavy.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cam
Reviews.Author: al-salami
Reviews.Content: Great photo quality & easy to use. Love the movable LCD screen especially in bright light. Battery life could be better

Reviews.Title: the best camera I've seen
Reviews.Author: mohamad
Reviews.Content: great price. amazing zoom !!!!!!. high quality .price . simple to use. this ca itmera like a profesional camera. i love it

Reviews.Title: Nice camera great price
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a friends birthday and I love it. I am always a fan of Amazon's prime service which gives great shipping options. When this item arrived I played with it before I gave it away and I love the clarity of pictures that it produces as well as the price that it cost. A very reasonable price considering the quality that it has.

Reviews.Title: hard to go wrong for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: woodthrush
Reviews.Content: I'm an amateur with cameras, have had this camera about a month and am still learning much about it, and I'm largely comparing it with a Canon S3IS that I'm upgrading from.  So put this all in context.As with many others, I bought this camera primarily for the zoom.  I use it mostly outdoors while on bird-watching ventures.  Up through the end of the optical range (50x), I've been quite pleased with the picture quality.  Digital zooms have always been gimmicks and they're no different with this camera.  The digital range goes from 50x to 100x and the picture quality in that range is so poor it isn't worth using.  That said, it's impressive what you can get through the optical range with this point and shoot.  The biggest issue I've had outdoors with the zoom in program mode is getting it to focus on the right thing when there are multiple objects at different depths in the field of view.  This isn't new to this camera but is an ongoing one I have with point and shoot cameras.  Assuming you are able to get your object in focus, the focus-lock feature on this camera is useful in maintaining it.  I give the zoom a B+.Though I didn't get the camera for movie purposes, they've been a very pleasant surprise.  The HD movies you're able to get, even at the high end of the zoom range, are simply fantastic whether you're viewing them on your computer or your large flatscreen TV.  Sound capture with the movies is quite good as well.  I give the movie feature an A.Image stabilization on the camera is excellent.  I've taken quite a few pictures in very windy conditions and, even at the high end of the optical zoom, I don't notice any degradation of image quality compared with conditions with no wind.My knocks on the camera would include the array of buttons on the back.  I continue to inadvertently turn on the self-timer feature in the midst of shooting.  Finally, though I love the zoom and movie features, I'm a bit disappointed in the overall crispness of pictures.  I was expecting a just a bit more, and I agree with others that the camera doesn't function well without very full light.Overall, a solid B+.  If it's zoom you want, you'll be hard-pressed to find this amount and quality for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: Great point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: J. Roberts "jwrca"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera as a gift for my wife. She likes to take pictures for art projects, but doesn't want to think about manual camera settings. This camera works well for her and offers sufficient manual control, if ever needed. I picked it over the SX40 because of the newer sensor and processor, along with the larger display. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Nathan Mirkis
Reviews.Content: I've been waiting for this particular feature set on a camera since the SX 20. I've been very pleased with the quality of images at full zoom handheld.

Reviews.Title: merry christmas husband
Reviews.Author: chs
Reviews.Content: got this camera for my husband for christmas after our other one went kaput!  so far so good.  he loves the zoom!  it's a little larger than our old snappy pocket camera, but can do a lot more.

Reviews.Title: Be prepared to be disappointed if...
Reviews.Author: A. Bhat
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to be disappointed if you own a DSLR and are used to that quality. I own a T3i and have always taken amazing shots in all sorts of settings. Compared to that the IQ of this camera is nowhere near close. I mainly purchased it because I could not afford Canon's 400mm zoom lenses plus another $500 for 2X tele-converter. I knew I was going to sacrifice Image Quality but not to this extent.The EVF is absolutely horrible. I personally prefer EVF especially while zooming as it is hard to use LCD. If you plan to use it exclusively for zooming and taking acceptable shots which otherwise you had no chance to capture then this camera is not bad. Keep your expectations low and avoid comparison with DSLR features and shots.Having used this Camera for one more week I can say it does take good pictures in bright sunlight. Even if the picture looks horrible in the EVF preview, they look good on the LCD/computer screen once downloaded. The Zoom and Auto-focus speed are great.The battery life is mediocre. The zoom motor and LCD/EVF do consume lot of battery. I got only 100 shots. I ordered a spare battery as a back up. Also ordered 58 mm adapter as I personally prefer using filters and hoods.

Reviews.Title: A big downer
Reviews.Author: A. Reid "Big Al"
Reviews.Content: Had to return the camera to Canon, almost immediately as there was recall on the eyepiece. Took an age getting the return tags etc. I had bought this camera for 2 reasons; it had good camera reviews for the x50 zoom, and supposedly it could live stream, with the purchase of additional cabling. Got the camera back from Canon last week: it's a brand new camera. Now trying to set it up for live streaming. I have my smart mini USB cable to SVGA. Live streaming does not work. It does not work, with any of the cabling diagrams in the service manual, and I have all the cables if you see my Amazon orders list. Called Canon Tech Support and guess what: this camera cannot live stream. It can only stream from memory. How does Canon explain the service manual?I would like to return this camera but between the recall etc etc I am now over the legal February return date. Pretty pissed.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: Joseph F. Pawlick Jr. "Joe"
Reviews.Content: I returned the original camera to Canon after I found it to have a focus problem with long telephoto shots and had shades of blue instead of black shadows.  The replacement sent by Canon works must better and has met my expectations.  Don't forget your tripod when you make those long shots.  The long lens was a real attribute when we ambled through Yellowstone late last summer.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Murray Brockman
Reviews.Content: Lens zoom range is the main feature and it's great. Easy to use too. Image quality is not great at long focal length.

Reviews.Title: Shame about the 1/2.3" sensor
Reviews.Author: Roland Rashleigh-Berry
Reviews.Content: I have this camera and love it. You can zoom in to get a good image of whatever you want and the image stabilisation will help you to take a steady photos of it giving you a 4.5 stop advantage. For macro shots you can go very close (zero distance in fact). Video is good and the image stabilisation helps a lot.I guess with a 50x zoom the camera sensor is not going to be large. In fact, it is a 1/2.3" sensor that is used for most small pocket compact cameras. A sensor that size is not going to give you a great image and the same is true for this camera. You will find yourself reducing the photo size in an image editor to give you a good looking image. For me, that is a definite negative, but all else is good.

Reviews.Title: Awasome camera
Reviews.Author: Sunil
Reviews.Content: Really liked the camera and it takes stunning pics... Also takes excellent pics in the night with flash.. however, without flash - pics are okay - certainly better than normal cameras but still could have been more better.

Reviews.Title: Not too good
Reviews.Author: Donna R. Hall
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am bitterly disappointed with this camera.  When zooming in with the camera on the sport symbol, the camera is continually zooming in and out and will not stay focused so all your action shots are blurry.  The only way to get a good shot is in the auto mode with the green auto symbol and then you can only take one shot at a time.  Also,the photos are much smaller when you download them.  Everything looks far away.  I am very disappointed with this product from Canon.  I bought the Canon 60D camera before this one and was so pleased I was expecting the same quality in the point and shoot, and it is definitely not there.  Before this camera I had the Kodak Easyshare Max, which zoomed to 30 x's zoom.  Now that camera was amazing.  Crisp photos and the action shots were perfect, so believe me, I will be throwing this one out and will try to find another Kodax Max.  Too bad Kodak got out of the game too early they were far and above when it comes to the point and shoot.  That camera I just plain wore out with constant use.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Alexander P. Raffini
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use. The 50x zoom was great. I went to Alaska and wanted to get some great pictures and I did.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Elaine M. Ackerman "avid reader"
Reviews.Content: We had the Powershot 35 so it was a natural jump to the 50!  Love the zoom lens for wildllife shots yet the grandchildren can take great pics too!

Reviews.Title: A good in between camera
Reviews.Author: DDC
Reviews.Content: I have a really good Nikon, but I wanted something to carry around with me all the time and was sick of crappy smartphone pics.  I researched heavily before I chose this camera and I haven't been disappointed.  First the pros:  pretty good design with nice hand-feel, but I wish it came with a wrist strap.  The flash doesn't pop up automatically, which for me is a pro because I often prefer the light effect with no flash, but if this concerns you, not to worry, it does let you know when it would prefer to use the flash.  The recording feature with HDMI video is a nice feature which I have frequently used.  you can also snap pics while recording, but you should note that it does pause the video for a second with a still shot.  The zoom can't be beat.  When you are zoomed all the way out you will need a tripod or at the least, have the camera sitting on something, but the shots I got of the moon are unreal.  The pics in general come out beautiful.  Fantastic color and richness.  The option for grouping shots on action mode is also nice.  My biggest con of this camera is that some features are buried in menus making them cumbersome to access.  Also, I wish it was more obvious when you are looking through your shots what is video and what is a pic.  More than once, I've been going too fast and deleted something that I thought was a pic, when it was a video.  (note that there is a notation over the pic, but if you are not paying close enough attention you can easily miss it).  Overall, I would highly recommend this camera for either a solid camera if this is your only one, or an excellent in-between camera to pair with your more expensive one.

Reviews.Title: Dust inside my brand new - just got out the box - Canon
Reviews.Author: marta c
Reviews.Content: I JUST received this camera! I got home and openned the box. This camera has all the features that I want, the zoom is great BUT THERE IS DUST INSIDE THE LENSES!!! It's not a scratch is dust!!! This is my 3th canon camera and I never saw something like that.I'm going to replace this camera and will give a follow up as soon as I receive the new one.Just received another one without any problem! This camera is great!

Reviews.Title: Great zoom
Reviews.Author: Jay Harvey
Reviews.Content: After watching youtube videos about this camera I decided to buy it. I was skeptical that it would zoom like the videos showed, but the zoom is really incredible for such a small camera. I don't like the manual flash because it takes longer to get the shot set up, then see the message that says "raise the flash", then do that and then take the picture. That is truly annoying.

Reviews.Title: The SX40HS is a better Camera, Aperture Vs Zoom is a no brainer.
Reviews.Author: Adam Petrone "Adam"
Reviews.Content: I'm an amateur photographer and basically use these for zoom and video. I've owned the SX30 and SX40. The SX40HS was a big leap over the SX30 but I can't say the same for this. The SX40 had a 35x 24-840mm lens, so the jump out to 1,200mm is substantial, but that compromises the Aperture. The aperture range for the SX40 was f2.7-f5.8, but it gets considerably slower for the SX50: f3.4-6.5. I wonder to how much zoom is to much. I think it's a marketing tool. No photo's at that range are going to be crisp and clear. I just don't see paying basically 140 more in price for a larger zoom at the price of aperture. The SX40HS is more than anyone will need.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing..... I don't recommend.
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Dockett
Reviews.Content: Ordered camera after seeing it 4+ star consumer reviews.  Received camera and shot 115 test photos (most in automatic mode); 35 photos were blurry, and that was with the image stabilization on.  Camera is made of cheap grade plastic (in my opinion).  The rotorly control dial on the back is not at all user friendly, being in a location where your finger will accidentally rotate it.  I expected much more from this camera, and was quite disappointed.  It was returned the next day after receiving it.  I got better results from my cheap Fujifilm 20X zoom lens camera.  Even got better photos from an older model canon point and shoot camera.  I did not expect it to be "as good as my DSLR camera, but did expect it to be better than what it was.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Robert Mougin
Reviews.Content: If you like the picture quality of disposable cameras, you will love this camera.  I have shot hundreds of photos with this, both handheld and on tripod at numerous iso/shutter speed/aperture settings and have yet to get a halfway decent shot.  My Canon SX230 outperforms this camera.  Combine small sensor size with a slow lens and bad programming and you get lousy pics.  The camera is programmed to give you the absolute worst combination of iso aperture and shutter speed for any lighting.  Even setting manually it still does not produce image quality for the length of the lens.  I wanted to use this for taking pictures of birds and wildlife.  Try to get a bird to wait while you fiddle with the settings.  Save yourself some money and either go with a small pocket camera or jump to DSLR.  Wasted $500 including accessories.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50 Powershot
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX50 is a great camera, love the LCD, but it was just too big for me. I just wanted a camera that would fit in my pocketbook.

Reviews.Title: Camera came with a health warning a day later ... not impressed
Reviews.Author: R. Millar "Patrick"
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst experience I have had with Amazon.  I ordered this camera - and before I even received it (2 day shipping) I got an email that told me it was defective.  I now need to return it to Canon so they can fix it - and this of course will be at my time and expense.  Who knows when I will get it back.  Really disappointed with you Amazon and Canon - not impressed at all.  Haven't even had the chance to try the darned thing.Here is some of the text from the recall for others to see:The rubber part of the viewfinder on some PowerShot SX50 HS compact digital cameras produced in certain lots from September 1 through November 15, 2013 may turn white after a short period of time. We have determined after inquiry with the rubber manufacturer and internal analysis that the white substance is zinc bis (N,N’- dimethyldithiocarbamate).... and ...As a precautionary measure, thoroughly wash your hands and rinse your eyes with water if they have come into contact with the rubber part of a viewfinder that has turned white. If any medical symptoms develop, please consult your physician immediately.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment!
Reviews.Author: lynnie
Reviews.Content: The electronic viewfinder was a total disaster.  I have gotten accustomed to using the viewfinder for composing and making the images and the one on this model cannot be used to do so.  It is difficult to use and if speed is essential (wildlife/bird photography) it is too slow to obtain the image.I have already sold the camera!

Reviews.Title: be aware...
Reviews.Author: shelley
Reviews.Content: After owning several Canon point and shoots, I spent a log time reviewing and trying to decide--DSLR vs. a better point and shoot.  Realizing I don't photograph anymore the way I did with my trusty old Minolta fully manual film SLR, and that I missed the Canon S3 IS that my husband stole from me for his own use, and that I just didn't want the expense and weight of DSLR's and lenses for the casual stuff I use a camera for nowadays, I opted for this model based on multiple great reviews from many sites on-line.  I didn't even bother to take a single picture with it when, after charging the battery and firing it up, I realized that Canon had eliminated a bunch of basic choices in its Scene settings.  ie.:  landscape, night landscape, landscape with portrait, beach, foliage, etc.  Now, I realize that turning the dial to Auto is likely to produce the same type of photo that I would have achieved if I had those scene settings to choose from, but I assume they are there for a reason on the older models, and I wasn't happy that they were gone.  I found it disconcerting that they kept fireworks (a setting that will get used once a year) but got rid of landscape, which I bet people use 50% of the time.  I traded the camera in the next week for the Nikon P50.  I like the Canon for the variable angle screen, ease of use, and being one of the companies that still has a viewfinder.

Reviews.Title: A great camera, but will it hold up over time?
Reviews.Author: D. E. Hill "follower of the art of Natural Hi...
Reviews.Content: I have recommended this very versatile camera to several people, because it is a great buy for the 50x features.  I have been able to do nice macro at 50x at a distance of 1.3m with it.  It's hard to use manual focus, and you need to know the custom settings to make this well for your applications.  But, overall a remarkable camera.  The reason for my lower rating here is that my camera suddenly stopped working a few weeks out of the warranty period (black screen), and Canon would not repair it, but offered to sell me a replacement.  This camera was never dropped etc. and was working well until it suddenly stopped.  I recommend that if you want this camera that you buy an extended warranty with it, since repair is apparently not an option.  Be sure to keep all of your paperwork and be ready to send it in for replacement when the time comes.  I've used many digital cameras for years, and this is not the first defect I have encountered, but it is the first time I had one that just stopped displaying what it saw.  The display of pictures already taken and other features, including the zoom motor, still worked, so I assume either a software failure that could not reboot, or more likely a wiring or sensor failure.

Reviews.Title: Maybe just a few too many options
Reviews.Author: P. Jager "pollyanna"
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Holland Tulip festival and Italy.  Loved the results!  But I mostly used it on Auto because I haven't figured out all of the options yet.  I'd like to have more manual control, but it's a big learning curve to remember which setting does what and how many screens do I have to get through to find the setting.  Beyond that, it's light weight, very easy to use in Auto setting, and 99% of shots are clear and great.  Spoiler Alert: if you don't know how to set up or frame a shot you still won't like your pics.  Remember lighting and staging count.  Try to be aware of things like trees growing out of heads :-P

Reviews.Title: Lasted less than a year!
Reviews.Author: CRMom
Reviews.Content: I have bought the new versions of this camera as they've come out and have always bought only cannon cameras. The last two were great, but this model has been different. The zoom is the only real reason to buy, but really the last model with slightly less zoom took much better pictures. Regardless, about a month ago the flash started going off even when closed and would make  a horrible "spark" sound. I have been using settings that do not ever use flash to avoid the problem. But, yesterday the camera froze and stopped working all together. Will try to contact cannon, but I'm out of the US for the next few months and based on reviews here, I'm not hopeful. Looking for a replacement now and seriously thinking itt is time to mahe the switch from cannon after many many years as a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12MP Digital Camera with 2.8-Inch LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: Sassiebabi "Sassiebabi"
Reviews.Content: Returned for replacement.  Lens had a squeak when powering camera on.  Very prompt customer service.  New camera being sent to me within one day.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera with an effective battery life
Reviews.Author: Raymon Saber Narouz
Reviews.Content: Product came as described with no defedcts.The only problem with this camera is the slow autofocus......compared to the fujifilm.

Reviews.Title: Super quality photos!
Reviews.Author: Allen Borcherding
Reviews.Content: The features that attracted me to the Canon PowerShot SX50 HS are perfect (50x optical telephoto, hot shoe, TTL viewfinder); however, I would prefer that the camera did auto-stitching for panoramics (my Motorola Droid cell phone - 8 MP - does!).

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera- A True bridge in between point-and-shoot and DSLR
Reviews.Author: EmiEmc
Reviews.Content: Excellent piece of equipment!Terrible Manual! Go on youtube and find 'fatdragon' and watch her 20 hrs of video on SX40 to understand how to use this camera

Reviews.Title: Great camera battery issues
Reviews.Author: Robert Magner
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived on time but when it was time for pics the battery would not charge had to find n buy a new one adding expense to the overall cost

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Linda LeBrun
Reviews.Content: We ordered this camera for an upcoming trip.  We have much to learn, but so far it seems easy to operate.  They are a couple of functions which are kind of noisey, but I think with time we will get use to the sound

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I received this as promised. I love this camera. You are very quick with your orders and everything is well packed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: rider
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it's now my favorite for day trips to the zoo or beach.  I have a much more expensive camera for birding, but I find it too clunky for normal use.  This camera is lighter and more practical.  It also takes great pictures of birds.  The zoom is phenomenal, but it does lose quite a bit of image quality at the highest settings.

Reviews.Title: It's been week and I love it more each day!
Reviews.Author: Pesh
Reviews.Content: Pros:Love the quality of the photos!Love the zoom!Great deal (price)!Cons:Low-light performance (night time photos) are not bad at all; but not great.The Camera arrived without HDMI and A/V OUT DIGITAL cables. (I wonder if it was a used camera... while I bought as new...)

Reviews.Title: Amazing technology for a point and shoot 'prosumer' camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff Durham
Reviews.Content: Love it. Great 50x optical zoom with software to lock on the target you want to zoom into to. Canon leads the way again.

Reviews.Title: Really Great Camera
Reviews.Author: DrBobGP
Reviews.Content: Though the far range on the tele-zoom is too far to be great, if you defeat the "optical zoom" feature you'll just be amazed...

Reviews.Title: TAKES GREATS PIC'S
Reviews.Author: argus21221
Reviews.Content: WELL I LIKE IT --I AM NOT A PRO OR ANYTHINGBUT THE PICTURES ARE GREATIN FACT EBAY PICTURES ARE TO GOOD --SHOWS DUST DIRT AND ECTWELL WORTH THE MONEY

Reviews.Title: Excelente super zoom
Reviews.Author: Edubuck
Reviews.Content: Esta camera eh uma das melhores compactas que já comprei, tem super zoom otico fantastico.Comparado com as compactas similares, não poderiamos compara la.O manuseio é fácil até mesmo para principiantes e consegui tirar ótimas fotos em movimento, graças ao estabilizador de imagens.Recomendo este produto!!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50
Reviews.Author: fricnfrac
Reviews.Content: I consider this the best all round camera.  The zoom capabilities are fantastic.  It makes unbelievable High Definition Movies.  Love this camera;

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 50x Wide-Angle...
Reviews.Author: Adrian Solomon
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 50x Wide-Angle...  I'm no expert on camera's for sure. I do know this bad boy can shoot great pictures and awesome video. I shake a lot and this thing adjusts itself to make clear, blur free images in both still and video mode. This camera will be getting much use in the very near future so I will update this posting with more concise information. The only issue so far is hand positioning which I'm pretty sure use will solve. LOVE IT !!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX50HS12.1 MP point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Carol E. Keeler
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera on Lillian Stokes recommendation.  It had a length of 24 to 1200mm.  I really wanted the long end.  It is a camera that is small and light so I could easily walk around with it.  While I like it a lot, there are some problems with it.  The controls are very complicated, but there is is no hard copy manual, only a computer disk. it does almost everything a DSLR does including shooting in raw. It has almost no time delay when you push the shutter button.  Many of the great features only work in certain modes, or jpg which was a problem for me.  I shoot in raw, aperture, or shutter priority, so the noise reduction doesn't work.  Images look great on the LCD screen, but when viewed on the computer, there was a lot of noise even at ISO400, with little detail.  The camera comes with a tethered lens cap, but no lens shade so glare could be a problem.  There is an adaptor for the lens front so you can add a lens shade and filters.  The Canon adapters are out of stock everywhere.  I got an off brand one, but it wouldn't go on.  I have enjoyed using the camera, but can't use the pictures for anything serious due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: Good Magnification and Pictures:
Reviews.Author: W. Graburn "Heavy Reader"
Reviews.Content: The magnification is magnificent and I was pleased with the quality of the pictures, mostly taken in daylight. The viewfinder needs to be improved. I'm still getting used to the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Lorraine M. Kerins
Reviews.Content: I took this on a trip to Alaska and didn't have much time to learn about it before I left.  The pictures are fantastic.  Great buy for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Rona Lis
Reviews.Content: i wish it was with Bluetooth.except this - great camera. good picture, easy to handlefor the price. nice

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Oliveira, Neilton
Reviews.Content: It was everything I expected. It's all. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good.

Reviews.Title: TWO THUMBS DOWN - BIG REDESIGN FLAW MOVING VIDEO BUTTON!
Reviews.Author: Patty Alspaugh "Dolce Far Niente"
Reviews.Content: I loved my powershot SX35 IS, but when I saw that the SX50 was a 50x zoom I thought all the better to have more zoom.  Yes, the zoom is good, but Canon switched the location of the damn video button, which I use ALL the time, from the left side of the finger hold to the right side, so that now, not only do I have to re-train my fingers to go to a different location to record videos than they've been going to for more than 10 years with my various Canons, I CAN'T easily hold the camera with one hand and move my thumb from the camera hold to the start video button like I could when the button was towards the center of the camera!  Plus, I am always mistakenly going to the wrong button, thus missing some great video.  And to my further dismay, I find that I accidentally start video recording by mistake because the button is on the edge of the camera, so that I am using up valuable card space for shaky recordings of my lap or my surroundings!  I therefore give the Canon PowerShot SX50 two thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX50 HS select models recalled over allergic reaction possibility
Reviews.Author: Benicio Vanderlei Klement
Reviews.Content: It has been confirmed that the rubber section of the viewfinder on a limited number of units of the PowerShot SX50 HS compact digital camera may change color (turn white) after a short period of time.The rubber section of the viewfinder on a limited number of PowerShot SX50 HS digital compact cameras produced between 1 September and 15 November 2013 may turn white after a short period of time. After investigation and analysis with the rubber manufacturer, we have determined that zinc bis (N,N’-dimethyldithiocarbamate) is the substance that causes the rubber surfaces to turn white (see surfaces in image below).The amount of this substance that has been detected on any individual unit is minimal but in rare cases, depending on individual sensitivity, contact with this substance may cause an allergic skin reaction.[...]

Reviews.Title: Purchase at Your Own Risk (UPDATE)
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift to my wife and I just recently received a "potential safety issue" warning notice on this product. There was a link to the Canon website:[...]From the email link:PhenomenonThe rubber part of the viewfinder on some PowerShot SX50 HS compact digital cameras produced in certain lots from September 1 through November 15, 2013 may turn white after a short period of time. We have determined after inquiry with the rubber manufacturer and internal analysis that the white substance is zinc bis (N,N'- dimethyldithiocarbamate).UPDATE, March 9, 2014:With the above being said, I am raising my rating on this item. The zoom on this thing is just insane!  We just came back from our last visit to Hawaii, and we were shooting freaking whales breaching FROM OUR HOTEL ROOM! I would say they were at least a mile out, maybe 2.I still stand behind my reservations about the manufacturing defect (hence the 4 stars instead of 5), but is it worth the risk? The answer is "Yes, it is!"It did take about a week and a half to get our replacement camera directly from Canon.

Reviews.Title: Didn't get all the accessories I had planned on.

Reviews.Content: The camera doesn't come with a USB cable to transfer the pictures from the camera to a PC.  That was a big downer, but something that wasn't made entirely clear to me when purchasing the camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera

Maybe you need to add a big handed staff for your testing...Otherwise, seems to be a good camera... Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 or 50 + Nikon D3100 best combination !!!
