Reviews.Content: Carry 2 cameras with you, a Canon SX40 or 50 and use it when you need a lot of zoom and for filming. For all around picture taking use the Nikon D3100 with the kit lens (18-55 mm).- This is the best combination, the Nikon D3100 is the smallest DSLR on the market and the quality of the pictures is just amazing!!! Day and night !!! This is what I use and this is what I carry in my Tamrac 3444 rally 5 bag all the time, it's lightweight...SX40/50 are good if you have plenty of light, otherwise the pictures look slightly washed out...fix them in Picasa.

Reviews.Title: fantastic

Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera but the 12MP does not look like 12MP...Photos from my phone with 13MP are manytimes better than this camera....

Reviews.Title: Difficult to use
Reviews.Author: A. H.
Reviews.Content: Placement of buttons may cause the user to accidentally hit one causing the camera to behave in an unexpected manner.  Auto mode is pretty much useless.  Auto-focus does a poor job.  The camera will not focus rapidly enough to catch fast moving images.Sorry I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Poor viewfinder
Reviews.Author: kirkcGuire
Reviews.Content: Can hardly see through the viewfinder to compose your picture. Zoom  tends to sticks when zooming in or zooming out.

Reviews.Title: Not much different than the one before
Reviews.Author: Jeff Freadrich
Reviews.Content: For the money not much if any better, went away fron double AA batteries, still very easy to push buttons on back of camera by mistake and drive you crazy trying to figure which one you touched by mistake, need lock out or 2 second hold to make buttons to work to a get idea.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: canon_in_d
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of it's highly rated reviews and because of the 50x zoom. I previously owned a Fuji HS20EXR bridge camera and it worked very well for me. I used it (Fuji)on a lot of concerts and lakers/clippers games. I also used it on some of our trips and It took a lot of wonderful landscape shots. I am a huge Canon fan and I am on my 2nd Canon SLR camera and I own some pretty decent canon lens. But I really don't get the hype about the SX50. It is very slow to focus, performs poorly in low light conditions and I get a lot of blurry images. I am selling my SX50 and a Fuji HS50EXR is already on its way. I still love Canon but will definitely stay away from its SX bridge camera series.

Reviews.Title: Canon does not support even simple repairs of this camera - don't risk it - look for another brand that cares about consumers
Reviews.Author: R. Hunter
Reviews.Content: Canon is out for only the almighty buck and tries to screw its customers to make a few extra shillings - here's the evidence:A few days over a year after we bought this camera, it was on a tripod and blown over by a gust of wind.  It fell on the grass lens-first and would not power on thereafter.We took it to a local, highly-reputable camera repair where they quickly diagnosed that the "lens gear assembly" was jammed and needed to be replaced, a simple matter for them to do EXCEPT that Canon refused to sell them the replacement part (at any price) and told them we had to send the camera (at our expense of $18 including insurance) to the Factory Service Center for "refurbishment".We did as instructed and received an email telling us the camera could not be repaired and that Canon would sell us a refurbished model for $350.  The brand new camera is available now on this site for $325.  I called to ask if the pricing information was correct that a used camera was being offered to us at higher price than I could pay for a brand new one - the answer was yes, that's how it is.Needless to say, we are looking for non-Canon replacement options and this will be the last Canon product we have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: it's okie
Reviews.Author: Dung Le
Reviews.Content: With the price like that, Canon PowerShot SX50 HS 12MP Digital Camera is the best choice for now. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Was not what was expected from product description
Reviews.Author: Melody M. Worley
Reviews.Content: Expected more ease of use and options.  Would have been helpful to have a regular manual instead of just disc.

Reviews.Title: package details
Reviews.Author: Alok Ranjan
Reviews.Content: The details of package were not very clear and I ended up ordering "GTMax Black Anti-Slip Neoprene Camera shoulder/Neck Strap Belt + Cup Pad for Canon SX50 HS, SX500 IS, G15, 6D, XT XTi XS XSi T1i T2i T3i T3 T4i T5i SL" and "Complete Accessory Kit For Canon PowerShot SX50 HS, SX50HS, SX40 HS SX40HS G1 X G1X, G15 Digital Camera Includes Extended Replacement (1200Mah) NB-10L". Which was a waste a money for me.While using the camera in auto mode, the camera takes photos in sports mode (multiple shots) sometimes.

Reviews.Title: not a good fit for me
Reviews.Author: mimbrava
Reviews.Content: I've been a Canon user for many years and was intrigued by this model's large zoom capability, but I must admit to being flummoxed by the control dial, which I couldn't accurately set even with my tiny hands. Otherwise, the picture quality and the camera's feel in my hands were fine, and those who can work with that dial should be pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Lens retracts if you playback your pictures, (weird feature)
Reviews.Author: D. Perez
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 10 days ago. It has good things, as well as bad things too. However i have decided to return it. After trying it in all differents modes and settings, and after reading the user's manual ( which i had to download because it is NOT included). Please, i would like to mention this: Don't blame me if you LOVE this product and disagree with something i will post here. I am rating this product according to what i found on it, either good or bad. I am giving 2 stars.I like the image quality in low-light, with NO flash. In these conditions camera focused faster than i spected it, despite the annoying AF lamp, which is annoying if you want to shoot a person's face, this wide beam of light will illuminate the whole face. If you turn off this AF lamp ( light) camera may not focus precisely.I bought this camera mainly because its RAW capability, and the hot shoe for an external flash. Well, RAW files are CR2 files rather than RAW, and i couldn't open them with photoshop elements 11, as i did with other  real RAW files.Build in flash doesn't pop up automatically, you need to raise it manually. Flash makes a loud "slapping" sound when fired.Saturacion, and Contrast are not in the main menu, but hidding in a "My colors" sub menu.Aperture is limited from 3.5  to only 8.0Max shutter speed is limited to 1/2000.Poor battery life, about 200 pictures, taken the same day with a full charged battery. Charged the same morning.AWB is awful for portraits, needs to be fine tune reducing the skin tone in "My colors" sub-menu. Or you won't get  a natural looking skin tones.And the most childish feature is the "lens reatract" .  Yes, if you already have some pictures and you want to view them, you switch to playback mode, the lens will retract either inmediately or after 1 minute, it depends on how you set it on the menu. You have no choice, and this is NOT a malfuntion but a ridiculous feature. After the lens retracts, you can still view your pictures, but when you are done, you would have realize tha the camera is actually off. Now you have to turn it back on if you want to take more pictures or play with the menu, or do something else with this camera.This is not fixed by turning off the power saving mode, ( which turns off the camera after certain time of inactivity).This is a different feature.In Manual mode, the camera sets the ISO to 80, if you set the shutter speed, at 1"3. The camera won't let you set a higher ISO.There is NO user manual, NO cables, NO hot shoe cover anymore like the previous sx40.You will love this camera if you like the huge 50x zoom, in addition 4x digital zoom for a total of 200x.

Reviews.Title: Not sharp pictures.
Reviews.Author: Charlene
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera especially for its 1200 mm zoom...but the sensor in the camera can not handle the zoom. The pictures at full zoom are very pixelated, even at 800mm they were pixelated...pictures are not sharp. The camera is also very difficult to use. Canon has opted not to put in the owners manual, but to sell it separate, and believe me, you will need it! It also opted not to include the download cord that you use to download into your computer, it too is sold separately. For the price on this camera and the other items you must buy separate, this is not a good buy at all, and I would not recommend it to anyone. I was very disappointed. I wanted a camera that I could take places I could not take my SLR,  and a 1200 mm lens is about $100,000 and weighs about 40 pounds. No this camera can not give the professional the quality they are looking for, will just have to stay where we can take our heavy equipment, except I won't on a ride down the river on the rafts!! I really wish I did not have to even give it a one star rating! It may be a great movie camera, but then just buy a movie camera as a still shot camera it is very very complicated, and the pictures are not SHARP!

Reviews.Title: poor desighn
Reviews.Author: Daniel Waldorf
Reviews.Content: cant hold camera and take a pic without accidently hitting lots of other functions you dont want. especially the time which makes it real hard to get the shot you want. also still havent figured out how to down load pics to computer, have the rigt cords ad have loaded the software. MAJOR dissapointment

Reviews.Title: It appears to be a great camera.
Reviews.Author: bill l
Reviews.Content: I say appears because I haven't used it a lot so far. However, the zoom is phenomenal. The pictures are sharp. And it's easy to use.

Reviews.Title: I don't like this camera
Reviews.Author: Ann S. Prather Speck
Reviews.Content: I have several other very nice Canon Cameras-they are wonderful. The shutter speed on each is fast and I hardly ever miss a picture, but with this camera, the shutter is slow and I miss many great pictures. I HATE IT and wish a million times I hadn't purchased this camera. The zoom is really nice and that is about all there is to it. I just don't like it. I was and had been wanting a smaller nice camera that wasn't large in size that would take excellent fast picture. A few pictuers do turn out nice, but just every  once in a while. I wish I had purchased another brand. Too late now and I am stuck with it, which looks nice sitting on the shelf.

Reviews.Title: Larger than I expected
Reviews.Author: Funstepper
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I ordered this camera thinking it was a lot smaller than it actually was.  I was looking for something small to fit in my purse.  This camera was almost the same size as my Canon digital SLR camera with the 55 mm. lens.  It might be a good camera for someone who wanted a camera that has a good telephoto plus a wide angle without carrying a couple of lenses.

Reviews.Title: Zoom seems useless...
Reviews.Author: Joe Buyer "Joe"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because of the zoom, as most would.  I wanted a camera to carry with me on walks, and can't afford a huge zoom for my dslr.  I had the Panasonic that was one of the "big" zooms--I think it was 10 or 12x--and I loved it until it died.  The reviews led me to believe the quality of htis is as good as the Panasonic, but it doesn't appear to be.  I am really unimpressed, and went to return it immediately, only to find out that I have to pay for the shipping, and it will take a couple of weeks for my refund.  I am an Amazon Prime member--you'd think they'd at least pay for the shipping.  Next time I'll buy locally.  It's impossible to tell from online images what an actual photo will look like, and I need enlargement quality.  It's possible that the particular camera I received was damaged--the box was dinged up and there was very little inside padding--the camera was pretty loose in the box...but I have no way of knowing that.

Reviews.Title: SX40 or SX50 ??? ,  Near Fatal Flaw ???
Reviews.Author: Victoria "Vikki K."
Reviews.Content: Superzooms.  Incredible zoom at an incredible price.  But what is real cost?  50x zoom --- is this really needed?  (Don't forget the ability to crop.)  Not by many.  Indeed, Canon opted for zoom at the expense of lens speed.  That is, the already zoom far enough for near anyone SX40 (about 35x) has a faster lens (check it out).  Comparing the two cameras the SX40 seems to shoot better indoors, too (not as dark).  On the other hand, this camera is a bit smaller and more elegant.  It is also very fast to zoom and can do about 10fps under certain conditions.  It has RAW --- anyone really going to use that on this?Near fatal flaw --- terrible viewfinder (I believe 202,000 pixels) --- would, say, 600,000 pixels have cost too much?  Almost useless and needed if one is super-zooming (less blur when held to nose rather than using the smallish LCD.  The noonday winter (much less later in the day winter sun) ruins shots and is unpleasant to use.  This price cutting (I'm assuming it is not a size issue) is  annoying and silly on such a camera --- charge $20 more.  As a comparison my Nikon D5100 (a DSLR) has an easy to read viewfinder in the same sunlight.  My venerable FZ35 even has a better viewfinder !!!  Get some dough ready for a new tripod :-).Very good for pics on a sunny day (especially in the summer) --- surprisingly sharp --- the IQ is great.  Indoor pics much harder.Will try and update to see if this camera warrants 4 stars (and is better than the SX40).Too bad they did not keep the prior lens and let us enjoy the relative speediness of this lens.  I mean, 35x is good enough for me, and I don't need bragging rights.The FZ200 is probably the one to get --- less zoom, better video, great lens (2.8 at any zoom) and more pixels in the viewfinder.  If the same price, I would have obtained the FZ200.UPDATE:It's close but I'm upgrading this to 4 stars.  Compared to the Nikon P500, it seems much better.  The P500 has trouble focusing at full zoom, a smaller battery, and, of course, a smaller zoom range (20x - 40x is enough for me).  The SX50 is better than the P500 indoors and out and with more use, I believe it is overall better than the SX40.  IS seems a bit better, the LCD seems a bit better, and so on.  IQ, with practice, better than expected.  No, it is not a D5100 or even a G15 in terms of IQ, but that's to be expected.Four stars is still a bit difficult.  It's priced at about $399 while the D3100 with a good kit lens is about $499.  Better value:  D3100 in my opinion.  Also, that viewfinder remains terrible (the same one is found on the SX40).  Of course, the D3100 has a much better one.  But even the FZ200 megazoom has a much better one with more than 1 million pixels.  Try these three out and, perhaps, the G15 and it's fast lens.

Reviews.Title: Truth about the zooms
Reviews.Author: terry harvey
Reviews.Content: I recently went to target and tried the Sony Hz200 and the Panasonic fz 70 and canon SX 50 all next to each other Panasonic said it had a 300 times digital zoom but there 300 is the equal to canons 200 times digital zoom  Sony had an eight hundred times zoom and it was much much further but everything looks like a Bigfoot in the woods. Also once a got home I took a picture with my 70-300 lens at 300mm and it is equal to 500mm on the canon sx50 not a big deal just fyi. I chose the canon SX 50 I think it took the best pictures not as easy to use as my Canon 40d or rebel and the pictures aren't as good but they are still decent and what we are all here for the 1200mm lens.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera upgrade
Reviews.Author: Durango
Reviews.Content: I use a camera in my profession, I previous had a Cannon PS5SX  which was a good camera  good clear pictures with great color balance easy to use software, and hence my next camara was a "cannon"  also SX50HS, my first disappointment was the software it used the same easy to use software as previous however its now covered up with a fancy front and make many more steps to do what was once easy.The camera is junk I will be selling it and happy to sell for half price, horrible in balanced colors grainy photos,  control are not as easy to use the rotating disk finger keeps slipping off, camera is also in balanced and not as easy to hold, lens is oversized, horrible downgrade and expensive mistake..

Reviews.Title: Most Frustrating Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: BusyWife&Mom;
Reviews.Content: The "manual" it comes with is a joke, offers NO help whatsoever on the settings, which you'll be forced to spend hours looking for online in order to actually use this piece of crap.Despite turning OFF face tracking and Subject Tracking it still focuses on 1 area of the screen (bottom left, top right, bottom middle)- Literally EVERYTHING Except the CENTER OF the dat gum screen!!!) and then when you take the photo, your subject is Out of focus and the background/sides are in focus.Basically, if you're buying this camera for scenery shots it's great. If you're buying it to photograph kids, bugs, wildlife, anything with a pulse, forget it- run the other direction because you'll spend more time deleting crap photos than you will getting shots you can use. I took 38 photos on Auto of my kids playing with a lion cub, literally only ONE came out usable.HATE HATE HATE this Piece of Crap, but unfortunately, dh threw out the box. He should've kept the box and threw out the damn camera! Thank God I still have my SLR to rely on.

Reviews.Title: Great, with some drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Chosenbygrace Notworks "eternian.wordpress.c0m"
Reviews.Content: I hate pretention, so I'm going to make this simple:Pros:1) MUCH better than any digital camera I've ever used. The closest comparable ones were a Nikon P40? with 40 or 45x zoom, which was horrible and a Fuji that could get 30x. The Fuji was mediocre but could pull off some nice photos and could get pretty clear shots of planes very high in the sky without a hellish amount of blurred shots. It wasn't great for long distance for some reason when it came to people and scenery, but just a little above okay so that it was website worthy. I only used the Nikon one for a few minutes, I left a review for it, but since amazon has repeatedly banned me my accounts are fragmented and it skews how my review habit actually is and my score (and they relentlessly spam me and use my affiliate links anyways, very honorable of them huh - banned for "an extraordinary amount of refunds" by the way, read the boycott I made on boycottowl.c0m for more on that extraordinary claim). Anyways.2) Excellent zoom and resolution. Ironically this was nearly the reverse of the Fuji, even with 20x more zoom far away pictures of planes are blurry, then again the sun was nearly down and I only got a few shots, most of which were blurred. I used it on people that were far away and the blurring was minimal and I could see their faces clearly unlike with the Fuji which at it's best could only pull off muddyish features at 30x, and just about useless at night.3) Night video was very useable and much much better than any other camera I've used to record night video except this Sanyo cam that you hold like a gun, I forget, which could amplify light tremendously, especially for photos at the cost of making everything appear to be golden and muddy and grainy. But the Canon had no such muddy or grainyness, but as I said, I couldn't force it to up the ISO. Maybe messing with the exposure would have done something but I haven't tried it yet as it's not the easiest control system.4) It seems to have a level so you can know if the camera is parallel with the ground/horizon or not, cool! I was actually wondering why no camera had a physical level like the kinds that have a bubble in them.Negatives:1) I can't figure out how to adjust the iso on video, there appears to be no way to change it.2) No manual focus control, which isn 99.99 percent of the case with all point and shoot cams.3) I found the control ring confusing as it not only allows manipulation through the use of a dial ring, but the usual cross way button pressing. At one point when I switched to manual and macro and got the iso where I wanted, the screen kept turning white, so I was forced to switch modes and found messing with the exposure put a stop to that. For some reason in macro mode on manual I couldn't change the exposure significantly, and at one point told me I could do such and such because the shutter speed was too slow (I'm less than an photo amateur so I didn't understand what that meant, and yes, I've heard of F stop, and don't bother telling me I don't want lessons through amazon comments.)4) What little I used of the the dynamic range, and it was only a little, didn't look impressive to me and you had to keep the camera very still. This in contrast to some new Panasonic point and shoot cam (which was terrible) which came out with an amazing HDR photo when I wasn't even intending it and not exactly keeping the camera still, though I was sitting down unlike when I was using the SX50 for HDR. I was bending over and pointing it close up at a rock, and it made some sort of shaking camera symbol on the bottom and in the middle indicating to not shake the camera. I couldn't see any way to turn the anti-shake on.5) The lens already has a faint scratch on it, about half a quarter of an inch maybe, as far as I know I've not scratched it with a rock, the only thing that would have done that is an incredibly small grain in the form of dust. Sucks.I didn't read the manual and don't want to, I hate reading white and black manuals, hate it.

Reviews.Title: Returned.
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: Was not happy with the zoom, did not surpass my Nikon Coolpix P51 with a 42 time zoom.  Too bad, I had high hopes for it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed image quality.
Reviews.Author: JohnQ
Reviews.Content: I was excited to buy big zoom camera from Canon.I own Cannon T3i with many lenes.but this camera is junk,Image quality is very bad (at low light or bright light), the faking 1200mm zoom (25mm equivalent) - the real zoom should be around 500mm compare with my DSLR lens on T3i.also my new camera LCD screen has two bright pixels.the only good thing might be slow motion video recording.All others are very disappointed.the very failed camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in Canon
Reviews.Author: C. Baber
Reviews.Content: I waited a long time to purchase a new camera.  I bought this one several months ago before a trip to The Grand Teton Mountains followed by several days in Yellowstone.  It wasn't until I printed some of my 2,000+ pictures that i realized something was very wrong.  I emailed the online support and found that my camera was set on an aspect ratio of 1:1 instead of 3:4.  This is certainly something I had never heard of before.  My pictures are all square, so I have to chose to have them printed either horizontally or vertically.  I lose either way.  This has been very upsetting to me, especially with these once in a lifetime pictures.  I just got off of the phone with a Canon representative.  He accepts absolutely no blame for this from the factory.  He told me that someone must have taken the camera out at some point and played with it.  I asked him if he meant someone at Amazon did this, and of course he said he had no idea.  He even told me that I could special order prints which even made me more angry since I can't even imagine that cost.  I have always bought Canon products, but this is really leaving a sour taste for the company.

Reviews.Title: too complicated for 80 years old.
Reviews.Author: Helen L. Dixon
Reviews.Content: Cant get action shots.  Also I  cant use a tripod on an exotic animal farm when my animals are moving.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT LOAD ACCOMPANYING SOFTWARE / RECALL TOO!
Reviews.Author: JJs Mom
Reviews.Content: Over 10 additional extraneous and annoying programs were loaded - these have significantly impacted my PCs operation with all the annoying pop-ups.  Lesson learned.ALSO- just got the "recall" e-mail.  Being told I must pack this up and ship it to a service center for "free " repair.  That doesn't sound "free" or convenient to me.  Canon fails on customer service!

Reviews.Title: I did not do well "out of the box" on this camera
Reviews.Author: Bill A. Belt
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the specks that one can possible desire.  However I just wanted a small camera that I could take to Africa and take some wild animal pictures. The specifications certainly made me think this was the camera. It would be small enough so that not a lot of space would ben necessary and with the zoom lens I could get some close ups of the wild game. Did the camera perform as advertised?First my photos are most disappointing. Thank goodness I took along my Nikon D-90 from which I got some great photos. My photos are not professional quality and more than likely just above candid snap shots.The camera is small and you will immediately notice this once you put it in your hand. If you have large fingers you are going to find the controls rather awkward and even the place where your right thumb fits on the back of the camera is small and my large thumb kept getting in the way and effecting the cameras settings. The zoom in switch is located on the right  at the front of the camera and once again if your fingers are large you may encounter a challenge.The camera has a fixed lens that is advertised as a 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 50X wide angle optical image stabilized zoom. Too often I let the optical portion of the lens go beyond  the optical limits to the digital and that was a total disaster. Even at the 50X mark I found that my pictures were not clear and clean. The lens is fixed therefore you cannot change lens. This is basically the same kind of snap shot camera one buys to slip in one's pocket so you always have a camera handy.  However this camera is too large to slip into your pocket. I think this would make a nice camera for a child as a first camera. It does have a screen on the back which rotates and a viewfinder and viewfinders seem to be a thing of the past unless you go into a higher priced products. I missed some really good big game shots due to using the optical and digital lens Zoom. The photos will be find if I limit my prints to 4 X 6 but trying the enlarge them is a complete disaster.The camera write up claims that you can imagine getting right down on the filed to capture sports action, zeroing in on your child's expression on a crowded stage and recording elusive wildlife shots. It's a good write up but one that certainly did not happen with me. If one would take the time and put this camera on a  tripod and then use appropriate filters you can more than likely get some good shots in what I would call a mid range area. Just don't do like I did and try to capture moving shots at 100 yards. That tri-pod will help with the stabilization. If you want to take some close up snapshots then don't worry about the stabilization and shoot away. You will get some really great "snap shots".The image stabilized zoom will actually help stabilize your shot if you don't have the zoom extended too much. Go all the way to 50X and that is another story. The specks refer to a "Zoom Framing Assist" that will help you track your subject even a long distance away. This is true to some extent. Once again don't do like I did and try to extend the zoom too far as that little square will simply move all over the place. Perhaps with a lot of practice you could get this function working better than I did.I am certainly not giving up my Nikon and will stay with inter changeable lens mounts for the future. I will continue to work out the "kinks" I have created and eventually have this camera working like it should.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Only reason I havent given it a 5 star is because I havent had chance to fully try it out.....

Reviews.Title: Broken :(
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: The camera was broken when I got it. The package wasn't protected as it should be. It had only one air bag.

Reviews.Title: Ordered brand new unopened and received used damaged camera from Amazon LLC
Reviews.Author: Melssj5
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera listed as brand new unpackaged. but the camera box seemed to be previosuly openned and camera was broken. Actually I am outside the us. I never have had this kind when buying directly from amazon, so I hope they gave me a solution for this issue. If amazon give me a solution I will change this review.Update at 05/Mar/2013I received the new camera, Amazon has an excelent customer support, but it took about an extra month in order to ship it to my country.I oppened the new camera box(scared) and noticed that this camera have a clicking sound inside when moving it, but luckily this is not brokem. I took several pictures inside my office.I must say i was expecting much more from it. Summarizing:PROS:  very fast for taking and saving pics  large zoom for distant objects  nice autofocus while zooming(not amazing but nice)  amazing super macro while zoomed outCONS:  very small view finder  Cant focus super macro when zoomed(My prev Fuji could at full zoom)  Feels and look very fragile  Colors in the camera are true color but when watching the pics taken on the PC, the color is not the same  cant really atach lenses or filtersOverall its a good camera, but I would have bought another Fuji.

Reviews.Title: Bad buy
Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: The photos are not very good quality.  My old kodak is just as good.  I went to return this camera, but was 2 days past the return date when I went to print out the return slip.  Very disappointed there was no way to even try to return it, no way to contact seller after the 30 days.

Reviews.Title: Has dust spots in the lens
Reviews.Author: Gagan
Reviews.Content: Took some pictures during night time, my flash was on & the image came back with dust spots on it.Looking at the lens doesn't reveal any dust particles, seems like a defective piece to me.Also there are no controls for flash what so ever, I couldn't force the flash to remain turned on during the night time.It's all auto controlled, really frustrating. I wish I had known about this before.

Reviews.Title: No cable included
Reviews.Author: bigdogmom
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera as a gift. It's probably a great camera but it comes with a Cd to install the software but doesn't include the cable to attach the camera to your computer to be the basic installation. Have to buy that separate. Bad business Canon. It's going back.

Reviews.Title: Canon & Amazon- Bad Business Practice
Reviews.Author: M. Cook "beefmaster"
Reviews.Content: Am I wrong to expect the camera to come with all components needed to take a photo, and SEE the photo as well?The camera arrived without a memory card or special cable(s), two items necessary to take and view a photo!This is bad business, and it is now a mistake for me to have made this purchase because I'm leaving on a trip and can't wait for another mail shipment. I won't be able to buy a memory card or cable where I'm going and now I won't be able to use the camera for my trip.Thanks Canon! Thanks Amazon!!What college graduate thought this was a good idea?I'll go to Best Buy from now on for my electronics.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot SX50 HS
Reviews.Author: S. Fassett
Reviews.Content: Ok really a camera for almost $400 dollars and no USB cord? what's up with that! Really folks giving this camera all the praise for what? Just because it is the most powerful zoom lense for point and shot camera on the market. It can take a clear detailed focused picture of a knats ass at 100 yards. Has a super powerful processor with Canons latest technology same used in higher end canon DSLR camera's quick autofocus through out the zoom lenses range. Great low light abilities unless you want to stay up all night taking a long exposure shot of the moon. Raw format available too. Made in Japan hello! This is really a great camera!!!. The one star is only because no USB cord is supplied with camera kit. You can take professional photos with this camera but It don't do you any good if you kan't download it to your computer or printer.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but no cord to connect to computer?
Reviews.Author: Liz H. Kelly
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, but why is Canon no longer including a cord to connect the camera to your computer? I called Amazon and they confirmed that this camera no longer comes with the camera. Luckily, I have an old cord that I can use. What's up with that change Canon?
